story:
A Drop In The Ocean is a film about the seven seas but really it’s about the seven billion of us. We are all little drops in the ocean. So how good would it be if we all added our individual drops to an ocean of change? What could we achieve together?

Well … we think we can change the world – and that’s why we’re here. And now, we’re ready for you to become the heroes of our film.

Remember how An Inconvenient Truth brought eco awareness to the mainstream? Our film will be the next chapter – the story of you and how you helped to change the world.  

Does it really make sense for us to keep hoping for enlightened leaders or praying for tech miracles to save us, when really we are perfectly capable of saving ourselves? We are 99.99% of the population and around 70% of the economy. So, who has the power?

Sure, we could wait for CNN or Fox News to tell us what to do – or we could show them that we’ve already made our minds up. That we have taken back our power. That the future is in good hands. Ours.

Welcome to our crowdfund page – and thanks for taking the time to check us out. Ever since we began A Drop In The Ocean in our hometown of Melbourne, Australia back in 2014, we have been reaching out to folks just like you all around the world. The response from individuals, companies and NGOs has been fantastic – but now it’s time to take things to the next level.

 

Why are we doing this?

Behind the logo, the online community and the viral videos is a team of real people leading real lives – parents, business operators, students, people who pay rent, visit supermarkets and drive cars. (Just like you.) For us ‘the environment’ is more than just scary news and big problems. For better or worse, it’s something we all contribute to – not just by making films but with our everyday actions.

That’s why we decided to use our combined expertise to do something more useful than just worrying and talking. We asked ourselves – what can we do to inspire people to take positive action on the environment? The answer was obvious. Do it ourselves and inspire others to join in.

 

About the film.

A Drop In The Ocean highlights three potentially catastrophic impacts of human activity on the oceans and ultimately our health:

  • Plastics – we dumped 8 MILLION TONNES of it in the ocean last year alone
  • Pesticides – agricultural run-off ends up in rivers and coastal waters
  • Over-consumption – no fish in the sea by 2050?

As a response to this potentially deadly trio, our film will focus on three achievable fixes:

  • Hemp – the ultimate, easy to grow natural fibre, used for over 12 000 years 
  • Organic agriculture – no GMOs, no or low pesticide farming, permaculture
  • Smart shopping – the power of your pennies to the change the world

By linking what we do on land (agriculture & consumption) to what happens in the oceans (fishery depletion & pollution) and then back to us again (food sources & climate change), we will join the dots between the way we live and the impact we’re having on the planet.

However, A Drop In The Ocean isn’t about big scale politics or marching in the streets, it’s about what each of us does every single day. In other words, green action through what we do and buy – at home, at work, at play. This film is the story of how all of our small change can create big change.

 

What use is another film?

It’s a good question. However, in a world where action on climate and the environment is moving too slowly, it’s time for all of us to step up.

And this is where A Drop In The Ocean comes in. Film is the most compelling storytelling medium we have ever created. When combined with the power and reach of the internet and social media we can now directly access millions of people around the world, many of whom are hungry for our film’s positive message.

By making this film we can encourage others to take action in their everyday lives and to inspire their friends to do the same. Our goal is to use the medium of film to create a spark. It’s up to you to light the fire.

 

How you can help?

Shining a spotlight on the critical environmental issues affecting us all requires passion, commitment and funding.

We need your help to continue, not just with the film but with our broader objective of changing the world. In fact, you are the linchpin of everything we’re about.

To add your drop the ocean you can:

  • Contribute to the crowdfund on this site.
  • Encourage your friends to do the same by sharing this page
  • Share our crowdfund video by clicking here
  • Like our Facebook page and share our posts by clicking here

Basically, anything you can do to help us get our message out there will serve a purpose – and we thank you for your support.

 

What will we do with the funds we raise?

By raising $200,000 (USD) we will be able to proceed to the next, vital stage of production – to begin shooting A Drop In The Ocean here in our home city (Melbourne), at other locations in our home state of Victoria and at locations around Australia’s vast coastline (including the World Heritage listed and endangered Great Barrier Reef).

Should we raise $300 000 (USD) we will be able to proceed to the planned international phase of production, including interviews with global green advocates and shoots at key locations.

Should we raise $500,000 (USD) we will be able to complete the film (including post-production), meaning that A Drop In The Ocean will be a 100% independent, grassroots funded film.   

 

How will we give back?

A Drop In The Ocean has formed an alliance with the Banksia Foundation, an NGO here in Australia that honours positive green action by handing out our country’s highest profile environmental awards and educating the community and business about sustainability.

After we’ve done paying our production bills, we’ll donate 25% of any profit we make to the Banksia Foundation so that they can keep pushing the environmental envelope across the boardroom tables of big business and government and send our message loud and clear to key decision makers.    

Link: www.banksiafdn.com

story:
This is the first home in our Kresge funded grant project. We will make 120 homes green, safe and healthy over the next 3 years.

We need your help. We have about $1500 to put in each of these homes. We need donations of labor, supplies and dollars to add to each of these homes.


We are also seeking donations of labor and supplies. If you are able to donate these please contact nicole@omahahealthykids.org

We are also seeking donations of labor and supplies. If you are able to donate these please contact nicole@omahahealthykids.org

story:
Our Story  (Climate Change- From Sea Birds to Polar Bears)

The film follows the story of one man, one island and 40 years of dedication as he returns to the same Arctic outpost to study the area's wildlife.

As much of the Arctic is now ice free in the summer, what started out as a sea bird project has evolved. Cooper Island has now become a refuge for the Arctic's most charismatic inhabitant, the polar bear. As a consequence of this change, biologist Dr George Divoky's research has grown into a dramatic study of climate change in the polar regions. It is an indicator of the problems now facing the entire of the planet.

Much of the film is already shot and this campaign is being run to help fund the completion of the project through editing and the building of a website to host the film. It would be available free of charge and provide a great educational resource to anyone.

The Impact  (Help spread the word)

Climate change is perhaps the biggest challenge facing our planet. Not only does it impact wildlife, but as weather becomes more extreme and unpredictable, it has already begun to have dramatic consequences for people across the world as devastating floods, drought, storms and wildfires become more common. It poses huge challenges for food production, safety and political instability.

Although scientists from around the world have strong evidence that the process is well underway and that we need to change our living habits to save the planet, there are many people that still don't understand what is happening to the world's climate. As a consequence they have not joined the movement for change. This compelling story is a great vehicle to help spread the word to a wider audience and to make people care enough to want to make a difference.

The Help We Need

The film's producers, biologist George Divoky, Friends of Cooper Island and others that have assisted by providing over $30,000 in production costs and enabled the team to already shoot most of the film. We need your help to complete the editing and delivery of the project.

We are hoping to raise a minimum of $8,000 to finish the film and present it on its own website. Our donors will recieve a range of perks from a DVD of the film to being able to spend time with the filmmaker (David Wright) in Maine to discuss the project and have a personalized day of tuition in documentary film making.

David is an award winning documentary filmmaker specializing in wildlife and environmental stories. He has particular interest in the Arctic and is responsible for producing the Emmy awards winning National Geographic film "Realm of the Great White Bear", following the first year of life of a polar bear.  He first met George Divoky while shooting a story for the new BBC / Discovery series 'Frozen Planet'.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help to spread the word about this project, you will be assisting to us provide a free educational resource that is both a compelling story and a very effective way of educating the public about climate change.

story:
Great news! A local commercial AC company has donated the equipment and labor to repair the library’s stolen HVAC system, and is including an alarm to alert staff to any tampering! Nevertheless, the William Leonard Public Library is woefully underfunded and, as Mrs. Coatney told me, “operates on a shoestring,” so whatever we raise will still be donated to assist with whatever needs are most immediate. Thanks for your generosity and support!

Robbins Needs Help!

The William Leonard Public Library, in Robbins, Illinois, is a small community library serving a financially disadvantaged community just south of Chicago.  Recently, the library's AC unit was dismantled and stolen from the roof of the building at the height of a crippling heat wave. The library has been struggling due to a declining tax base in the community - the staff hasn't taken raises in years - and provides essential services to their patrons, including:

  • Children's summer programming
  • A literacy and training center
  • Community gathering place - especially for those who don't have AC in their own homes!

The William Leonard Public Library in Robbins provides essential services to a community that needs them, but they cannot operate without adequate cooling to make the building safe and habitable for all. Let's give back and use the power of crowdsourcing and caring to fund the AC unit they so desperately need!

The Challenge is On!

Because of the urgency of the need, this fundraiser is _extremely_ short: only 15 days!

  • The quote for repairing the AC unit is $10,000. This is a ceiling-style HVAC unit.
  • With fees for credit card processing and other associated fees, we've added a $2,000 buffer.
  • By providing the Robbins Library with the money to repair the unit, we hope to save summer for the kids and community who rely on it!
  • Anything extra will go to the Robbins Library for needed services, programs and improvements!

Help Save Summer for Robbins!

Many of us can think back to a hot summer day relieved by the cool of the local public library, experiencing the fun of kids programming or working toward a goal in a summer reading challenge.

Those of you who are associated with librarianship know the importance of a library as a community center and a lifeline - a literacy and job center, a community information center, a center of learning and activity for kids and young adults, a gathering place for seniors. The library is one of the few places left in our country that is truly for all. And yet libraries, which frequently rely on local property taxes, are often the first to suffer from lack of funding.

Let's give generously to this project in whatever amount we can and underscore the importance we ascribe to local public libraries. Let's help save summer for Robbins!

Who Am I?

I am a graduate student in Library and Information Sciences at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. More importantly, I am a lifelong library patron and lover and recall with fondness my own summer days at my local library as a child. I was inspired to start this campaign and share it with friends after I posted the news story and my friends and I decided we wanted to help.  We figured, if we wanted to help, we thought you might want to, too.

Learn More

The story of William Leonard Public Library, Robbins and the HVAC unit theft was reported today in the Chicago Sun-Times. You can click here to read the story! Also view a video and interview with Library Director Priscilla Coatney, from the Chicago Tribune.

  • Please share this story and this campaign widely, through your social networks!
  • Any contribution helps!
  • Please act quickly! The summer heat is raging and we're keeping the campaign short to reflect this! Robbins needs our help today!

Thank you!

story:
This Could be your New Public Land!


White Horse Mountain is a 1,700 acre forested mountain in Hampshire County, WV. It is the last remnant of what was once tens of thousands of acres of former timber company land - much of it public access. These timber lands have been systematically sold off as residential subdivisions, degrading the local character, wildlife habitat and water quality of this rural region. White Horse was also purchased by a developer but the housing crash has forced them to place the property back on the market, providing us a rare opportunity to protect this land and return it to public access - forever.
 

Potomac Conservancy has negotiated an option to purchase the mountain but we must raise more than $3 million to make it happen. If we are able to exercise our option by the end of March, we can purchase the property and transfer it to the WV Division of Natural Resources (DNR) to become the State's newest public Wildlife Management Area. This land, rather than divided into 70 residential lots as proposed by the current owner, will instead be opened to the public for hunting, hiking, wildlife viewing and other enjoyment. 

         Their Plan - Private Subdivision          Our Plan - Public Conservation Land

What We Need & What You Get

We have already raised more than half of the needed funds to purchase the land and have arranged for a loan to finance the remainder. We have a goal of bringing at least $600,000 in cash to the April, 2015 closing - 94% of which we have already secured. You can help us raise the remaining $35,000 to take us across the finish line. We are also pleased to say that a local family foundation matched the first $20,000 of donations dollar for dollar AND another generous supporter pledged an additional $4,000 challenge on April 13.   

White Horse Mountain Fundraising To-Date ($3.2M goal)

Any funds raised beyond the immediate cash-in-hand goal of $35,000 additional dollars will go directly toward filling the remaining $350,000 funding gap (dark blue above). We don't need these 'extra' funds to close - that's what the loan is for! But they will allow us to take a smaller loan and help ensure that we can quickly transfer the property to the DNR and get it into your hands to enjoy.

The Perks!

With your support, we can purchase this important land and return it to public access. If that's not perk enough, you can also feel good knowing that you have personally helped to protect drinking water for the nearly 6 million people who draw their water from the Potomac River and ensured that 1700 acres of forested land continues to provide critical habitat for wildlife. That being said, we have a few special things we'd like to offer in addition to the warm fuzzies:

$25 - Be personally recognized for your contribution on social media. We'll also send you a cool Potomac Conservancy sticker;

$100 - Get this stylish Potomac Conservancy t-shirt!

$500-$999 - Get one of REI's award winning lightweight Flash 18 Pack and take it along on a day trip to explore the new Wildlife Management Area! 

$1000-$1500 - Check out the wildlife and amazing views from White Horse with this new pair of 10 X 25 waterproof binoculars from our friends at REI. Only two available so act fast!


$1500 -  Your name will be added to a plaque that is prominently displayed at the entrance to the new Wildlife Management Area, forever honoring your contribution to this project.

The Impact

This project will have lasting impact on a number of levels:

Public Access - the new Wildlife Management Area will be open for you, the public, to enjoy forever. Less than a 3 hour drive from the Washington DC Metro area, this project will create a new public space in a landscape with dwindling opportunities for new conservation lands of this size. 

Supporting Private Landowners - Several private landowners adjoining or near White Horse are interested in protecting their working forest lands to contribute to this conservation hub. They can only do so if funds are available to purchase conservation easements on their land. Potomac Conservancy is helping these landowners (in blue below) apply for land protection funds on more than 3,000 additional acres of land by leveraging the protection of White Horse Mountain.  

Water Quality - protecting our forested headwaters is one of the easiest ways to maintain high quality drinking water downstream. Carving up forests into subdivisions increases the risk of pollution from septic leaching, erosion and toxics. White Horse also protects key ground water recharge zones, which supply the nearby town of Springfield with its drinking water via a spring just off the property.

Wildlife Habitat - the mountain contains hundreds of acres of unique forest glade and northern hemlock habitats as well as ten miles of headwater streams and numerous springs that provide unique habitats for an array of local wildlife.  

Rural Culture - Hampshire County, WV is rural with a strong natural resource-based economy - mainly forestry, farming and outdoor recreation. Their culture and economy depends, quite literally, on maintaining this rural landscape and the White Horse project contributes directly to this goal.

Risks & Challenges

This is the largest land protection project we have ever undertaken and the first time we have ever attempted to raise what equates to more than twice our operating budget for a single land purchase. That being said, we have been so impressed with the support and enthusiasm we have received around this project and feel confident that we will be able to make it happen.

We have already overcome many of the challenges of embarking on this ambitious campaign - we have raised more than $1.6 million, secured a $2.3 million loan and lined up interest from WV DNR to accept and manage the land. However, the project is far from being a done deal and we must still identify at least $350,000 of funds beyond the cash in hand at closing. If we are unable to raise these funds and repay the loan, it is possible that we would have to sell a portion of the property to recoup our costs. However, we believe this is a highly unlikely scenario. We have three years to raise these funds and given our success in fundraising for this project to date ($1.6 million in just nine short months), we feel confident that we have the right team in place to achieve this goal.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute financially to this project, you can still help us get to our goal. Share this campaign website with your friends, family and social networks! The more broadly it spreads, the more support we can generate to save this mountain! Learn more about the project at:

    http://potomac.org/whitehorse

    This campaign was generously support through a grant from the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation

The Perks!
 With your support, we can purchase this important land and return it to public access. If that's not perk enough, you can also feel good knowing that you have personally helped to protect drinking water for the nearly 6 million people who draw their water from the Potomac River and ensured that 1700 acres of forested land continues to provide critical habitat for wildlife. That being said, we have a few special things we'd like to offer in addition to the warm fuzzies:$25 - Be personally recognized for your contribution on social media. We'll also send you a cool Potomac Conservancy sticker;$100 - Get this stylish Potomac Conservancy t-shirt!


$500-$999 - Get one of REI's award winning lightweight Flash 18 Pack and take it along on a day trip to explore the new Wildlife Management Area! 

$1000-$1500 - Check out the wildlife and amazing views from White Horse with this new pair of 10 X 25 waterproof binoculars from our friends at REI. Only two available so act fast!

$1500 -  Your name will be added to a plaque that is prominently displayed at the
 entrance to the new Wildlife Management Area, forever honoring your 
contribution to this project.    The Impact This project will have lasting impact on a number of levels:
 Public Access - the new Wildlife Management Area will be open for you, the public, to enjoy forever. Less than a 3 hour drive from the Washington DC Metro area, this project will create a new public space in a landscape with dwindling opportunities for new conservation lands of this size. 
Supporting Private Landowners - Several private landowners 
adjoining or near White Horse are interested in protecting their working
 forest lands to contribute to this conservation hub. They can only do 
so if funds are available to purchase conservation easements on their 
land. Potomac Conservancy is helping these landowners (in blue below) apply for land 
protection funds on more than 3,000 additional acres of land by 
leveraging the protection of White Horse Mountain.  


Water Quality - protecting our forested headwaters is one of the 
easiest ways to maintain high quality drinking water downstream. Carving
 up forests into subdivisions increases the risk of pollution from
 septic leaching, erosion and toxics. White Horse also protects key ground water recharge zones, which supply the nearby town of Springfield with its drinking water via a spring just off the property. Wildlife Habitat - the mountain contains hundreds of acres of unique forest glade and northern hemlock habitats as well as ten miles of headwater streams and numerous springs that provide unique habitats for an array of local wildlife.  


Rural Culture - Hampshire County, WV is rural with a strong natural resource-based economy - mainly forestry, farming and outdoor recreation. Their culture and economy depends, quite literally, on maintaining this rural landscape and the White Horse project contributes directly to this goal. 
  Risks & Challenges  This is the largest land protection project we have ever undertaken and the first time we have ever attempted to raise what equates to more than twice our operating budget for a single land purchase. That being said, we have been so impressed with the support and enthusiasm we have received around this project and feel confident that we will be able to make it happen. 
We have already overcome many of the challenges of embarking on this ambitious campaign - we have raised more than $1.6 million, secured a $2.3 million loan and lined up interest from WV DNR to accept and manage the land. However, the project is far from being a done deal and we must still identify at least $350,000 of funds beyond the cash in hand at closing. If we are unable to raise these funds and repay the loan, it is possible that we would have to sell a portion of the property to recoup our costs. However, we believe this is a highly unlikely scenario. We have three years to raise these funds and given our success in fundraising for this project to date ($1.6 million in just nine short months), we feel confident that we have the right team in place to achieve this goal.     Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially to this project, you can still help us get to our goal. Share this campaign website with your friends, family and social networks! The more broadly it spreads, the more support we can generate to save this mountain! Learn more about the project at:


http://potomac.org/whitehorse

This campaign was generously support through a grant from the National Fish and Wildlife Foundation

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Tony Croasdale and I am the program coordinator for the Cobbs Creek Junior Docent Program. This program is training seven inner-city Philadelphia high school students to serve as naturalists and tour guides for the park. Cobbs Creek Park is a beautiful forested stream corridor in economically depressed West Philadelphia. Of the city's two other stream corridor parks (the major parks of the city) this is the only one without a city funded environmental center, and coincidentally the park surrounded by the lowest income neighborhoods of the three parks. Cobbs Creek Community Environmental Education Center is a non-profit organization founded to fill that void. 


Currently Cobbs Creek Environmental Center has several programs that provide supplementary environmental education to hundreds of Philadelphia students. What the center is lacking is a way to provide ongoing public programs. The Junior Docent program is a way to provide the public with a free and fun environmental education experience while giving these high school students valuable work experience.


The Impact

Currently the program is funded through May 31st and the stipends to pay the students for their guide services in earmarked for the summer, however after May 31st there are no funds to pay for personnel to open and staff  the center and supervise the students and ensure their safety while conducting the tours. Also, there is currently no funding to promote this program. The Junior docents have been training since November and while they will receive their training stipends it looks like they may not be actually get to be paid to lead the tours they worked so hard to prepare for. This program provides an invaluable resource to the community. On our first public nature walk in November 28 people attended! 


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $5,000 to pay for staff to keep the environmental center open to the public and to supervise the docents during June, July and August. This will be a salary of $15.00 per hour for ten hours a week. The balance will be to pay for promotional materials, add space and binoculars. For a small amount of money dozens of people a week from a low income neighborhood will receive free guided nature walks in a beautiful park. This will enable these high school students who have worked so hard during training to demonstrate their skills to the public and gain valuable paid work experience.


Other Ways You Can Help

Donations of binoculars and nature field guides will be greatly appreciated.

story:
Shark Stanley Needs Your Help!

Shark Stanley and his friends were playing on the reef,
When down came a net that swept them away. 
But at last when they escaped, they saw to their grief, 
Their home had no sharks! Leaving it barren and grey. 

Now Stan and his buddies are searching the ocean 
From Bali to Brazil and Bangladesh to Belize
For friends to stand up and cause a commotion 
Because the world needs sharks to help save the seas!
 

Hi! We're Leah and Onon, two graduate students at the Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies from Shark Defenders, and Dan Yagmin Jr., a Connecticut artist and we're excited to introduce you to Shark Stanley, a charismatic little hammerhead travelling the world to help protect sharks and rays! He's the cornerstone of our grassroots campaign that aims to provide engaging and creative educational tools to mobilize youth support for shark conservation and ensure that our voices are heard on the international stage.

The idea is simple: cut him out, take a photo with him and send it our way! We’ll compile the photos across our social media platforms and make sure that key decision makers internationally see them. As we write this, Shark Stanley has only been live for a week, but already more than three hundred photos from over a thirty countries have sent in their photos! Check out our gallery on indiegogo as well featuring some of our favourites! Here's what else we're planning:

  • To accompany the cut-out, we'll be releasing The Adventures of Shark Stanley and Friends, a children's book and activity booklet to teach kids about the importance of sharks and our oceans. Along with this, we'll be designing and running special kids Shark Stanley workshops at natural history museums and aquariums. 
  • After book, we're going to run a webseries including new Shark Stanley paintings, short stories and comics.
  • We're gathering huge public figures (including "her Deepness" Sylvia Earle), top marine scientists, artists, writers, activists, chef and shark attack survivors for a symposium at Yale that we'll be livestreaming and recording so that people all over the world learn more about the issues. Think TEDtalks, but just for sharks!
    • This event, From Ocean to Plate will take place on Feb. 15 at Yale University. We invite you attend in person or tune in online! Speakers include: Sylvia Earle, photographer David Doubilet, Chef Barton Seaver, Artist James Prosek, marine biologists Barbara Block, Demian Chapman and Ellen Pikitch, shark attack survivor Krishna Thompson and Sue Lieberman of the Pew Environment Group.

Before we tell you more, we'd like to talk about why we're doing this campaign and why it's such a critical time for shark conservataion. 

Sharks in Danger

Sharks have roamed our planet’s oceans for almost 450 million years ago, yet today these perfect predators are in extreme peril. Each year, up to 73 million sharks are killed to support the global shark fin soup industry. Many shark populations have suffered declines of up to 90% in only a few decades. The effects of this decline are far reaching. Sharks are key top predators that regulate the structure and function of marine ecosystems: their disappearance threatens the health of the whole ocean. 

However, as awareness of the threats to these magnificent creatures increases, the tides are starting to shift. The next critical moment is fast approaching and will be the first global campaign for Shark Stanley. In March 2013, 176 countries will convene in Bangkok for the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES) meeting. Three endangered sharks, including the iconic hammerhead and two manta rays species are proposed for protection. We are going to make sure that CITES reps vote YES!  

Using viral social media, our goal is to partner with 50 organizations, aquariums and NGOs internationally to gather at least 5000 photos from 176 countries. We'll compile these an give them directly to those responsible for voting in each country as creative petition "signature," showing them that there are thousands of passionate supporters, in their country and globally, that demand shark protection!

The campaign won't stop there. Shark Stanley will not only continue to advocate on the global stage, but will provide a charismatic character that young people can build their own relationship with while making meaningful links with youth around the world as they share their own Shark Stanley adventures.

With that, we invite you to join us: Shark Stanley Needs Your Help!

Leah Meth with Shark Stanley 

What We Need

We need $10000 for our project:

$3000 - Honorarium for the talented Daniel Yagmin Jr. who is doing the watercolor illustrations for the book and the cut-out characters 

$3000 - For the graphic design and printing of the Book

$3200 - To run the symposium, bring in our fantastic guest speakers and professionally film the talks and distribute them globally

$500 - To run the children's events, covering printed materials, crafts, life size Shark Stanley cut-outs and shark artifact displays

$300 - To design, create and deliver the photo "petitions" to all 176 CITES representatives; press release in Bangkok at CITES which Leah and Onon will be attending.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute funding, there are still ways that everyone can help Shark Stanley:

  • You can send us your photo with him and get your friends and family to do the same!
  • If your organization would like to partner with Shark Stanley to help us spread the word, email us at info(at)sharkdefenders.com 
  • If you work with kids in schools, aquariums, museums (wherever), we'd love to provide our children's activity book and our Shark Stanley cut-out sheets.
  • You can follow our campaign on www.sharkdefenders.com, facebook, instagram and twitter. 

Updates

December 30: We now have over 300 photo signatures from over 30 countries and over 20 partnering organizations including the Pew Environment Group, Shark Savers and Shark Aid UK!

January 26: We've officially reached 79 countries, have over 50 partners and over 1500 photos!

story:
Short Summary

We are concerned with climate change and the impacts it is already having on communities in the South Pacific. Over the last ten years strong ties have been made with government, non-governmental and community groups in Vanuatu and awareness has been raised on the issues of coastal erosion and sea level rise. Communities have been displaced in Vanuatu owing to changes in the coastal zone. Through a strong and committed team of concerned people in Vanuatu, New Zealand and the Philippines a coastal adaptation plan has been put into place. One of the key elements in the plan is rehabilitation of the coastal vegetation zone through the planting of native coastal plant species that are known to be saltwater tolerant and sand binding.

One of the key plant species that has been lost to the system is Spinfex littoreus. It needs to be returned to the islands so that the people of Vanuatu can have the best possible chance to support their own drive toward coastal zone stability in the face of rising seas.

With your support a team from Vanuatu, New Zealand and the Philippines with expertise in plant ecology, coastal rehabilitation and climate change will secure Spinifex littoreus seeds in the Philippines and bring them to Vanuatu for propagation and dissemination to threatened coastal communities. They are ready to protect their coastlines using vegetative means. The technology is well advanced and proven with kilometres of coastline protected in New Zealand and elsewhere around the world through community inititiaves. The Government of Vanuatu is strongly committed to the process and will support the nurseries and community groups for implementation. They just need the seed to start.

Your contribution will support an international team in traveling to source seed in the Philippines through a relationship with the University of the Philippines-Los Banos. The members of the team have worked together on numerous climate change risk assessment projects and have known each other for many years. They are a committed team of practical ecologists, scientists and community organisers.

When completed this project has the potential to revolutionise and rapidly accelerate coastal adaptation activities across the Pacific. As is well known, this region is already experiencing the impacts of climate change. Through the reintroduction of a critical coastal plant species to Vanuatu the country is keen to become the model for other Pacific nations and the community-based teacher and provider of plant material for those nations.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your contribution to support the time and travel for the team to source seed from native Spinifex littoreus plants still found in the Philippines. The experts from the University of Los Banos will assist the team from New Zealand who will process the seed and carry it back to Vanuatu where it will be turned over to the Vanuatu Department of Forestry for propagation. All government processes and procedures will be met for the export/import of biological material. As the plant variety is native to the region there is no biosecurity risk.

If the funding goal is not met all funds will support nursery development in Vanuatu for the propagation of other native plants for environmental rehabilitation. 

The Impact

Your contribution and the successful implementation of this reintroduction of Spinifex littoreus will have an enormous impact on mitigating coastal erosion not only in the Vanuatu but in other nations of the region. Not only will coastal environments be better protected but the surrounding reef systems will have less stress and be more resilient to climate change owing to the control of coastal erosion that has been impacting negatively.

Our team has the experience in such work with hundreds of kilometers of coastal environments having been rehabilitated with native species in New Zealand. With strong community support beaches have grown in size and have become highly resistant to storm  damage. In fact, storms have aided in the growth of the once highly eroded dune system. The key team member Mr. Greg Jenks is a leader in his field and he has also travelled to Vanuatu to advise on opportunities for extending the methods. The other team member Dr. Peter Urich has over 20 years experience in community environmental projects and has been involved in climate change risk assessments and adaptation planning in Vanuatu for many years. Peter also has extensive experience in the Philippines where he conducted socio-environmental research for his master and PhD. His links and strong working relationship with the Chancellor of the University of Philippines – Los Banos and the Dean of the School of Forestry means that the country’s best people will be involved. In Vanuatu Dr. Chris Bartlett formerly of GIZ and now affiliated with the Government of Vanuatu and a speaker of ni-Vanuatu will coordinate with the various government departments who will manage the propagation and dissemination of the resulting plants. There are development funds already in place and committed for coastal rehabilitation that will be enhanced by the sourcing of these seeds and the plants they will produce.

Other Ways You Can Help

If personally you are not in a position to help but you know of others who wish to make a concrete contribution to an ecological sound climate change adaptation method please share this link. The whole project will be documented and will be available for monitoring through the IGCI website.

story:
Who Am I?

My name’s Kate, and I spent the past couple of years building my own permaculture farm from scratch. I started out with a 3 acre plot of woods, and through natural building techniques, grafting native trees into more productive fruit trees, cover cropping, and using animal rotations, built a productive and sustainable small farm. Before that, I spent years interning with the most innovative, creative and knowledgable people I could find all around the country. I have had the pleasure of working with those on the cutting edge of sustainable farming. That experience taught me a lot, but I realized that one of the things I loved most was teaching other people the skills I have learned.  And now, I’m looking to take the knowledge and resources I’ve gained, and try to make it accessible for more people, in the form of a farm that is also a community center. With your help, I am trying to buy the perfect farm to do this with.

What are you trying to do?

Specifically, things that will be demonstrated/taught on the farm:

  • Home Solar Power (both passive and active, including passive solar house design)
  • Grafting/budding fruit and nut trees (and grafting native trees into more productive trees)
  • Plant Propagation
  • The Integrated Orchard (growing trees, animals, and mushrooms in concert organically)
  • Permaculture Design classes (and other sustainable land use classes)
  • Horsepower on the Farm (using horses for mowing, driving, hauling, etc)
  • Artisan Cheesemaking (and how to start a home dairy)
  • In addition to on-farm demos, I intend to have speakers come give classes on other sustainable topics

 

Many of these skills are dying arts (such as grafting, horsepower, and cheesemaking) while others are just emerging (solar technology and permaculture design). It is my belief that taking the “good” from the past and the “good” from the present and combining them can help create a sustainable and beautiful future.

 

Where will the farm be? What will you grow?

The farm will be in upstate South Carolina, which has a wonderful climate for growing a huge array of productive crops. It also has a great social climate, with both Greenville, SC and Asheville, NC having a broad base of communities interested in sustainable living. Geographically, it is easily reached from GA, NC, TN, and lowcountry SC, which makes it a nice “hub” for drawing folks here.

As far as what will be grown for food crops, one can expect the following (grown organically and biodynamically, meaning no chemical sprays):

Indian Runner Ducks, Dairy Sheep (St. Croix), Guineas, Turkeys, Mules, Oyster mushrooms, Apples, Pears, Mulberries, Kiwis, Jujube, Figs, Kumquats and other hardy citrus, Gooseberry, Medlar, Almond, Peach,  Pecans, Asian persimmon, American Persimmon, Butternut, Shagbark Hickory, Persian Walnut, Blackberries, Raspberries, Pawpaws, Plums, Loquat, Hazelnuts, Elderberry, and various annual crops including rye and wheat grain.

What will this money do?

The funds will go to paying for the land, as it is by far the biggest expense. I am able to propagate most of the plants, and cover the cost of building structures and earthworks (ponds, swales, berms, etc) but gathering funds for 10 acres has been challenging. In addition, I want this farm to be more of a community educational center, and less of a “private farm”, so asking for funding from the public makes sense.

Thanks for your time, please follow along and see the progress of the farm at www.bricolagefarm.wordpress.com
story_txt:
Who Am I?
My name’s Kate, and I spent the past couple of years building my own permaculture farm from scratch. I started out with a 3 acre plot of woods, and through natural building techniques, grafting native trees into more productive fruit trees, cover cropping, and using animal rotations, built a productive and sustainable small farm. Before that, I spent years interning with the most innovative, creative and knowledgable people I could find all around the country. I have had the pleasure of working with those on the cutting edge of sustainable farming. That experience taught me a lot, but I realized that one of the things I loved most was teaching other people the skills I have learned.  And now, I’m looking to take the knowledge and resources I’ve gained, and try to make it accessible for more people, in the form of a farm that is also a community center. With your help, I am trying to buy the perfect farm to do this with.
What are you trying to do?
Specifically, things that will be demonstrated/taught on the farm:

Home Solar Power (both passive and active, including passive solar house design)
Grafting/budding fruit and nut trees (and grafting native trees into more productive trees)
Plant Propagation
The Integrated Orchard (growing trees, animals, and mushrooms in concert organically)
Permaculture Design classes (and other sustainable land use classes)
Horsepower on the Farm (using horses for mowing, driving, hauling, etc)
Artisan Cheesemaking (and how to start a home dairy)
In addition to on-farm demos, I intend to have speakers come give classes on other sustainable topics
 
Many of these skills are dying arts (such as grafting, horsepower, and cheesemaking) while others are just emerging (solar technology and permaculture design). It is my belief that taking the “good” from the past and the “good” from the present and combining them can help create a sustainable and beautiful future.
 
Where will the farm be? What will you grow?
The farm will be in upstate South Carolina, which has a wonderful climate for growing a huge array of productive crops. It also has a great social climate, with both Greenville, SC and Asheville, NC having a broad base of communities interested in sustainable living. Geographically, it is easily reached from GA, NC, TN, and lowcountry SC, which makes it a nice “hub” for drawing folks here.
As far as what will be grown for food crops, one can expect the following (grown organically and biodynamically, meaning no chemical sprays):
Indian Runner Ducks, Dairy Sheep (St. Croix), Guineas, Turkeys, Mules, Oyster mushrooms, Apples, Pears, Mulberries, Kiwis, Jujube, Figs, Kumquats and other hardy citrus, Gooseberry, Medlar, Almond, Peach,  Pecans, Asian persimmon, American Persimmon, Butternut, Shagbark Hickory, Persian Walnut, Blackberries, Raspberries, Pawpaws, Plums, Loquat, Hazelnuts, Elderberry, and various annual crops including rye and wheat grain.
What will this money do?
The funds will go to paying for the land, as it is by far the biggest expense. I am able to propagate most of the plants, and cover the cost of building structures and earthworks (ponds, swales, berms, etc) but gathering funds for 10 acres has been challenging. In addition, I want this farm to be more of a community educational center, and less of a “private farm”, so asking for funding from the public makes sense.
Thanks for your time, please follow along and see the progress of the farm at www.bricolagefarm.wordpress.com

story:
Hi my name is Dawn.  I am a mom, community activist and organizer for close to 20 years.  I am continuing my education in non-violent direct action with the Backbone Campaign's 4th annual  Localize This! camp.  I am driven by social justice and compelled to act. This year, in addition to Occupying Seattle, Olympia and DC I have attended many marches, rallies, die-ins, sit-ins, sing-ins, flash mobs and  cash mobs even a pop-up medical tent. I have been focusing on: Jobs, Housing, Healthcare and Justice -- For All.    I have trained and  worked with the Backbone Campaign many times including in  DC!  In fact, I had the opportunity for a sing-in on the  for the 2nd Anniversary of Supreme Court's decision  on Citizens United @ the Supreme Court itself.  (video link below) I also was able to help produce a protest of light projection  onto the Supreme Court and US Chamber of Commerce.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bC6xUXziFxE

ToolKits and Local Laboratory
While Artful Activism and Culture Jamming are fun and  exciting for both particiapants and the  public. It also  helps us reframe the argument use our strength and establishes trust.   It is only part of the work that is done.  Team Backbone provides educational toolkits to progressive organizations, communities and neighborhoods to help them get noticed and create effective change for their local issue. Leaders from around the county provide training in all kinds of tactical training and know-how including;   local banking/ credit unions and eviction protection. We can literally reclaim this country block by block, community by community.  

What We Need

What we need is to raise $400. per participant to cover the costs of this week long training which includes camping and meals.  All funds, whether my goal is met or not will go to Backbone.


http://www.backbonecampaign.org/component/k2/item/50-localize-this-training

It is my goal to raise the funds for myself and at least a quarter of the funds for  aother participant.  Additioally, I hope through outreach that I am able to invite and have people particpate who would  otherwise not know about the training opportunity.

Reframing the argurement and taking back our neighborhoods and communities.

My first training with Bill Moyer of the Backbone Campaign explained the tactics and strategies of the Progressive Movement.   He made me aware of Chuck Spinny's theory of  M & M,  Motherhood & the Mismatch Strategy.  In  positive and creative ways setting up the difference and capitalizing on the power I have as a mother and critical thinker. I am compelled to create and act in a way that serves social justice, so that  human rights and dignity is extended to all not just those who can afford it.  We maybe outspent and cospired agaist, we have the moral highground.

Local banking, eviction protection are just a few examples of how I hope to help  take back our local economy and create thriving sustainable communities.

Radical Self Reliance

Sustainablity has been a lifelong pursuit for me. I am ever trying to understand how to be a better steward often with simplicity. The trainers and participants value, emphasis and creatively address and share this goal.

 I have learned so much from the Backbone Campaign and participated in so many meaningful training and actions.  As we look to the future, having more training and knowledge makes me that much more effective and versatile to create meaningful change.


 Ways You Can Help:

  1. Check out Backbone Campaign http://www.backbonecampaign.org/

  2. Consider attending the camp for a week, a day or future training.

  3. Pass on the information to those who are interested or compelled. Use your social media connections and Indiegogo's easy to use tools to further the message.

  4. Donate!


Thanks for your time.

Forward Together,

Dawn Levy

story:
PLANET GREEN SLEEVES

"What's on Your Sleeve?"

OUR PROJECT

Out of a simple design improvement a product is born, in this case, the next evolution of beverage sleeves. To date, coffee sellers supply a disposable one time use cardboard sleeve as a courtesy for the customer. On each is a printed company logo for branding purposes and/or other advertisements. Unfortunately, this creates tons of extra waste in the world’s landfills. Our products, which we refer to as “Green Sleeves”, are easy-grip beverage sleeves that can be used over and over.

With this innovation, our product can be sold directly to those very coffee houses AND retailers on a wholesale level. This will help reduce and eliminate the daily waste of the 50 Billion cardboard sleeves disposed of annually around the world while becoming a point of revenue for retailers.

In essence we are creating a fun and useful product while designing a print-on-demand business model for online customers.

At Planet Green Sleeves, action, purpose and a cause to reduce the billions of wasteful corrugated cardboard sleeves is what drives us to bring an exciting and sustainable product to the world! Since our product involves the sharing of ideas from others around the world we thought why not let our backers give it a name and logo, the one/s that best represents the products image and message will be chosen at the end of the campaign and be rewarded at the $500.00 level. We look forward to seeing your great ideas!

What is Planet Green Sleeves? Our mission is to promote environmental consciousness through the use and sale of reusable beverage sleeves fashioned in an ergonomically designed sense made with green technology and or recyclable products.

Planet Green Sleeves will carry a full line of reusable sleeves that is safer for hot and cold liquids. Its ergonomic shape fits perfectly into the hand of the end user. The sleeve keeps the temperature comfortable for holding, thereby preventing potentially harmful incidents and providing a long needed improvement of corrugated cardboard sleeves in use today. 

It helps protect the environment and people love because of its eco-friendliness and its endless personalized customization possibilities. Every individual can express their unique personalities by simply uploading an image on our consumer website for print and delivery. What’s going to be on your sleeve?

 

How did you come up with such a great idea? The inspiration for Planet Green Sleeve’s first came to me from the repeated annoyance of getting coffee cups from the local barista that were too hot to handle even with a corrugated cardboard sleeve. I would find myself using additional cardboard sleeves along with paper napkins to cool down my cup, simply put… wastefulness in its truest form. I decided to create my own solution and the idea for Planet Green Sleeves was born.

What's so cool and unique about it?
Good question!

Here is why we think Planet Green Sleeve’s is so special: It possesses the following qualities… extremely light, US Manufactured, Customizable, Heat/Cold Stable, Superior Strength and Performance.

First considered were the 4 questions below
1. Do you have an idea, innovation or invention?
2. Do you think it has commercial value?
3. Can it be made, marketed and sold at a profit?
4. Do you want to get it into the center of its marketplace so it can serve humankind and make you money?

Stats are relevant and warrant consideration for any products success so here’s a few eye popping mind boggling figures for you to digest. Initially we are targeting an industry that has the distinction of being the number one consumed beverage on the planet. There are 400 Billion cups consumed annually worldwide, wherein 50 Billion are takeaway cups (with cardboard sleeves on them).

We’re # 1! The US population consumes about 400 Million cups of coffee per day or equivalent to 146 Billion cups per year making the United States the world’s largest coffee consumer, 54% of the population of the US drinks coffee daily spending an approximated 9.2 Billion dollars in the retail sector.

Studies reveal the average consumer holds on to their cup for 49 minutes. The message on the sleeve is seen by six people and the retention rate of the information on the sleeve is 65%, business owners are sure to choose this form of advertising over disposable sleeves thus by default contributing towards sustainability.

It's truly Reusable. We engineered it to last for thousands of uses. It is made from a sturdy substrate that is pliable, malleable, bendy and soft to the touch, not a dry chalky cardboard associated with the cardboard sleeves. It folds into a carry pouch for easy storage and transport too.

Could the saying…”Good advertising dollars gone to waste” be more literal? One company alone in the United States prints over 200 Million corrugated cardboard sleeves with advertising/logo designs. Sadly, those cardboard sleeves help generate 45 million pounds of landfill waste. That's enough sleeves to circle the Earth 18 times! If by developing a simple product that can help prevent the untold daily waste of hundreds of millions of corrugated cardboard sleeves, would it be worth further efforts to bring to the market? Even if Planet Green Sleeves products can replace 1% of the world’s cardboard sleeve waste, that is still 45,000 pounds of waste kept out of the landfills.

Creation of a product that stimulates awareness on a global scale. In truth, it is long overdue for not only a design improvement but an engineering innovation towards comfort and functionality that surpasses its predecessor. Our projected retail price point under $10.00 and wholesale pricing much less will not challenge consumers buying decisions, and will lead them to (“go green”). This will foster a sense of contribution without having to purchase large ticket items such as solar panels or hybrid automobiles.

It's sustainable. To us, sustainable means a responsible product that actually reduces your “carbon foot print” on the planet. Planet Green Sleeve’s products will last you for thousands of uses. We are committed to being eco-friendly!

Proudly Made in the USA! After extensive research and many bids from overseas manufacturers we turned to the USA and found a reputable manufacturing company right here in Denver Colorado. They are committed to bringing this eco-friendly product to the masses.

When and how will you ship my cool stuff? We will ship via USPS at the successful first run of manufacturing. We will also send you an email before we ship your reward. 

What if I am interested in Wholesale orders other than the perks listed? Wholesale orders will be a big part of our business. We will approach retailers, businesses and coffee chains domestic and international to purchase in large volumes. If you are interested in Wholesale please contact us for preferential pricing.

What happens if the Planet Green Sleeves project is over-funded? By all accounts an additional $50,000.00 above our target goal of $7,500.00 would expedite the creation on our full line of products. With more, we can also turn our attention towards immediately instituting the print on demand digital image transferring for personal customizing. The initial $7,500.00 will take us in the direction to build the prototype and build the business in a manner that will allow us to do a first run of manufacturing and introduce Green Sleeves to over 30,000 distributor chains. Exceeding our funding goal will only help us to grow stronger and faster. Don't worry, we will consistently keep you updated and informed on our progress!

WHY ARE WE ON INDIEGOGO?

We are here for several reasons:

- We need your support for the professional tooling of this product that will allow us to manufacture, exhibit and display finalized printed products at the many beverage industry trade shows across the US.

- We want to find other people who believe that this product line should exist and it’s hard to argue the effect a real product can have in the hands of the end user.

- We plan to engineer a multitude of physical designs and sizes to be made in fun, cool, creative, eye catching, happy, warm, inviting, stylish, classy yet simple ways.

- We aspire to have the ability to print with digital imaging. Doing this requires more than our initial request for backing. Please consider backing us to make this a reality. Imagine a website where you can upload your own images, affirmations, personalized statements then opting into a growing online library as well as choosing designs that have been shared by people from all parts of the world from our website. Below are just examples of images that can be placed on sleeves. What’s going on your sleeve?

OUR CAUSE

If it already hasn't been noted enough throughout the campaign the importance of providing an eco-friendly product cannot be overstated. We believe in the benefits it will have on the world’s eco-system by reducing the use of an inferior product that’s damaging our environment.

We’re aware no product alone can solve the problem of wastefulness. Nevertheless, by raising awareness and consciousness derived from this environmentally responsible product will give people an easy way to help the planet. If introducing Planet Green Sleeves onto the marketplace we’ll have reached our dream of creating a cleaner world for years to come.

A program identifying a kaleidoscope of causes will continually be chosen whereby a percentage of profits will be donated to shared interest organizations.

REWARDS

If we reach our goal we predict our product will be in production early spring 2014. A multitude of styles and designs from our pre-manufacturing marketing efforts will allow for a generous selection that our eager backers will be the first to choose from. Rewards are as follows…

  • $1.00 A heartfelt Thank You!
  • $10.00 A heartfelt Thank you and a Hot Cup Green Sleeve with Logo
  • $25.00  A heartfelt Thank you and a Hot Cup Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeve
  • $50.00 A heartfelt Thank you and a Hot Cup Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeve and Green Sleeve with Logo
  • $75.00  A heartfelt Thank you and 2 matching Hot Cup Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves
  • $100.00 A heartfelt Thank you and 2 matching Hot Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves and 2 Hot Green Sleeves with Logo
  • $150.00 A heartfelt Thank You and your choice on any combination of 4 Hot/Cold sleeves
  • $250.00 A heartfelt Thank You and your choice on any combination of 6 Hot/Cold sleeves
  • $500.00 A heartfelt Thank you and 2 matching Hot Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves 2 matching Cold Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves and 2 Hot Green Sleeves with Logo 2 Cold Green Sleeves with Logo
  • $750.00 A heartfelt Thank you and your very own non digital custom design sleeve with 2  Hot and 2 Cold Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeve or any combination thereof
  • $1000.00 A heartfelt Thank you and any combination of 6 Hot and Cold sleeves on your very own non digital custom designed sleeve.

If we exceed our goal by $100,000.00 all backers will get their designated number of rewards commensurate to their amount and their own personalized digital image custom design. Please help us make this a reality for you by spreading the word on this exciting venture.

CHALLENGES & FORECAST  

After extensive research, development and testing we have submitted patent applications, produced prototypes of the designs presented in the video and established our budget. Our next step is to finalize prototypes that are production-ready, while we simultaneously develop additional styles and variations.

The amount we have chosen as our campaign target is meant to complete the first prototype but may not be sufficient for finalizing all of the production-ready prototypes. Any funds we receive in excess of our target will expedite the process of putting into operation the remaining specifically designed production line so that more eco-friendly sleeves in a variety of styles and sizes can soon be made available.

HOW WILL WE USE THE MONEY?

  • Professional grade tooling of the mold for its production.
  • Manufacturing a first run to be used in a multitude of marketing campaigns.
  • Packaging, printing, setup, design and delivery have been accounted for and finalized.
  • Day to day marketing to join/affiliate with Industry related Associations. It is necessary to establish that network of over 30,000 already identified independent sales agents (distributors) that generate sales of over $19 Billion dollars annually in the US for Branded Promotional Gifts.
  • Trade show budget for booth displays while attending local, regional and national trade shows.
  • Institute campaign introducing to large retailers, small businesses and corner convenience stores to carry, display, and sell.
  • Seek licensing agents of professional sports teams and the likes of large corporations that wish to advertise with or gift their employees.
  • Creating an interactive consumer website. The development and maintenance of a CMS (Content Management System) website with e-commerce functionality does not come at a small price but is crucial in providing consumers with a user friendly experience for your custom online purchases.
The ongoing marketing plans are designed to perpetuate re-orders and are necessary to become a self-sustainable company out of the gate. With this, it will allow the development and launching of a multitude of already pre-engineered sleeves spurring growth and stability.

 

How can I get more involved with your efforts?  

Hi guys and gals, even the best designed campaign on IndieGogo would go nowhere without being able to spread the message. This is where I need your help the most, whether you decide to be a backer, simply sharing this with another will most likely lead to its success, please take a moment to network this link to your friends near and far and spread the word on any of these social media platforms e.g. Google+, YouTube, Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, blogging, etc.)

FINAL THOUGHTS!!! 

It is undeniable there is a fundamental transformation of the world’s economic infrastructure taking place. Going green and its many technological applications both large and small is at the forefront. It is currently shaping consumers choices now and well into the new millennium.

We do not aspire to become just a local store front, restaurant, shop or business relegated to neighborhood sales; we wish to reach all parts of the world. We’re aiming to become an award winning product at Coffee Fest’s, Trade Shows and Product Conventions in the global beverage industry! Whether its glass, paper or plastic you can insulate your beverage with our Eco-Friendly Sleeves.

Please join/follow us on our journey to introduce the first ever digital image customize-able sleeve into coffee shops, Universities, retail chains, commercial businesses and proprietors around the world!

Visit our investment website at www.planetgreensleeves.com for more information.

Join the conspiracy and be a steward of the Earth!
