OUR CAUSE
If it already hasn't  been noted enough throughout the campaign the importance of providing an  eco-friendly product cannot be overstated. We believe in the benefits it will  have on the world’s eco-system by reducing the use of an inferior product  that’s damaging our environment. 
We’re aware no product  alone can solve the problem of wastefulness. Nevertheless, by raising awareness  and consciousness derived from this environmentally responsible product will  give people an easy way to help the planet. If introducing Planet Green Sleeves  onto the marketplace we’ll have reached our dream of creating a cleaner world  for years to come.
A program identifying a kaleidoscope  of causes will continually be chosen whereby a percentage of profits will be donated  to shared interest organizations.

REWARDS
If we reach our goal we  predict our product will be in production early spring 2014. A multitude of  styles and designs from our pre-manufacturing marketing efforts will allow for  a generous selection that our eager backers will be the first to choose from. Rewards  are as follows… 


$1.00 A heartfelt Thank You!
$10.00 A heartfelt Thank you and a Hot Cup  Green Sleeve with Logo
$25.00  A heartfelt Thank you and a Hot  Cup Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeve
$50.00 A heartfelt Thank you and a Hot  Cup Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeve and Green Sleeve with Logo
$75.00  A heartfelt Thank you and 2  matching Hot Cup Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves
$100.00 A heartfelt Thank you and 2 matching Hot Special  Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves and 2 Hot Green Sleeves with Logo
$150.00 A heartfelt Thank You and your choice on any  combination of 4 Hot/Cold sleeves 
$250.00 A heartfelt Thank You and your choice on any  combination of 6 Hot/Cold sleeves 
$500.00 A heartfelt Thank you and 2 matching Hot  Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves 2 matching Cold Special  Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeves and 2 Hot Green Sleeves with Logo 2  Cold Green Sleeves with Logo
$750.00 A heartfelt Thank you and your very own non  digital custom design sleeve with 2  Hot  and 2 Cold Special Edition first run Inaugural Green Sleeve or any combination  thereof
$1000.00 A heartfelt Thank you and any  combination of 6 Hot and Cold sleeves on your very own non digital custom  designed sleeve.
If we exceed our goal by  $100,000.00 all backers will get their designated number of rewards commensurate  to their amount and their own personalized digital image custom design. Please  help us make this a reality for you by spreading the word on this exciting  venture. 
CHALLENGES &  FORECAST  
After extensive  research, development and testing we have submitted patent applications,  produced prototypes of the designs presented in the video and established our  budget. Our next step is to finalize prototypes that are production-ready,  while we simultaneously develop additional styles and variations.
  
The amount we have chosen as  our campaign target is meant to complete the first prototype but may not be  sufficient for finalizing all of the production-ready prototypes. Any funds we  receive in excess of our target will expedite the process of putting into  operation the remaining specifically designed production line so that more  eco-friendly sleeves in a variety of styles and sizes can soon be made  available.
HOW WILL WE USE THE MONEY?

Professional grade tooling of the mold for its  production. 
Manufacturing a first run to be  used in a multitude of marketing campaigns. 
Packaging, printing, setup, design and delivery  have been accounted for and finalized. 
Day to day marketing to join/affiliate with Industry  related Associations. It is necessary to establish that network of over 30,000 already  identified independent sales agents (distributors) that generate sales  of over $19 Billion dollars annually in the US for Branded Promotional Gifts. 
Trade show budget for booth displays while attending  local, regional and national trade shows. 
Institute campaign  introducing to large retailers, small businesses and corner convenience stores  to carry, display, and sell. 
Seek licensing agents  of professional sports teams and the likes of large corporations that wish to  advertise with or gift their employees.
Creating an  interactive consumer website. The development and maintenance of a CMS (Content  Management System) website with e-commerce functionality does not come at a  small price but is crucial in providing consumers with a user friendly  experience for your custom online purchases.

The ongoing marketing plans are designed to  perpetuate re-orders and are necessary to become a self-sustainable company out  of the gate. With this, it will allow the development and launching of a multitude  of already pre-engineered sleeves spurring growth and stability.
 
How can I get more involved with your efforts?  
Hi guys and gals, even the  best designed campaign on IndieGogo would go nowhere without being able to  spread the message. This is where I need your help the most, whether you decide  to be a backer, simply sharing this with another will most likely lead to its  success, please take a moment to network this link to your friends near and far  and spread the word on any of these social media platforms e.g. Google+,  YouTube, Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, blogging, etc.)
  


FINAL THOUGHTS!!! 
It  is undeniable there is a fundamental transformation of the world’s economic  infrastructure taking place. Going green and its many technological  applications both large and small is at the forefront. It is currently shaping  consumers choices now and well into the new millennium.
We  do not aspire to become just a local store front, restaurant, shop or business  relegated to neighborhood sales; we wish to reach all parts of the world. We’re  aiming to become an award winning product at Coffee Fest’s, Trade Shows and  Product Conventions in the global beverage industry! Whether its glass, paper  or plastic you can insulate your beverage with our Eco-Friendly Sleeves.
Please  join/follow us on our journey to introduce the first ever digital image  customize-able sleeve into coffee shops, Universities, retail chains, commercial  businesses and proprietors around the world!
Visit our investment website at www.planetgreensleeves.com for  more information.

Join the conspiracy and be a steward of the Earth!

story:
15,000 Climate Stick Pendants distributed at the Great Climate March on September 21.


Pictures from the March of people with pendants.


News Flash -- Bill McKibbon supports the Climate Stick--



Other Environmentalists who support the Climate Stick


"The Climate Stick stands tall in educational value!"

                        Henry Pollack,  Author, A World Without Ice

"The climate stick helps educate a variety of audiences about the amount of CO2 we have polluted the atmosphere with, and how little time there is to fix our problem. It's a great portable tool -- and the pendant is a great conversation starter!"

                      Monica Patel, Creative Director at the Ecology Center

"The climate stick helps to point out what risks are at stake for each degree of rising carbon levels. It helps to point out our population is on a dangerous trajectory if serious action on climate is not taken. A quick look at this info-graph can educate people on climate change, and the solutions we have to reverse the trends. "

                    James Clift, Policy Director

  Michigan Environmental Council

“There are many different ways to get the word out about the Climate Problem to people. The Climate Stick has a sound argument and a compelling logic.”

                    Peter Sinclair,  Climate Crock of the Weekde

The video shows what the teaching value of the

Climate Stick can be, and the Perks allow you to get your own Climate Stick to use when you do your educational work to eliminate the burning of carbon.  The first step in making the Climate Stick a widespread teaching tool is this Indiegogo campaign.  The $22,000 to be raised will fund the production and distribution of 20,000 Climate Stick Pendants at the Peoples Climate March in New York City on September 21, 2014.  More pendants will be made and distributed if we exceed our goal of $22,000. And after the March our web-site will allow more people to get similar Climate Stick items so they can join our process of education until we win and carbon ceases to be burned. Any profits from these activities  will be shared by the non-profit organizing the Climate Stick project with 350.org (getting 20%) and the Union of Concerned Scientists (getting 10%) and several others still to be named. While we have been long time supporters of these groups we have no "official" connection with them.

The Impact

(A personal message from the developer of the Climate Stick for Climate Action project)

Many people are very worried about how fast our climate is changing and how soon these changes will dramatically affect our ability to feed the 7 billion plus people who now inhabit the Earth (not to mention increasingly severe floods, fires, storms and other major climate related events we see weekly now on our TV screens).

But conversation about these issues is so filled with half-truths and competing technologies that as yet we have not been able to create a consensus with the political will to overcome the strength of the fossil fuel industry and its supporters.

I have been giving presentations about climate change for more than six years, and have engineering,  educational and business experience in changing how organizations function. The facts and focus of the climate debate have changed over time but it is still difficult to convey quickly and clearly what is at a stake as we burn more carbon.  Ten weeks ago I discovered a way to make the complete picture clearer with a simple picture – the Climate Stick as I call it. In my last presentations many people “got it” in ways they had not before. 

The Climate Stick for Climate Action project is an attempt to bring the use of the Climate Stick to the national conversation of how we turn the corner and start to directly address the climate crisis. We all know that a mass movement is needed to free up the money that subsidizes coal and oil so that the green energy sources (including energy conservation and efficiency) we need can be brought to implementation a lot sooner that the year 2050 that is given lip service in current debate.

The Climate Stick for Climate Action will bring 20,000 (40,000 if we significantly overachieve our fundraising goal of $22,000) Climate Stick Pendants to the Peoples Climate March on September 21 in New York City to be distributed at no cost by a Street Team of 30-40 people engaging marchers in Manhattan.  Our web-site (cs4us.org) will allow for additional Climate Stick Items to be available to support the building of a mass movement to stop the burning of fossil fuel by 2022.  Yes, a goal all reasonable people think is just impossible. A mass movement could change that. More on this in the Risks & Challenges section.

Our video shows you the Climate Stick and how you can use it in your discussions.

Our Perks will let you get Climate Stick related educational, clothing and jewelry that also convey the story of the Climate Stick.  You are also making a symbol for the mass movement to stop burning carbon as you support the Climate Stick for Climate Action project and use the items you receive as Perks to inform your relatives, co-workers and friends.

Bill McKibben has said “Very few people on earth ever get to say: "I am doing, right now, the most important thing I could possibly be doing." If you'll join this fight that's what you'll get to say.”  This statement directs what I do in my life.  Living it produced the Climate Stick.  If you think the Climate Stick would help you argue for a sane energy policy, and you do, and we stop the burning of carbon, then Bill might just be right.


What you get

First, a tool to help you communicate the issues of the climate debate clearly and powerfully.

Second, a connection to the movement that will ban the burning of fossil fuel in enough time to keep us from increasing temperature past where agriculture can provide enough food for those living on our planet.  Plus an important role in creating the symbol of the movement to stop burning carbon.

And the choice of at least Sixteen different Perks for Climate Stick Tools, Jewelry and Apparel that help you tell the story in your own words.

Since our focus in the next month is on getting 20,000 Climate Sticks Pendants produced  and to the Street Team that will deliver them in New York City, the mail delivery of these Perks to you will probably be after September 21, 2014.  If possible the Tools and Fused Glass Custom Pendants may be delivered before the September 21 Peoples Climate March.   For those ordering standard pendants and attending the March we will make a location available in New York City for you to pick up the special pendants for the New York March, if you so desire.

Each Perk comes with a Climate Stick Operator's Manual for the number of items in the Perk.  Multiple items in a Perk are mailed to the same address.

 You saw the basic, everyone-wears-one Climate Stick at the top, below is the Climate Stick Lapel pin that is worn vertically as the pin is behind the red section.



Now our T shirt comes only in grey, but there are plans for white ones after September 21, 2014.  The Climate Stick Poster duplicates what is on the T shirt.


 


Want to get your school's science teachers into engaging climate change discussions, get them a six pack of Climate Sticks, or just one for your self.



One person's own Climate Stick, or you can order them by the dozen

                       

There is even a Custom Fired Glass Climate Stick Pendant that you can give to that special person who helps you get through the "does this make any sense" part of your day.

There are several Perks that contain Pins, Pendants and/or Shirts, just pick the Perk you want.

And we are looking for some fun additional Perks involved with getting together in New York on the 19th or 20th of September.  See the last section for ways that you might help us create them.

Additional Details of the Project

The Basic Story: Green, Black, Yellow, and Red

After 60 plus presentations about climate change that included up to 50 slides, and taking 40 minutes, I have reduced the story about climate change to a two minute discussion with the Climate Stick as my visual aid.

My hope is that each person masters the short version and uses it to expand the number of people who will help us get to a sane energy policy.

The Green

The green represents the last 11,000 years up to 1804 CE (estimated date of reaching one billion people on the planet).  It is the time when humans developed agriculture and during that time the CO2 in the atmosphere was about 275ppm and the average earth temperature was about 55 °F.  The total CO2 in the atmosphere was about 2300 Gigatons.  The greenhouse effect from the CO2 was beneficial.  It helped keep the climate consistent enough for us to develop agriculture in many places on the globe, and allowed for the human population to grow to 1 billion people.

The beginning of the Industrial Age starts sometime after 1750 CE and between then and 1850 CE there was little addition of CO2 by humans to the atmosphere.  Choosing 1804 when the population was estimated to reach one billion is a convenient, but arbitrary, date for the change from Green to Black.

The Black

The black represents the additional CO2 in the atmosphere that has mostly been added by humans burning coal, oil and natural gas.  What began with the steam engine has continued until 2011 with the result of having 396ppm of CO2 in the atmosphere which added an additional 1,852 Gigatons of CO2.  The average Earth temperature increased 1.5 °F because of this increase in CO2 and in methane which comes from increased milk and meat production.

Within the Black section is a Yellow Stripe showing when the CO2 in the air reached 350ppm – the amount that is believed to be the maximum amount of CO2 that can exist in the atmosphere without beginning to change the general climate patterns of the last 11,000 years.  This level was passed in 1988. And since then in ever increasing ways the climate has started to change, causing more and stronger floods, droughts and more destructive hurricanes. And of course: expanding oceans, melting Greenland and Antarctic ice and increasing ocean, land and air temperatures.

For discussion purposes the line between the Black and Yellow band represents now (2014) and the current level of CO2 is about 400ppm.  You can use the Climate Stick from the Yellow through the Red to represent the future and the Green and the Black represent the past.

The Yellow

The Yellow represents the estimated amount of 565 Gigatons of additional CO2 that can be placed in the atmosphere before causing the surface temperature to increase by 3.6°F.  At this temperature much of agriculture will be disrupted by changes in the climate and the minimum need for food to feed the 7-9 Billion people on the planet will not be met.  As we move forward in time more people will have a harder time getting the food they need to sustain themselves.  Some scientists believe that we have 15 years before major food shortages occur; others think that 30 to 40 years is left before the 3.5°F limit is reached.  The Yellow represents both the additional CO2 that can be added before major disruptions of the food growing capacity occur, and at the same time it represents 25% of the total amount of fossil fuel that the fossil fuel industry has on its books to burn by 2050.

The Red

The large oil and coal companies and the petro/fossil fuel states such as Saudi Arabian, Russia, USA and Venezuela have $28 Trillion worth of carbon in the ground that they intend to burn by 2050.  Only $7 Trillion of that can be burned without the temperature exceeding a 3.6°F increase.  The Red section is three times as large as the Yellow section.

So what

Noted scientists and activists, like James Hansen, Bill McKibben and others have written books, hundreds of articles and made thousands of presentations.  They are so fearful of the future their grandchildren will inherit that they have been arrested multiple times at the White House to bring attention to the climate crises.  What will you do now to help eliminate the BURNING OF CARBON FOR ENERGY?

Background: How the Climate Stick Came to Be

By late April 2014 I had given 50 to 60 presentations on climate change.  I had developed or borrowed close to seventy slides that illustrated the science, economics and politics of the "climate crisis."  I was invited to give a presentation to a student group at a church in Essexville, Michigan on April 27th, 2014.  As I prepared for the presentation, I decided to simplify certain slides by representing several concepts and values on a 2" x 2" piece of lumber that was 5 feet long.  The information was written with black marker in sections marked off with green tape.  The presentation was given and those present seemed to like the "climate stick."

The next week as I prepared for a presentation at the Bay County Commission (BCC)  on 5/13/2014, I revised the data on the original climate stick and decided to use color and a full 2" x 4" piece of wood six feet in length.  As I was making these changes, it occurred to me that smaller versions of the colored climate stick could be used in informal situations to make discussion about climate change more understanding and vivid.  I made several smaller versions about 18” long (with my nephew B.J. Race doing the painting) and took three climate sticks to the Lone Tree Council meeting on May 2, 2014.  After my presentation, one of the members made a donation to obtain one of the climate sticks.

I took the six foot long, color climate stick to the BCC meeting on May 13th, 2014.  After about a six minute presentation that was videotaped by a community access TV station, several commissioners asked questions and the taped session was about 8 minutes long.  When I put the video on my Facebook page I received many positive comments and five or six people shared it with others.

As I used the shorter version of the stick at several events leading up to our May 17, 2014 350 Picture event, it seemed just a little too long - so I drilled a hole in one end and hung it with a cord around my neck to keep my hands free.  I used the six foot version at the May 17, 2014 event and more than twenty people made it a point to tell me how effective the Climate Stick was.  Several of them said that they would like a smaller version for their own use in discussion with friends.  As I thought about making it shorter the idea of making if a pendant to wear around the neck came into my mind and I asked a clay artist to see if he could make a pendant using the colors of the Climate Stick.  We produced four different sizes and the 2” long version was the preference of 90% of the women who made up the rolling “focus group”.  Using clay was a time consuming effort. I had to look for a way to mass produce the Climate Stick so that it was economically feasible to provide them to many people. The pendant in its mass produced form is a variation on the tags which are used for security and identification on more expensive clothing and jewelry items.


Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges

There are three significant problems that can make the realization of the Climate Stick Pendants  project difficult:

·  production of the Climate Stick pendants

·  assemble and management of the distribution team, and

·  logistics of getting the Climate Stick pendants to the distribution team.

In addition there is a set of very unlikely possibilities that could affect the “special event” that is one of the main elements of the project.  Should the Peoples Climate March in New York be postponed, cancelled or disrupted then the main distribution activity needed could be diminished significantly.  Since these possibilities would most likely happen only a day or two before the event, the only plan possible is to regroup and choose another event to distribute the Climate Stick pendants.

Possible Solutions to Risks and Challenges

Production of the Climate Stick Pendants

Production is currently scheduled for the supplier to deliver the Climate Stick Pendants on September 12, 2014.  The supplier has a strong record of on-time delivery.  Weekly checking of the delivery schedule is planned for each week until delivery.

Assemble and management of the distribution team

The estimated is that 40 people are needed to distribute 20,000 climate sticks in 6 hours. And provide and explain the climate stick. They will be the Climate Stick Street team. The Street Team is to be made of two organizations that will provide the majority of the needed volunteers.

Logistics to New York City

Multiple hotel rooms have been reserved for the four days before the September 21 event and the shipments of the Climate Stick pendants to the hotel should be no problem. Getting the Climate Stick pendants to the Street Team in New York will require coordination.

Another risk associated with the use of the Climate Stick is that it is not a precise instrument.  People will say "about" and "almost" when talking about the science and economics it helps them discuss.  This gives those who hold the view that only the most pristine science could ever influence them to accept that the status quo needs to change.  Most regular people get it, so don't worry about those who don't.  There are enough of us if we just get into organized action. And if we do then the actual state of what our scientist and engineers know and can invent will change the perception and reality of how fast we can eliminate the burning of carbon.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can make your own Climate stick with a piece of wood and colored markers in 5 minutes. Using what is in the Extras and the video, you could be doing a Climate Stick presentation in an hour.  So do it, and help your audience  go to Indiegogo and help support this project.

If you live in the New York City area, here are two ideas we would like to implement as Perks.

Meet the Climate Stick organizers in a 2 hour small party in an apartment that has a view of NYC.  $400 donation for you and a friend to attend.  10 possible slots. This could be Friday, September 19 or 20 at 6, 7, 8 or 9PM.

Meet the Climate Stick organizers on a 2 Hour boat trip on the Hudson River viewing the Manhattan Skyline.  $600 donation for you and a friend.  5 possible slots.  This could be Friday, September 19 or 20 anytime in the 2PM to 8PM time period.

If you know someone who is interested in the Climate Change movement and has either of these assets, ask them about the possibility, and if they say "possible", go to www.cs4us.org and sign in with your phone or e-mail and I will contact you to see how we might approach them.

And Of Course
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your support.

years.  This level was passed in 1988.
And since then in ever increasing ways the climate has started to change,
causing more and stronger floods, droughts and more destructive hurricanes. And
of course: expanding oceans, melting Greenland and Antarctic ice and increasing
ocean, land and air temperatures.
For discussion purposes the
line between the Black and Yellow band represents now (2014) and the current
level of CO2 is about 400ppm.  You can
use the Climate Stick from the Yellow through the Red to represent the future
and the Green and the Black represent the past.

The Yellow
The Yellow represents the
estimated amount of 565 Gigatons of additional CO2 that can be placed in the
atmosphere before causing the surface temperature to increase by 3.6°F.  At this temperature much of agriculture will
be disrupted by changes in the climate and the minimum need for food to feed
the 7-9 Billion people on the planet will not be met.  As we move forward in time more people will
have a harder time getting the food they need to sustain themselves.  Some scientists believe that we have 15 years
before major food shortages occur; others think that 30 to 40 years is left
before the 3.5°F limit is reached.  The
Yellow represents both the additional CO2 that can be added before major
disruptions of the food growing capacity occur, and at the same time it
represents 25% of the total amount of fossil fuel that the fossil fuel industry
has on its books to burn by 2050.
The Red
The large oil and coal
companies and the petro/fossil fuel states such as Saudi Arabian, Russia, USA
and Venezuela have $28 Trillion worth of carbon in the ground that they intend
to burn by 2050.  Only $7 Trillion of
that can be burned without the temperature exceeding a 3.6°F increase.  The Red section is three times as large as
the Yellow section.
So what

Noted scientists and
activists, like James Hansen, Bill McKibben and others have written books,
hundreds of articles and made thousands of presentations.  They are so fearful of the future their
grandchildren will inherit that they have been arrested multiple times at the
White House to bring attention to the climate crises.  What will you do now to help eliminate the BURNING OF CARBON FOR ENERGY?
Background: How the Climate Stick Came to
Be
By
late April 2014 I had given 50 to 60 presentations on climate change.  I
had developed or borrowed close to seventy slides that illustrated the science,
economics and politics of the "climate crisis."  I was invited
to give a presentation to a student group at a church in Essexville, Michigan
on April 27th, 2014.  As I prepared for the presentation, I decided to
simplify certain slides by representing several concepts and values on a
2" x 2" piece of lumber that was 5 feet long.  The information
was written with black marker in sections marked off with green tape.  The
presentation was given and those present seemed to like the "climate
stick."
The next week as I prepared for a presentation at the Bay County Commission
(BCC)  on 5/13/2014, I revised the data
on the original climate stick and decided to use color and a full 2" x
4" piece of wood six feet in length.  As I was making these changes,
it occurred to me that smaller versions of the colored climate stick could be
used in informal situations to make discussion about climate change more
understanding and vivid.  I made several smaller versions about 18” long
(with my nephew B.J. Race doing the painting) and took three climate sticks to
the Lone Tree Council meeting on May 2, 2014.  After my presentation, one
of the members made a donation to obtain one of the climate sticks.
I took the six foot long, color climate stick to the BCC meeting on May 13th,
2014.  After about a six minute presentation that was videotaped by a
community access TV station, several commissioners asked questions and the
taped session was about 8 minutes long. 
When I put the video on my Facebook page I received many positive
comments and five or six people shared it with others.
As
I used the shorter version of the stick at several events leading up to our May
17, 2014 350 Picture event, it seemed just a little too long - so I drilled a
hole in one end and hung it with a cord around my neck to keep my hands
free.  I used the six foot version at the
May 17, 2014 event and more than twenty people made it a point to tell me how
effective the Climate Stick was.  Several
of them said that they would like a smaller version for their own use in
discussion with friends.  As I thought
about making it shorter the idea of making if a pendant to wear around the neck
came into my mind and I asked a clay artist to see if he could make a pendant
using the colors of the Climate Stick. 
We produced four different sizes and the 2” long version was the
preference of 90% of the women who made up the rolling “focus group”.  Using clay was a time consuming effort. I had to look for a way to mass produce the
Climate Stick so that it was economically feasible to provide them to many
people. The pendant in its mass produced form is a variation on the tags which
are used for security and identification on more expensive clothing and jewelry
items.

  Risks & Challenges  
Risks and challenges
There are three significant problems that can make the
realization of the Climate Stick Pendants  project difficult: 
· 
production of the Climate Stick pendants
· 
assemble and management of the distribution team,
and 
· 
logistics of getting the Climate Stick pendants to the
distribution team.
In addition there is a set of very unlikely possibilities
that could affect the “special event” that is one of the main elements of the
project.  Should the Peoples Climate
March in New York be postponed, cancelled or disrupted then the main
distribution activity needed could be diminished significantly.  Since these possibilities would most likely
happen only a day or two before the event, the only plan possible is to regroup
and choose another event to distribute the Climate Stick pendants.
Possible Solutions to Risks and Challenges
Production of the Climate Stick Pendants
Production is currently scheduled for the supplier to
deliver the Climate Stick Pendants on September 12, 2014.  The supplier has a strong record of on-time
delivery.  Weekly checking of the
delivery schedule is planned for each week until delivery.
Assemble and management of the distribution team
The estimated is that 40 people are needed to distribute 20,000
climate sticks in 6 hours. And provide and explain the climate stick. They will
be the Climate Stick Street team. The Street Team is to be made of two
organizations that will provide the majority of the needed volunteers.
Logistics to New York City
Multiple hotel rooms have been reserved for the four days
before the September 21 event and the shipments of the Climate Stick pendants to the hotel should
be no problem. Getting the Climate Stick pendants to the Street Team in New York will require
coordination.
Another risk associated with the use of the Climate Stick is that it is not a precise instrument.  People will say "about" and "almost" when talking about the science and economics it helps them discuss.  This gives those who hold the view that only the most pristine science could ever influence them to accept that the status quo needs to change.  Most regular people get it, so don't worry about those who don't.  There are enough of us if we just get into organized action. And if we do then the actual state of what our scientist and engineers know and can invent will change the perception and reality of how fast we can eliminate the burning of carbon.

Other Ways You Can Help You can make your own Climate stick with a piece of wood and colored markers in 5 minutes. Using what is in the Extras and the video, you could be doing a Climate Stick presentation in an hour.  So do it, and help your audience  go to Indiegogo and help support this project.
If you live in the New York City area, here are two ideas we would like to implement as Perks.


Meet the Climate Stick organizers in a 2 hour small party in
an apartment that has a view of NYC. 
$400 donation for you and a friend to attend.  10 possible slots. This could be Friday, September
19 or 20 at 6, 7, 8 or 9PM.
Meet the Climate Stick organizers on a 2 Hour boat trip on
the Hudson River viewing the Manhattan Skyline. 
$600 donation for you and a friend. 
5 possible slots.  This could be
Friday, September 19 or 20 anytime in the 2PM to 8PM time period.
If you know someone who is interested in the Climate Change movement and has either of these assets, ask them about the possibility, and if they say "possible", go to www.cs4us.org and sign in with your phone or e-mail and I will contact you to see how we might approach them.And Of Course
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 Thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

Organic waste is not being disposed of in an environmentally responsible manner with dire consequences to both the fresh water aquifer and the coral reef.  Our mission is an environmental one; to help clean up the organic waste being disposed of without regard for the environment by treating this organic waste in Anaerobic Digesters (ADs) and producing both green energy and fertilizer; both commodities badly needed in the Caribbean.  We will use a patented  anaerobic digestion process technology known as AFC2 developed by Dr. Alan Rozich of BCS.  BCS currently is involved with installing this technology in Korea, Australia and at a co-operative of farms in Massachusetts, so the technology is proven to work.  See information on BCS at  www.bioconversionsolutions.com .  The best way to describe this technology is to say that it turbo charges a typical Anaerobic Digester (AD) and vastly increases it's efficiency from typical ADs.  This  process creates a biogas, from which "Green Electricity" is created for sale into the island's grid, thereby helping alleviate in some way the high cost of electricity in the islands. The process also creates a high quality liquid fertilizer that can be dried and sold into the islands or sold into the United States in liquid form to help the islands obtain foreign exchange.


To further our commitment to the environment REGI will donate 5% of our Crowd Funding proceeds to the Bellairs Research Institute at McGill University (www.mcgill.ca/bellairs) which maintains an open-door  research facility in Holetown, Barbados to advance research projects involving both marine and terrestrial environments.


ENDORSED BY DR. ALAN ROZICH

"I am Dr. Alan Rozich, CEO of BCS and the founder and patent holder of the AFC2 technology used by BCS to significantly enhance the conversion rates of the anaerobic digester (AD) process.  These modifications result in almost doubling biogas production and the production of high-grade fertilizer over conventional ADs.  We at BCS are partnering with REGI throughout the Caribbean to bring this technology to the islands.  In all of my many years of experience in building these projects throughout the world, I feel that the REGI Barbados Project has compelling economic metrics while simultaneously solving environmental issues.  The project will generate electricity and fertilizer for the people of Barbados and put them on the road to resource independence.  I strongly endorse this project!"

David and Kevin Ridley, two brothers born and raised in Canada but vacationing extensively in the Caribbean, have identified a serious need to help treat organic waste which is polluting the islands. They have identified that organic waste is disposed of in environmentally unfriendly methods and that landfills are reaching capacity. The solution is to stop the pollution by treating this waste and create electricity and fertilizer for the islands. 

David and Kevin Ridley have incorporated Ridley Energy Group Inc. (REGI), a Canadian Company and along with their technology partner BioConversion Solutions LLC, (BCS) now have the technology and the means to start the clean up. REGI intends to develop its first Waste-to-Energy (WTE) facility on the island of Barbados, W.I. REGI has to go through the approval process for its first Caribbean facility on the island of Barbados and needs your help and support to do so. 

Please see the REGI web site at www.ridleyenergygroupinc.ca and the BCS web site at www.bioconversionsolutions.com for more information.

What We Need & What You Get

David Ridley has been in various businesses since graduating from McMaster University in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada in 1976 with a Bachelor of Commerce degree. David is a very successful entrepreneur who now owns and operates a real estate appraisal company in St. Catharines, Ontario, Canada, which is the largest in the area and employs 15 people. Kevin Ridley has greater than thirty years of diversified experience in a consulting and academic teaching capacity in earth science, hydrogeology, engineering and environmental projects since graduating from McMaster University in 1973 with a Bachelor of Science degree (Magna Cum Laude). He also has a M.Sc. in geology and chemistry and a Ph. D. in engineering. Dr. Ridley owns and operates a boutique environmental health and safety consulting firm in Brampton, Ontario, Canada. He works throughout Canada but mainly in the Greater Toronto Area.

The Ridleys need your help to finance the approval process to allow for the WTE facility to be built/operated in Barbados. Your valued contribution will be used to support the approval process in Barbados that involves the hiring of planning and environmental experts and finalizing the contracts to secure waste feedstock and a power purchase agreement.  Once approvals are obtained and the facility is built, the intention is to build other WTE facilities within the Caribbean to process organic waste to create electricity and fertilizer. Your financial contribution will help clean up Barbados and later the other islands in the Caribbean. The magnitude of your valued contribution will help within the approval process and eventually help in cleaning up the Caribbean islands to keep them pristine and beautiful for future generations to enjoy.

Although we can't supply perks directly related to the project, we do have some very interesting perks.  The book written by the inventor of our technology is very noteworthy and enlightening with respect to "inconvenient truths" and how they may impact the world.  The Merrymen CD is also a must have for any fans of this iconic music group with all of their favourite songs including such hits as Beautiful Barbados, Yellow Bird, Island In The Sun and Hot, Hot, Hot.   The cultured pearl necklace is a gift from the sea; very beautiful and providing  a lasting reminder of your generous help to us and our very important project.

Please see our video, which explains what we are trying to accomplish.

The Impact

In addition to being “Green” it will benefit these small nations by alleviating some of the elevated and expensive cost of electricity and reduce their high carbon footprints.  Another benefit of using this unique process is its ability to produce a high quality liquid fertilizer that can be used in the agricultural industry to create employment and lessen the burden of the loss of foreign exchange, which will benefit the Caribbean people and their economies.

David and Kevin Ridley have jointly established Ridley Energy Group Inc. (REGI), a Canadian Company to address this matter.  They have partnered with others and BioConversion Solutions LLC, (BCS), a company that specializes in Anaerobic Digestion to commence the cessation and eventual prevention of discharging liquid organic waste to the Caribbean Sea which will eventually result in the natural clean-up of the water and regeneration of the reefs which are so beneficial to the natural habitat and the tourist industry.  We all like to vacation in the Caribbean and our mission is to maintain the environment not only for the tourists but for the local population.  REGI is seeking funds to construct the first Waste-to-Energy (WTE) facility in Barbados and ultimately within the Caribbean as a whole.  To do so, we need to proceed through the environmental and social assessment approval process with the Barbadian regulatory agencies and need funding to do so.  For the past three years we have proceeded by following normal, accepted business channels but have not been able to raise the necessary seed capital to fund the regulatory approval process. Hence, we are proceeding by requesting funding through this avenue which we believe is unique and innovative.  We need your help, which will benefit all of us locally and abroad.

Please visit our web site at www.ridleyenergygroupinc.ca and the BCS web site at www.bioconversionsolutions.com for more information.  We believe that it will be worth your while and further demonstrate the genuine nature of our intent.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute to help REGI obtain the approvals for our project in Barbados. But you can still help us by getting the word out to your friends and associates. Please use the Indiegogo share tools and mention the REGI site here on Indiegogo and also our web site at www.ridleyenergygroupinc.ca

story:
Short Summary

We are the Everitts (Anthony and Kriscinda). We were married about a year ago and shortly afterwards, we found the perfect house/property to start our lives together. We moved from the city to a rural area with the hopes of living a slower-paced life, closer to the land, more self-sufficiently, and with the ability to pretty much do what we want (and neither of us are unreasonable people). Since moving here (really, since the weather got nice), we've put most of our energy into constructing a 23-raised-bed vegetable garden. It was a tremendous amount of work, but as of this writing, things are growing! We plan on canning and freezing enough to take us through the winter.

Unfortunately, our neighbors don't share our enthusiasm, or our aesthetic, despite the fact that this land and this property in particular has been used for farming since the late 1700s. Around us is a little rural suburbia. It's too much to get into here, but it you'd like the ugly details of what we've been dealing with, please get yourself a cup of coffee and click this link:

 

http://heavymetalhomesteading.wordpress.com/2013/06/25/us-and-our-neighbors/

 

The short version is that one neighbor in particular has tried passive-aggressiveness, intimidating us via the mail, and now he's dragging us before the township Board of Supervisors in order to force us to maintain our property the way he wants to see it, which is a little like a golf course (with a barn on it).

 

We're fighting this. We'll fight it with the township and if that doesn't succeed, we'll get a lawyer. The fact is that we didn't spend most of our savings just to act as caretakers for a pretty suburban parkland for our neighbors to admire. We bought this place in order to make it functional and to please us in terms of our aesthetic. There's a lot at stake here, including whether or not we stay or sell, which would be devastating for us. We're also afraid that fighting this is going to rapidly deplete the remainder of our savings, and this leaves little room to take this measure...

 

...in order to preserve our sanity, we would like to build a fence. We'd need a solid fence between our house and his house, because he's also a bit of a peeping Tom. But he's not the only neighbor who has issues with us (for the same reasons, though), and so we'd like to put a fence up along the rest of that side of our property as well. We're thinking a cheaper wire fence on which we could grow thick vines. We have a total of 5.38 acres, with a total of about 1,175 feet we'd like to fence in, 3'-8' in height, in accordance with township ordinances. $10,000 won't even touch all of that, but if we could get the solid fence up between us and our most immediate problem, that would be a huge relief and then we could see what we could do about the rest of it on our own.

What We Need & What You Get

$10,000 will cover the solid fence in the most needed section, and its installation. It's amazing how expensive this stuff is. If there is anything left over from what we've raised, it will go towards more fencing, extending it further along the property line.

 

What will you get in return? First and foremost, you'll get the satisfaction that you're helping a couple of pretty decent folk make a complete jerk extremely unhappy. You'll also make those two people extremely happy by finally being able to walk out of their house without feeling harassed.

 

You'll also get things! Thanks to the generous donations of friends and family, you could receive a monster bunny, a conpany logo design, and more! I myself (Kriscinda) will be happy to make a lovely, warm afghan throw in the colors of your chosing! We'll keep adding perks as we find them...


Most importantly, you will get the satisfaction that you are helping irritate some folks who don't know how to mind their own #$%^&* business.

 

If we don't reach $10,000, whatever money we can raise will still go to the cost of the fence. Any help is help we need.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially to this campaign, please share it in any way you can. The more eyeballs that see it, the closer we will be to living with a little peace here. We think---we certainly hope---that in the end, we'll prevail, even if it means bringing them into court and citing the Constitution. In the meantime (and forever, really), we'd like to at least not have to watch them, watching us, and waiting for them to pick apart the next thing they become fixated on...

story:
About Me... 

My name's Aimee and I'm a PhD student at Oxford Brookes University in the UK. I’ve been passionate about tropical deforestation issues since I became aware of them as a child. After learning more through studying a Masters in 2010, and consolidating my thoughts and ideas over years of volunteering and working in tropical forests, I’m now beginning my own project and starting my journey to make a difference in a conservation issue that’s truly urgent.


The Problem...

Some of the main causes of tropical forest loss and fragmentation include clearing areas of forest to make way for crops, roads and human settlements, all driven by a growing human population. In Uganda, this rate of forest loss is alarming, leaving the chimpanzees (as well as all the other species!) that live in the now-cleared forest exposed to these human activities and potentially prone to local extinction. The situation is urgent to find ways for humans and chimpanzees to coexist peacefully and to protect them in the long-term. 

Chimpanzees in a heavily disturbed, recently burnt patch of forest. Photo credit: Kimberley Hockings

This begins with understanding exactly how chimpanzees are affected by these threats – most research so far has focused on how humans perceive and react to the chimpanzees with little attention given to the chimpanzees themselves. With this information it will be possible to develop the most informed and targeted conservation strategies that take into account how chimpanzees react to human activities, as well as vice versa!

Your contributions will be vital to get this project off the ground, starting research which will not only contribute to the protection of the chimpanzees in this study, but will feed into conservation strategies in other areas where human influences are ever-expanding. 


How am I going to do it?

My research is independently designed and conducted, as I’ve been developing my questions and methods over the past couple of years, learning from my previous experiences collecting data on primates in tropical forests. 

The project will adopt a comparative approach, comparing one chimpanzee community which inhabits protected, continuous forest in the Budongo Forest Reserve with chimpanzees living in very heavily disturbed and unprotected forest only about 20km away. These chimpanzees are living in forest fragments surrounded by roads, large-scale sugar crops, small holdings, human settlements and gardens. I’ll follow the chimpanzees from when they get up in the morning until they nest in evening, taking data on their social dynamics and behaviour, particularly paying attention to stress-related behaviours, as well as on the structure of the habitat, including recording various human habitat disturbances. I’ll then be able to make a comparison between the two chimpanzee communities in order to see how they react to a variety of different habitat types and disturbances, which will be used to inform better land management and conservation strategies.

An example of forest clearance in unprotected habitat outside Budongo Forest Reserve. Photo credit: Matthew McLennan

Extremely little research has been carried out in such exposed and degraded habitats to date, yet these are the habitats with the most at-risk wildlife! I’ll be the first person to go conduct a long-term study on this exposed community which means that my research presence and interactions with the local community should, over time, improve local understanding of chimpanzees.  I’ll employ and train a local assistant and make sure that there’s clean, filtered water to drink and a reliable source of electricity for all electrical items essential for data collection. 


The Impact...

I will be hosted by the Budongo Conservation Field Station whilst in Budongo Forest Reserve, and my results will feed into their community conservation programme, which includes outreach and education projects as well as an anti-snare project (a large proportion of the chimpanzees have snare injuries). 

As a result of very little information on chimpanzees in heavily disturbed habitats, this project will shed light on how different disturbance types (like crops and roads) affect chimpanzees on a very detailed level. These can feed in to strategies such as developing novel methods to deal with human-wildlife conflict and my results will inform the IUCN guidelines on these, which are co-authored by one of my supervisors.  In fact, my supervisory team at Brookes are all leading experts in this subject area, meaning that together we can work towards finding some real solutions.


Your support...

All the generous support you give will go towards the set up and running of the project, starting in late September, when I will collect preliminary data and organise logistics such as a setting up a base in the village. The funds are broken down like this:

To give you more of an idea of what you could support….

  • £25 will cover the salary of a local assistant for one week
  • £50 will cover a month’s worth of food
  • £100 will cover the water filter for clean drinking water
  • £200 will cover a solar-powered generator needed to recharge all electrical equipment
  • £350 will cover a whole month of station fees for the Budongo Conservation Field Station

As a symbol of gratitude to thank you for your generosity, I'm offering some great perks which I hope will encourage you to support this project. These include some great photos to send or put on your wall, from greetings cards to large canvases, conference passes to see me present my final results and a chance to meet and hear inspirational talks on primate conservation and, lastly, the honour of naming a wild chimpanzee which will be studied for years to come! 

I'm really excited about this project - I am really grateful for any support you can provide to get it started. I'm super passionate about finding conservation solutions, and that starts with research and understanding the problems. This will be a huge step in my life's work in this area, trying to make a difference in whatever way I can, however large or small that turns out to be - watch out Jane Goodall! 

Many thanks go to Andrew Walmsley for his invaluable help shooting and editing the video with me, and to Kim Hockings and Matt McLennan for their superb photos from the field!

story:
Our Story

Nearly thirteen years ago my husband and I landed on the West Side of Providence and fell in love with the neighborhood.  Since then, we've opened a successful business (Healing Paws) here, added two human children to our furry family, and created an urban mini-farm next to our house.  This spring, we are embarking on a brand new adventure - opening a full service veterinary center, the first for our neighborhood. 

We were lucky enough to be able to buy a huge corner lot on a major thoroughfare (and within walking distance of our home) where the new hospital will be opening.  As a former car sales lot, it is all asphalt, something we desperately want to change!  However, gutting and rebuilding the garage building into a new and functional animal hospital has required the bulk of our bank loan, leaving very little left over to beautify the outdoor space.

We love our corner of Providence and want to give this long-neglected asphalt lot an environmentally-conscious face-lift as a gift to the neighborhood: to the people who wait for the bus right outside our fence, to all the dogs and their owners who regularly pass by, to those neighbors whose homes face our lot, and to all who walk or drive by everyday.  We all deserve to be surrounded by beauty, rather than cracked asphalt and weeds; it makes everyone feel better! 

The Plan

We have worked with local Greencircle Design to come up with a landscape plan.  Phase 1 includes installing 12 fruit trees to form a mini orchard and planting pollinator gardens in the three long, narrow grass strips just outside our property.  We are using local non-profit Groundwork Providence to depave large portions of asphalt to accommodate the trees but for now, the rest of the non-parking portion of the lot will remain asphalt while we determine how best to use it.  We welcome neighbors' input!

Your contributions to this project will help pay for:
  • equipment and labor needed to cut through and pull up the asphalt ($4,000)
  • labor to dig out the twelve 3ft. x 5ft. tree pits ($2,500)
  • trees (12 @ approximately $75 each) and flowers for pollinator beds (approximately $1,100)    

    Why this matters

    Urban centers like Providence are filled with impervious surfaces like concrete and asphalt, meaning that when it rains, the stormwater has nowhere to go except into our storm drains.  As the water runs off of asphalt parking lots, sidewalks, and roadways, it collects all the pollutants found in a city: oil, pesticides, salt, plastics, antifreeze, and heavy metals.  Then the water, along with the pollutants, makes it's way into our waterways where it can have devastating longterm effects on those natural habitats. [Watch this cool video about "water cycling" produced for another local non-profit, Woonasquatucket River Watershed Council.]

    Asphalt and concrete also hold heat and cause the temperature in cities to be elevated causing what's known as "the heat island effect."  Absent vegetation or moisture that could absorb the heat and cool the surrounding area, the asphalt retains the heat during the day and then releases it in the evening.  No wonder it's always at least 10-15 degrees cooler at the beach! 

    This project, in our tiny corner of Providence, won't change the city's summer temperatures or completely alleviate the amount of pollutants making their way into Narragansett Bay, but it is a positive step in the right direction.  What it will do is beautify this part of our neighborhood, lessen rainwater runoff, support a host of pollinators and small animals, enhance our air quality, and offer a calming, noise-reducing oasis in a busy part of the city.  Not to mention all the yummy fruit we will be sharing with friends and passersby alike!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help us get the word out about this project by sharing with your friends and networks!

story:
At the Resource Conservation District in San Mateo County, we are passionate about farms and the environment. The RCD provides practical solutions and real results for people, nature, and agriculture.  We believe in the win-win and have been helping farmers grow food sustainably for over 75 years.

We were awarded a $75,000 Conservation Innovation Grant from the USDA to study the effects of biochar on soil nutrient retention and crop yield, while assessing the economic benefit for local farmers to use biochar as a conservation practice.  The total project cost is $94,000 and we need to raise the remaining $19,000 to complete this valuable project.

Biochar is produced by heating organic biomass under low-oxygen conditions, producing a charcoal that preserves much of the original carbon in the parent material.  It has been well documented as a highly stable source of carbon which can establish a long-term sink for atmospheric carbon dioxide, reduce greenhouse gas emissions from soils, increase soil moisture, retain excess nutrients, and improve general soil health.

Please help us close a critical funding gap!  Every tax-deductible dollar that you donate now will leverage up to $5 for climate friendly farming.

We were awarded a $75,000 Conservation Innovation Grant from the USDA to study the effects of biochar on soil nutrient retention and crop yield, while assessing the economic benefit for local farmers to use biochar as a conservation practice.  The total project cost is $94,000 and we need to raise the remaining $19,000 to complete this valuable project.Biochar is produced by heating organic biomass under low-oxygen conditions, producing a charcoal that preserves much of the original carbon in the parent material.  It has been well documented as a highly stable source of carbon which can establish a long-term sink for atmospheric carbon dioxide, reduce greenhouse gas emissions from soils, increase soil moisture, retain excess nutrients, and improve general soil health.Please help us close a critical funding gap!  Every tax-deductible dollar that you donate now will leverage up to $5 for climate friendly farming.

story:
We are E.DAS.A., an environmental non-profit association that has been watching over the beautiful mountains surrounding Athens, Greece over the past 30 years by spotting and reporting forest fires. When a fire breaks out, our volunteer fire-fighters rush to the field to assist the Fire Service.

Greek forests have been devastated by wildfires in recent years. During the summer, the Fire Service is stretched thin and needs all the help it can get. That is why each night of the fire season a small group of E.DAS.A. volunteers carries out look-out shifts, overseeing mount Parnitha and the surrounding area. From their vantage point, they can relay timely fire reports, even for fires that break out in very distant places. Meanwhile, our small fire truck patrols the forest, capable of putting out forest fires before they spread.

Beyond its focus on forest fires, E.DAS.A. is all about the protection of the environment, carrying out activities such as reforestation, public awareness campaigns, hiking trail maintenance, presentations in schools and more.

Throughout the years, more than 4000 volunteers have participated in 2237 EDASA night shifts, spotting 215 forest fires. Additionally, the volunteer crews operating our fire truck (acquired in 2008 thanks to a donation by British Airways) have performed 652 patrols in the Parnitha National Park and helped putting out 45 forest fires

However, the financial crisis ravaging Greece has led the private sector sponsorships that support us to drop dramatically.

With your contribution, we will be able to continue our work. All funds raised will go towards providing material support to our groups and keeping our call center —where all volunteers’ shifts are organized— operational.

Help us keep our people in the fire look-outs. Help us keep the fire suppression team going.

Help us protect Attica’s most important lung. Help us protect Parnitha.

story:
Depuis 2003, je suis Gérante de J3D où je supervise les aspects financiers, administratifs et commerciaux de la société. Les opérations de celle-ci sont axées sur le développement de procédés novateurs et écologiques.

Recherche et développement, promotion dans le Monde d’un procédé breveté pour la production d’eau douce à partir de l’atmosphère. Co-Inventeur et copropriétaire du brevet « Moyens  d’échange thermique liquide/gaz, notamment eau/air, et système de production d’eau à partir de l’humidité de l’air comprenant de tels moyens».

J’ai contribué au projet de développement et de recherche Oilmatic, un procédé qui traite biologiquement les huiles et solvants contaminés par des éléments radioactifs. Je suis Co-Inventeur et copropriétaire d’un brevet « procédé pour traiter des huiles contaminées par des radioéléments » (N°2963846 INPI).

J’ai également travaillé pendant 10 ans dans le Groupe CONDAT, spécialiste en lubrification, lubrifiants industriels, graisses, huiles, traitement des bois,… avec CDR (Chaudronnerie des Roches) SA Groupe SNIG et au milieu des années 1990, j’ai été assistante technique à SICMA (Société industrielle et commerciale de matériaux anti polluants) à Paris, traitement des effluents radioactifs – Suivi et contrôle des produits et analyses biologiques- Sur des chantiers à l’étranger, notamment construction d’une papeterie à Saïda et cimenterie à Constantine (Algérie) où j’étais chargée du cost-control.

Diplômée universitaire en physique/chimie de la Faculté des Sciences de Lyon (1973). J’ai également étudié les mécanismes réactionnels et fonctionnels des bioconversions, notamment des métaux.

LE PROJET :

Développer un procédé qui va dans le sens du Développement Durable, un procédé qui profitera à tous et fournira au marché un produit utile. Comme cela a été souvent exposé, la « guerre de l’eau » a commencé. L’avenir, c’est aujourd’hui et nous nous devons d’en faire quelque chose de bien. Chacun, à sa façon, a le devoir d’y participer.

 

COMMENT REALISER CE PROJET

Prouver le concept - Cela a été fait par le programme R&D qui a été appliqué ces 6 dernières années

Des spécifications techniques de conception, et plans de fabrication,  ont été réalisés pour des unités de taille diverses

Identifier le Marché : de nombreux contacts nationaux et internationaux ont exprimé  leur intérêt pour le produit

La conception a été améliorée au cours de la R&D. Il s’agit maintenant d’obtenir le capital nécessaire à la fabrication de plusieurs unités de démonstration et à leur implantation sur site dans diverses régions du Monde.

Nous avons les clients potentiels, un prototype fonctionnel qui nous a permis de produire 720 Litres/jour en France

Il nous reste maintenant à produire les unités de démonstrations qui reprennent l’ensemble des conclusions de nos études.


Le « capital » nécessaire afin de poursuivre le développement de ce projet est de 200 000 € qui seront utilisés selon tableau ci-après. Des clients potentiels ont demandé qu’une unité de démonstration soit présentée avant de passer des commandes fermes et/ou d’acheter des licences.

 

Postes du budget pour 3 unités 3 m3/jour

Montant en Euros

Contrôle Qualité

  21 000

Fabrication

27 000

Matière première – matériau

12 000

Accessoires – fournitures

21 000

Emballage pour expédition

4 500

Administratif-gestion- Personnel-Ingéniérie-BE-Commercial-Communication…(sur 8 mois)

114 500

TOTAL

200 000

Je remercie tous ceux qui s'intéresseront à ce projet, n'hésitez pas à en parler autour de vous, et merci par avance pour votre solidarité. C'est un beau et bon projet, avec un produit solidaire, pour lequel je me bats depuis des années, l'eau fait couler beaucoup d'encre, moi je fais couler de l'eau !

Montant en Euros




Contrôle Qualité


  21 000




Fabrication


27 000




Matière première – matériau


12 000




Accessoires – fournitures


21 000




Emballage pour expédition


4 500




Administratif-gestion- Personnel-Ingéniérie-BE-Commercial-Communication…(sur 8 mois)


114 500




TOTAL


200 000







Je remercie tous ceux qui s'intéresseront à ce projet, n'hésitez pas à en parler autour de vous, et merci par avance pour votre solidarité. C'est un beau et bon projet, avec un produit solidaire, pour lequel je me bats depuis des années, l'eau fait couler beaucoup d'encre, moi je fais couler de l'eau !

story:
Bamboo Skateboards, located in Oceanside, CA, is an eco-friendly skateboard brand and manufacturer of high quality skateboards and longboards made of sustainable bamboo from managed forests. In 2008 a team of skaters and entrepreneurs decided to accept the challenge of coming up with an environmentally-friendly alternative to maple decks that they could introduce into the short board market; a feat that was virtually untouched at the time. Since its monumental launch, Bamboo Skateboards has grown in recognition and popularity and is found online, as well as in skate shops across the country and around the world.

 


 

Fundamental to Bamboo Skateboards are two principal factors: Sustainability and Philanthropy.

With an estimated 6+ million skateboards produced annually, this industry has now become one of the leading causes of maple deforestation throughout the world. By using bamboo - which is a grass, not wood - as an alternative material for producing skateboards, we will be able to help preserve our forests, reduce soil erosion, and improve the air & water quality of our planet.

Philanthropy is at the forefront for Bamboo Skateboards. We partner with many charities and non-profit organizations that benefit from every sale we make.  Grind for Life, Red Cross, World Wildlife Fund and Musicares are just a few of our alliances. In 2012, Bamboo Skateboards also launched an in-house charitable program known as "100 decks for 1" through which a portion of deck sales are given back to local at-risk youth in the form of complete skateboards. Can you imagine the difference a free skateboard could make for a child who is unable to afford one?


By contributing to our campaign, you will help a small company with a unique product and powerful message compete with highly established pro skateboard brands. This funding will allow us to raise awareness about global deforestation, expand our eco-friendly product line and become a force in the industry. Everyone loves the underdog!

In this first round of funding, we need $15,000. This money will help us raise awareness of global deforestation and the growing environmental issues caused by skateboard manufacturing, expand our eco-friendly product line and ultimately evolve the skateboard industry. $15,000 will allow us to purchase approximately 2 months of traditional advertising in the major skate magazines such as Transworld.  This will allow approximately 100,000 new skateboarders to learn about our company.  We have worked tirelessly to come up with a brilliant marketing campaign, and it is time we unleashed it!

- Shout outs from us on your Twitter or Facebook.

- Autographed collage of our AM skate team in action – These guys are the future of skateboarding. Here is your chance to say you knew them before they made it big!

- Limited edition t-shirts – Get a rad, eco-friendly, Bamboo Skateboards t-shirt!


 




 

- Corporate sponsorships – Pledge $1000 and we’ll show our appreciation by providing your company with marketing exposure on our website and social media pages.

- Opportunities – Get involved and experience first hand what’s most important to us. Hang out with the team at the Oceanside Bamboo Skateboards office or attend charitable events where we give skateboards to at-risk youth.  The ability to help others is truly the greatest gift!

We are a company that believes we can invoke positive change to benefit the world. This belief is fundamental to who we are and is extremely valuable to everyone who supports our cause!

There are over 12 million skateboarders in the USA and more than 18 million globally. Bamboo matures in 3-5 years while a maple tree can take up to 60 years. Realising the incredible influence that skateboarding has on people around the world, and the obvious advantages to using bamboo over maple for manufacturing, it became clear that we needed to lead an industry wide transition to a stronger, lighter, and more environmentally friendly material.

We love our fans, and our fans love our skateboards. We’ve received messages from customers all over the world who are stoked that our boards are lasting them on average 3 weeks longer than the maple skateboards they used to skate. Just another way Bamboo Skateboards is working hard to evolve skateboarding.


 

1. Buy a skateboard!

With your purchase, you will be making a real difference in people's lives.

2. Tell your friends about Bamboo Skateboards!

Share the link to this site on all your social media platforms.  Love is the movement!

3. Support the #30toSkate Trend!

Every day we will be giving you a new reason to ride our bamboo skateboards and we need your help to get the word out! Re-tweet our posts and use #30toSkate in your own to make it trend. Together, we'll inspire the world!

Want to know more?  Click on our Gallery Tab at the top of the page for videos and photos.  

Check out our social media links below or visit our website at www.bambooskateboards.com!

 

FAQ

If my question isn't answered here, how do I ask?

Just email us: info@bamboosk8.com

When will my items be delivered?

Shipping dates range from September to October, depending on which perk you choose.  Look at the bottom of each perk for specific details.

Is there a charge for International Shipping?

Yes, there will need to be an additional charge to ship internationally, which is indicated in the perks section.  Please include that in the checkout price.  If you forget, we'll contact you prior to shipping to finalize those details.

Is there a warranty for a bamboo skateboard?

There is no warranty on skateboards, but should you have any issue, email us.  We pride ourselves on our exceptional high quality and killer customer service.x

What percentage of donations go to the charities?

Our website lists the charity with which each skateboard is associated. $2 per online deck sold goes to the World Wildlife Fund, National Wildlife Federation, Musicares, and $10 goes to the American Red Cross.  As part of our “100 decks for 1 program," we donate 1 complete skateboard for every 100 decks sold online. We want to make the business model as transparent as possible and never want you to have to ask the question, "And then what?"  With that said we will not only tell you what, we will show you what!

 

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
UPDATE - 11/23

Thank you to everyone who contributed to our campaign for solar energy at Thoreau's birthplace!
We raised $7,100 here and $1,500 offline for a total of $8,600 toward the $12,000 match and our total goal of $25,000. We also received an equipment donation which will defray the project cost by nearly $2,000. We continue to fund raise for the balance through our website at thoreaufarm.org. 
Because of your generosity, we WILL be installing solar at Thoreau Farm around the end of the year - yay! Once again, thank you all for your support!

UPDATE - 11/22

This is it! Last day of our Indiegogo campaign and we still need $4,000 to get a $12,000 match from a generous donor. Henry is the original environmentalist - solar energy for his birthplace is a perfect way to honor his legacy. Make a donation today, just $10 will help!


UPDATE - 11/19

We must get to $12,000 to get the match a donor has pledge, which will put us within $1,000 of our total goal. We have raised $7,500 (here and offline). Will you help us raise $4,500 in the next 4 days? 

This video shows another reason why solar energy is so important to Henry's birthplace! Please spread the word by sharing with your friends.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8KkYJbK2qwc&feature=youtu.be


UPDATE - 11/15

"Walking" or "Sitting"? That's up to you! Take a look at this video and then please make a donation to our effort to install solar energy at Henry's birthplace - it's so important! 

Thank you to all who have given! We still need to raise another $6,500 in the next 7 days to get a matching gift of $12,000. Will you help???

http://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=_bteXNitNPY


UPDATE - 11/15

Great story in yesterday's Boston Globe about our solar energy project!

http://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/regionals/west/2013/11/14/thoreau-birthplace-launches-bid-solar/ANIGJTYv5OAppi0z1kJi0M/story.html


UPDATE - 11/12

We have raised nearly $4,000 here and $1,000 offline - we still need $7k and we have just 11 days left to get the full $12,000 match!! Watch this new video and see just how important solar energy is for Henry David Thoreau's birthplace.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GcNOx_TbzAI


BIG NEWS!

Big news! To help us reach our goal an anonymous donor has stepped forward with a challenge - he will match every donation we receive dollar-for-dollar up to $12,000!

This means your gift has TWICE the value and will get us to our goal TWICE as fast. PLUS your gift gets you fun and unique perks listed to the right.

Thank you to all you have already contributed! We're off to a good start but we still have a long way to go. Please help Henry go solar - make a tax-deductible gift today!


THE PROJECT

Henry David Thoreau is going off the grid once again, 168 years after his famous experiment in living deliberately in a simple cabin at Walden Pond! Thoreau Farm needs $25,000 to fund a solar photovoltaic system for the birthplace of Henry David Thoreau, America’s first and most influential environmentalist.

Thoreau's birthplace came dangerously close to being razed to make way for a housing development, but the Thoreau Farm Trust, a nonprofit organization, led the effort to save and restore the site in a manner befitting Thoreau's legacy as a prominent and influential writer, philosopher, and naturalist. In 2010, we opened this important landmark to the public for the first time in its history. Today the house is visited from people from around the globe who are inspired by Thoreau’s timeless ideas on life, nature, and civic responsibility.

“What is the use of a house if you haven't got a tolerable planet to put it on?” Henry David Thoreau

In honor of Thoreau's standing as father of the environmental movement and in the spirit of living deliberately, the Thoreau Farm Trust carefully integrated “green” materials and technology into the restoration of Thoreau’s birthplace while carefully maintaining the historic integrity of the building. We now have one final project…

“No sun illuminates me.” Henry David Thoreau

Our dream is to install a solar photovoltaic system at Thoreau’s birthplace and produce our own electricity. The system has been already been specced out and approved by the organization's Board of Directors. Preliminary permissions have been obtained from all relevant parties for the system's installation. Thoreau Farm has experience managing a capital project such as this, having successfully raised $900,000 and overseen significant work to the site already. We just need the funding to move it forward!

We urgently need your help to accomplish this goal! We need to raise $25,000 in the next 30 days to have the system installed by the end of the year because:

  • We want to have the system up and running before another cold New England winter when we rack up a majority of our electric use
  • Rebates and credits for solar energy will be considerably less favorable in 2014

You can help us reach our goal - and get cool perks! Please take a look at the giving levels to the right and make your gift today!

THE IMPACT

The solar pv system will have the following impact on our organization:

  • Economic - by being able to generate our electricity we will save $2,000-$3,000 in operating costs per year.
  • Environmental - we will no longer have to use electricity generated from non-renewable sources (we use a low temp heat pump for climate control, which needs electricity to operate so a solar pv system will enable us to be completely non-dependent on any fossil fuels, even for our heating and cooling needs).
  • Education - we use all the green features at Thoreau's birthplace to educate visitors on how we can all be more environmentally conscious.

You Can Help

A donation of any amount is welcome, and all donations make a difference. Take a look to the right for the unique perks we're offering. Whether you make a donation or not, please spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends and contacts.

Thank you!!!
