We understand that some people cannot contribute financially, but there are other very important ways to help!
Get the word out by sharing our campaign with your friends and contacts!
Take advantage of the Indiegogo tools for sharing to Facebook, Twitter, and more!
If you have friends with relevant blogs, give them a recommendation to feature us on their blog. 
STRETCH GOAL! The money we raise beyond our goal will go towards registering a Non-Profit Organization called GAIA (Global Abundance In Action). The cost of this process is around $3,000, bringing our stretch goal to just over $15,000. The Mission of GAIA is to bring Permaculture Education and Infrastructure to underserved communities, encouraging global abundance through local, grassroots action. The PermaculTourism Initiative is the first phase of this long term, regenerative movement. What is Permaculture?There are many ways of defining this vastly applicable system of design; here are a few of our favorites: 
“Permaculture is defined as consciously
designed landscapes which mimic the patterns and relationships found in Nature,
while yielding an abundance of food, fiber, and energy for the provision of
local needs… More precisely, I see Permaculture as the use of systems thinking
and design principles that provide the organizing framework for implementing
the above vision.”                 -David Holmgren, co-founder of Permaculture
“Observe Nature thoroughly, rather than labor thoughtlessly.”         –Masanobu Fukuoka
“Permaculture is the art of the
Possible”      -Graham Bell
“Permaculture is a Revolution disguised as Organic Gardening”  -Graham Burnett
Our CurriculumThis Practice-Intensive Permaculture Course will provide participants and locals with the opportunity to learn a diverse spectrum of skills and practices including: THANK YOU for supporting us by donating, sharing the link (igg.me/at/permacultourism), and for caring about our vision of a healthy, thriving planet!

story:
What Exactly is S.A.F.E. Earth © ?

 

S.A.F.E. Earth is a first of its kind, website based and fully social media linked program designed to support the growth of a global grass roots sustainability movement.  The online portal will put all of the necessary tools to save Mother Earth right at your fingertips. 

The S.A.F.E. Earth Team will roll out the comprehensive sustainability support program featuring an on-line Sustainability Resource Center.   It will offer a wide range of affordable green tech support apps, introductory guides to sustainable action, on-line webinars, subscription-based support services, and much more.  All tools and resources will be offered in the 2 major global Climate Zones: 1) Cold / Temperate, and 2) Tropical.  Further, most apps will uniquely address issues that are particular to urban & rural settings.

S.A.F.E Earth will also be home to the  “1-1” Action Program, a 3-Step program designed to guide small groupings of individuals, families, and organizations - working together - toward successful pursuit of sustainable action.  

S.A.F.E. Earth On-line Resource Center 

"Get-It-Right-The-First-Time” © Tech Support Apps

These colorful, user-friendly guide apps will provide an overview of the essential “do's and don’ts” of sustainable green technology application, as well as step-by-step tutorials addressing proper project planning, start-up, operations, maintenance, monitoring, and "finished product" harvesting – all designed to help all users avoid the most commonly made mistakes by those pursuing sustainable actions. 

The first in the multiple series of Apps include in the first phase: Solar Electric-PV, Organic Composting, Rainwater Harvesting, Waste water Re-use, Energy Efficiency Upgrade, and Renewable Energy Technology Selection.

  


The Sustainability Master Framework App

The Sustainability Master Framework app introduces the user to truly sustainable actions by presenting model reference projects and encouraging the user to explore the integrated nature of the five (5) main “green” technology areas.



The “1-1” Action Program:  Small Groups -- Together -- Making Global Sustainability Progress 

The Program steps include:

Step 1: Get Inspired … Get Started!  Watch the Intro Video & Get Ready to Start,

Step 2: Get Organized … Get Going! Complete a Sustainable Action Plan and implement the plan;

Step 3:  Share Your Results.  Get Connected!  Complete a simple results survey; link on-line w/ other "1-1" Program participants in your area ... & around the world!

The SAFE Earth Website will also be the home of the “1-1” Action Program, a 3-Step program designed  to guide small groupings of individuals, families, and organizations - working together - toward successful pursuit of sustainable action.  We at SAFE Earth expect the "multiplier effect" resulting from these small group actions pursued locally, regionally, and, ultimately, globally, will help turn short term mobilizations - such as the recent global network of Climate Control mass marches - into long-term action toward achieving global sustainability.

The S.A.F.E. EARTH rallying cry is “One-One, Bring the Balance, Save Mother Earth!”, borrowing from the name of the traditional mutual aid program of St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands: “One-One – Fill De Basket”.  

The Grant + Fern-Kuzenski “1-1” Team

Roy Fern and Sue Kuzenski at home with their 10 kW Wind system

Richard Grant and Rita Dudley-Grant at home with their 5 kW Solar-PV system

 

The Grant + Fern-Kuzenski “1-1” Team cooling out and doing the SAFE Earth "1-1" Rallying Cry after a productive Team meeting.

"The amount of valuable information our "1-1" Team has shared --- while having a good time -- has been amazing.  With the help of the Team, I started composting after our first Team meeting, got a hang of it, and I'm now in the process of introducing composting at our local  youth rehabilitation center where I'm  Director of Clinical Services.  Who knew Saving Mother Earth could be so rewarding --- and so much fun?"   

 Rita Dudley-Grant,  Team Member


What We Need & What You Get

The S.A.F.E. Earth Team over the past two- and a half years worked hard to successfully  complete the entire S.A.F.E. Earth program and product lines to the "proof of concept" level. This includes the preliminary design of support apps and a website framework.  The app and website design work enabled us to complete a realistic budget for final development, beta testing and release.  


We estimate the final cost of app and website production alone to be approximately $282,000 or 72% of the total  $395,000 required. The remaining costs include  operations and legal services. 

The pie chart illustrates where the funds will go to open and launch S.A.F.E. Earth portal, apps and service program.

PERKS: Power of One and Legacy 

For your generous support, we offer a variety of Perks at different levels to acknowledge your contributions, starting from $10 for the Power of One donation up to Legacy Donors from $1,000 - $20,000 to a "Founder" contributing $50,000.  Click on the Perks to see all the exciting details!  There is something for everyone! 

The Impact

Together  —  We Can Meet Our Biggest Global Challenge Yet…But Right Now We Need Your Help!

Sustainability: More than a Theory — A Movement!

No longer just a theoretical concept, sustainability -- The Balancing of “3-Ps” : People / Planet /  Productivity , or in business terms, “The Triple Bottom Line”, is now the cause and potential global movement that can finally bring together the global environmental/“climate action”, the equity-“99%”, and the poverty alleviation movements -- all towards creating a future that enjoys a balanced global climate AND socially balanced and healthy global communities.  


Tracking and Celebrating Our Progress!

"Its easy to be discouraged by today's dire predictions of worsening climate and economic challenge around the world -- but not if you are taking stock of progress right in your own backyard!"    Onaje Jackson, S.A.F.E. Earth founder

What is our “1-1” Team’s carbon footprint and  social benefit index today — and what improvements will we achieve after we implement  our sustainable action plans? S.A.F.E. Earth addresses this very important question and helps individuals take stock of and celebrate their progress through a number of program mechanisms, two such initiatives include:

·The Annual Sustainability Progress Report.  

All "1-1" Teams will be asked to share evidence of their progress by filling out a simple on-line survey. The data collected will be compiled throughout the year and published in an Annual Sustainability Progress Report. 

·Annual Sustainability Achievement Awards.  

Global and regional awards for top achievement in sustainable action will be awarded annually and celebrated widely. 


Onaje Jackson: A 25+yr. Sustainability Pioneer

·1980s:  

PV FORCES - Building Integrated PV Think Tank Workshop. 

Onaje organized the 1st US PV Think Tank workshop to explore integration of PV technology in buildings.

·1990s:

Sustainable Water Delivery Systems for Guyana’s Interior Amerindian Communities. 

Onaje managed the planning and implementation of this sustainable water infrastructure project for the World Bank in cooperation with The Guyana Water Authority.  Following a rapid water system assessment of five interior villages, pilot solar-powered and wind-powered village water supply systems were installed at the village of Annai.


Programme  for Belize- 1st Place Winner, 2000 International Eco-Tourism Society, Eco-Tourism Development Award, Belize, Central America

Through his "green" tech firm, Sustainable Systems & Design Int'l (SSDI), Onaje provided architectural design and infrastructure engineering for 100% stand-alone (energy, water, waste recycling) eco-tourism and program support facilities. Innovative building and infrastructure designs garnered 1st Place in the 2000 International Eco-Tourism Award.

"Casa Balanza" 100% stand-alone "green" eco-lodge & bathhouse

Solid waste composting system servicing the eco-lodge & bathhouse 

10 kW stand-alone solar-PV power supply system for eco-lodge & bathhouse


Coral World  Marine Park, and Underwater Observatory-St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands

Onaje provided an energy conservation and renewable energy plan, an Environmental Assessment Report (EAR), and design and install the PV and hydro-electric system for this popular tourist attraction.


·2000s:  

American Solar Energy Society (ASES) Board of Directors -"Legacy Schools Program"

Onaje, as an ASES Board Member, led the establishment of a Legacy Schools Program through which inner-city schools, located in the town in which ASES held its annual meeting, were "adopted" and provided with special educational resources and supports related to renewable energy.

Silverman "Model" Solar Net-metering System - St Croix, US Virgin Islands
The VI Water & Power Authority selected this 5 kW PV system as a model net-metering system for the USVI Territory, recognizing its high-quality design, national code compliance, and outstanding performance.

Home/PV system owner, Sidney Silverman, joins VI WAPA CEO, Hugo Hodge and Jackson to celebrate special recognition of his net-metering PV system by VI WAPA 


The Curacoa Oil Corporation's (CUROIL) Model “Green’ Pump Station: Sustainability Leadership in Action in Curacoa, W.I.

Onaje, through the SSDI Team, completed a “green” facility  master plan for CUROIL featuring  both sustainable building and infrastructure systems supporting their goal of building a Model "Green" Pump Station for Curacoa.  SSDI  employed its “Green Screen®” rapid  sustainability planning approach to achieve its mission.



Food Town  Supermarket "Model" Energy Project: Investment in Energy Efficiency Upgrade + 100 kW Solar-PV Net-metering System, St Croix, USVI
Onaje  completed a "walk-thru" facility energy audit and provided a comprehensive energy upgrade plan for Food Town supermarket owners featuring a "package" of energy efficiency upgrades (14 month simple payback on investment) and a 100 kW solar-PV net-metering system (3 yr simple payback on investment). Following completion of efficiency upgrade measures, the SSDI Team, with top VI Electrical contractor, NR Electric, completed the installation of the 100 kW solar-PV system in February, 2014.


Onaje stands among the 100 kW roof-mounted solar-PV array at Food Town Supermarket

FAQs·

  • Q:  When will the entire S.A.F.E. Earth program, products and web portal be complete and available to the public?
  • A:  The Development Team's goal is to complete the design and development of all apps within 6 months of the release of Indiegogo funds and then complete Beta Testing and final preparation for commercial release within a 2 month period following final design and development.  Therefore, our plan is to have the web portal and all apps ready for full commercial "launch" within 8 months, and no more than 10 months from release of Indiegogo funds.
  • Q:  Will your tech support app products be designed and available for different climate zones?
  • A: Yes, all tools and resources will be offered in the 2 major global Climate Zones: 1) Cold/Temperate, and 2) Tropical.  Further, most apps will uniquely address issues that are particular to urban & rural settings.
  • Q: What will be the price range for the various support app products once they are made available for sale?
  • A: Exact prices for all support products have not been set yet, given that price setting is difficult until final product design and development phase is underway (and we hope to raise sufficient crowd funds to move through this phase quickly). Nevertheless, our Team is committed to keeping all prices  affordable, and offering a wide range of product pricing -- including very low cost for introductory tools, such as the Sustainability Master Framework App.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • While monetary contributions at any and all levels are greatly appreciated, our Team understands and appreciates that non-monetary support is also critical. Therefore, in advance, we thank ALL S.A.F.E. Earth supporters and advocates for using any and all means to get the word out about the campaign AND the exciting new S.A.F.E. Earth program.

  • PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!

    Thank You for your support!!!

story:
Our Story

My name is Sara and I am a student who has been offered an opportunity I have wanted to do for many years but haven't had the time or money. I decided upon graduation this would be the perfect opportunity for me to do something I always wanted to do before I start working on a full-time basis.

I have decided to join the mission created by Volunteer Eco Student Abroad (VESA) and aid indigenous communities in Ecuador.

The Impact

VESA has previously connected with many different communities around the world to discover what the people need most. The communities have requested the aid with building washrooms, creating a filter treatment system for fresh water, and teaching English in elementary schools. I plan to be doing all of this while my stay there.

The people in these communities live by a river and use it for everything, bathing, drinking, eating, washing etc. They are in dire need of washrooms for sanitary reasons.


What We Need & What You Get

In order for me to volunteer with VESA and provide these basic necessities the villages have asked for I need the funds to join. All of the money will be going towards paying for my flights, board and room, and food (program fees). If I do not reach my goal of $4,000 I will not be going this year, but perhaps another year when I have saved enough money to travel.

If I make over 50% of what my goal funds are, I will continue to work over-time and if I can make enough to pay for the rest I will.

If you have always wanted to contribute to helping a community far away but never had the time or money to do so I can share this experience with you.

Even a donation of a $1 would be very helpful! A collective power is much stronger then one large sum, and better for everyone.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, peers, family, instructors, or employers! If you could spread the word that would be a lot of help!

story:
Bonjour et Bienvenue au Pays Cajun!

Hello and Welcome to Cajun/Creole Country!

NUNU'S Arts and Culture Collective is a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts organization dedicated to providing a stage/platform/gallery for creative living by facilitating community, economic, and artistic/cultural development. We are located in Arnaudville, Louisiana and our goal is to educate the public about the importance of the arts and the positive effects it has on preserving and promoting the culture of the Greater Acadiana area. 

        This is NUNU's now, but...

We need your support for the development of Village d' Art et Eco Parc, an expansion of our partnership with Nu Nu's.

The location is on the banks of Bayou Fuselier across the road from Nu Nu's Gallery on a pristine 1.75 acres site. 

The land opens up to fields with gorgeous views of sunrises and sunsets. Along Bayou Fuselier is a dense jungle of tropical vegetation providing the ideal setting for eco tent camping.

Your funds will restore this historical Singleton Lumberyard built in the early 1900's
that joins the pristine terrain and bayou banks for the park.


The former Singleton Lumberyard

                  ...."to transform the old to".... The Village d'Art et Eco Parc

                                                   The BIG PICTURE

                               Artist Rendering of Village d' Art et Eco Parc

The team developing the VILLAGE values this historical landmark and holds a 'vision' of an incredible creative site. The state-of-the-art venues offer local, national and international markets that are culturally diverse with the goal of creating tourism along with French speaking activities.

                                         YOUR DONATION IS NEEDED!

This Village development is divided into two phases:

PROJECT ONE & PROJECT TWO;      

PROJECT ONE is estimated to be completed within 6 months after reaching our goal of $150,000. It will offer numerous renovated vendor stalls, facilities and landscapes. Once this goal of $150,000 is reached, a grand opening celebration will launch the artists' and team members' dream in this little bayou town. Opportunities!

 VISITORS can expect:

Numerous Renovated Stalls offer spaces for:

story_txt:
Bonjour et Bienvenue au Pays Cajun!
Hello and Welcome to Cajun/Creole Country!
NUNU'S Arts and Culture Collective is a 501(c)(3) non-profit arts organization dedicated to providing a stage/platform/gallery for creative living by facilitating community, economic, and artistic/cultural development. We are located in Arnaudville, Louisiana and our goal is to educate the public about the importance of the arts and the positive effects it has on preserving and promoting the culture of the Greater Acadiana area. 
        This is NUNU's now, but...
We need your support for the development of Village d' Art et Eco Parc, an expansion of our partnership with Nu Nu's.
The location is on the banks of Bayou Fuselier across the road from Nu Nu's Gallery on a pristine 1.75 acres site. 


The land opens up to fields with gorgeous views of sunrises and sunsets. Along Bayou Fuselier is a dense jungle of tropical vegetation providing the ideal setting for eco tent camping.
Your funds will restore this historical Singleton Lumberyard built in the early 1900'sthat joins the pristine terrain and bayou banks for the park. 

The former Singleton Lumberyard
                   ...."to transform the old to".... The Village d'Art et Eco Parc
                                                   The BIG PICTURE

                               Artist Rendering of Village d' Art et Eco Parc
The team developing the VILLAGE values this historical landmark and holds a
 'vision' of an incredible creative site. The state-of-the-art venues 
offer local, national and international markets that are 
culturally diverse with the goal of creating 
tourism along with French speaking activities.
                                         YOUR DONATION IS NEEDED!
 This Village development is divided into two phases: 
 PROJECT ONE & PROJECT TWO;       
PROJECT ONE is estimated to be completed within 6 months after reaching our goal of $150,000. It will offer numerous renovated vendor stalls, facilities and landscapes. Once this goal of $150,000 is reached, a grand opening celebration will launch the artists' and team members' dream in this little bayou town. Opportunities!

 Numerous Renovated Stalls offer spaces for:
✓ Artists' Studios & Gallery Space

story:
Our Intent­

We, Revolutionary Gardens and OASIS Project Development Group, are building a fully off-grid, solar heated, thermal-bubble insulated greenhouse, to produce fresh, organic fruits, vegetables and fish all year round. Beyond just growing food, we would like to educate and showcase to everyone how they can sustainably produce nutritious and yummy food for themselves. Our current commercialized food system is not sustainable. The cost of food production in this system is tied directly with the price of fossil fuels through transportation costs, chemical pesticides, and chemical fertilizer production. The burning of fossil fuels, and the use of chemical pesticides and chemical fertilizer are polluting the air, our land, our food and our water. Our OASIS greenhouse project, is one of the many solution focused approaches, to producing urban or near-urban agriculture, and paving the way to a cleaner and less wasteful economy.


Who We Are

Please allow us to introduce ourselves, we are Revolutionary Gardens CSA Greenhouses. Welcome to our sustainable organic world of low-impact, high-intensity, near-urban food production. We have a passion for fresh, sustainable and locally grown food. If you are curious about where food comes from, or why it travels so far to get to our table, or you are interested in eating and living healthier or you love fresh produce, this is where you need to be. Gardening and food sharing builds stronger communities by bring friends and neighbours together for a common cause! Regardless of how you found us, we are living in dangerous times, where healthy, pesticide and chemical free food is uncommon. Join us to start a movement, that allows everyone to produce delicious, healthy, super-nutritious food, all year round!


Our Vision

At Revolutionary Gardens, we believe that small diverse market farms are the answer to high quality produce for all. Because of their smaller size, these markets, can produce well cared for crops and distribute food locally. They can also respond to the needs of communities more quickly. Our long term vision is not only to produce fresh organic produce for local markets and food hubs, but also to educate, through an urban agricultural learning center where we showcase the latest advanced methods in food cultivation, and technology for efficient use of water, energy and time in producing organic vegetables and animal protein. We will be demonstrating the use of aquaponics, bioponics, and aeroponics in our learning centre. Aquaponic growing systems are shown to take half the time to grow crops to harvest with 10% as much water as traditional farming - yielding the most animal protein production recorded of all livestock commercially raised. On average 1 pound of fish protein is produced for every 1 ½ pounds of fish feed invested.


Our Project

Revolutionary Gardens is a leading partner in the OASIS Project Development Group. OASIS stands for Organic Aquaponic Sustainable Integrated System. This project is a collaborative effort, whose mission is to increase local food security and to bring back local food sovereignty. We plan to achieve this by developing urban organic food growing communities and increasing urban food production through outreach, education and access to urban agriculture technology, training and support. Our other partners include Photonics (specialize in Renewable energy), Urban Crops (low cost, open source, urban agriculture technology), and LIFT (Low-Income Families Together), a Non-Profit Resource and Education Centre working on food security and social enterprises in vulnerable urban communities. Our latest project is a pilot test model greenhouse. This state-of-the-art passively heated Solaroof design consists of a 28ft x 56ft tunnel structure nestled inside a 32ft x 60ft structure to create a roughly 2ft thick void filled as needed, with biodegradable, non-toxic soap bubble foam. This allows the OASIS greenhouse to retain thermal energy captured from the sun during the day, and help maintain the system’s dynamic equilibrium throughout the night. This climate control technology will make it possible to grow organic plants and fish year round with minimal energy input. This leading edge technology, provides high-efficiency, high value, and long-term return on investment. In this final phase of building, we plan to install the solar cells, set up the bubble generator and to install the aquaponic systems. To make this fully off-grid and resilient pilot model a success, we need your assistance to raise $15,000, technically $16,129 to cover the fees deducted by Indiegogo.


The Problems with Centralized Food and the Impending Crisis

We as a global community, desperately need to engage in a public discourse on the unsustainable practices of our current commercialized food system.  This system is always under threat for potential disruption and contamination. As a result of the lack of accountability, food poisoning, food shortages, and food wastes incidences occur on a regular basis. In this system food security is always an issue. For example, “trucked” in produce could exorbitantly increase in price with the price of fossil fuels, seasonal changes and natural disasters could interrupt our food supply, traditional mono crop farming year after year depletes the nutrients in soil leading to erosion and the need for artificial chemical fertilization which is also "trucked" in, and commercial "conventional" greenhouses burn massive amounts of fossil fuels to heat.

The irony is that greenhouses are now contributing to greenhouse gas emissions. Is it nonsensical that the typical Canadian meal is transported 2000 km? The current global economy supplies an incredible array of foods to all corners of the earth, but does so at a high cost to the environment.

In today’s modern industrialized world, we have lost our once intimate relationship with food. I have come to realize that community starts with fundamentals of living, and nothing is more fundamental than food. In our fast paced, busy, urban life, we’ve not only become alienated from each other, but also from our food. With all this convenience, technology, abundance and prosperity, most of us don’t even know our neighbours by their first name. When is the last time your shook the hand of the person that raised the chicken you ate for lunch? It’s no wonder so many people take food security for granted, thinking there will always be plenty of it in the supermarket, or their favourite restaurant. Technology undoubtedly makes our lives easier, and connects us in ways our distant ancestors could only have dreamed of, yet most don’t realize that those same ancestors were connected by the food they produced and shared while celebrating life and kinship, in community.


Our Solution

Technology has been referred to as a double edged sword. Like many things in life, it can be beneficial in some respects yet damaging in others. What if someone you’ve never met in person, connected with you through this new virtual community on the internet, and told you there was a way to bring back that connection with our food and our local community. Would you believe them? Would you even be aware of the need for it?  What you are about to discover is that agricultural equipment technology may have contributed to getting us in this predicament, but it’s shaping up to be our saving grace in these rather uncertain times. There is currently a greenhouse technology that allows your local food producers to supply you with fresh, nutritious, and amazingly, out of season, fruits and vegetables with virtually no fossil fuels or environmental impact. In fact, there are a myriad of emergent technologies that are making their way into workshop basements, backyards, and greenhouses in urban locales everywhere. These technological innovations are paving the way to a cleaner and less wasteful economy, and hopefully a cleaner ecosystem too. Some experts are calling this the new “green” economy. The most effective lifestyle choice you can make to promote this emergent economy, a cleaner environment and bill of health, is to choose wisely what you put on your plate.


What do we mean by a green economy, you ask? Simply put, a green economy is low-carbon, resource efficient, and socially inclusive local to global management system. A few distinguishing features are :


1)  Efficient use of energy and other resources. For example, huge economic and environmental gains could be made if we had more energy efficient buildings and transportation.
2)  Use of renewable resources, like wind and solar, instead of non-renewable resources, such as coal and oil
3)  Application of greener manufacturing which is resource efficient and avoids the use of use toxic chemicals.

Urban Agriculture innovators like rooftop gardeners, aquaponic gardeners, and Small Plot Intensive (or Spin) farmers are working hard to reshape our local food growing, production and distribution. These innovators are not acting alone, they are simply the first ones reacting to a groundswell of different ideological shifts in public perception. Terms like foodie or “locavore” describe these trends, and are not only hip sounding, but are part of a whole new language being spawned by the need for food security. The Slow Food movement founded by Carlo Petrini, became an international association in 1989. It now boasts 85,000 members and offices in dozens of countries. Slow Food stresses the need for taste education as the best defense against poor quality and food adulteration, and incursion of fast food into our diets. It helps to safeguard local cuisines, traditional products, vegetable and animal species at risk of extinction. It supports a new model of agriculture, essentially permaculture, which is less intensive and healthier, founded on the knowledge and know-how of local communities. This is the only type of agriculture able to offer prospects for development to the poorest regions on our planet.


Please help this dream manifest into a reality. Contribute today and tell your friends about us too! You can be sure your contribution will go towards supporting local urban and near-urban agriculture. Those who contribute $1000 or more will receive 15% discounts for life on all workshops or gala events to be hosted at this first OASIS greenhouse.

Thanks in advance for your support

story:
The Christy Bradshaw Project

Environmental Presence

I am Christy Bradshaw, brain aneurysm awareness spokesperson and have a background of ten years as an environmental consultant, volunteering much of that time. I have seen the highs and lows of what it is like to stand up for people and the Earth through my efforts. I hope to enlighten people through a TV series that I have written, Environmental Presence, on ways to help our Earth and our people aside from the justice system. Through explorations of religious and other spiritual methods derived through history as well as through scientific methods we will explore ways to heal the Earth and the people from man-made as well as natural contaminations and Earth's natural happenings.  Possibly we can even get confirmation that their are spirits that exist whom are interested in giving their thoughts to us on Earth's happenings that may match what the professionals of the scientific world tell us.

This campaign is very important to me as I hope to educate others through the episodes concerning the Earth, health, and religious/spiritual beliefs on how we are connected to the Earth and how different cultures have chosen to heal the Earth in their views.

Your contributions toward this project will allow us to continue forward in filming. We are featuring the band MR SPOON with their song written by Joel Heslop titled "Shadow" in the pilot.  We have extras of which need to be paid for their presence. What we are asking will most likely not even be enough but it will definitely give us a good start.

Please help me to educate others on these topics by giving today to this campaign. We can change the world if we all do it together. Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. You may use the Indiegogo share tools to help out! :)

Thanks so much,

Christy Bradshaw, M.ED. 

*I am climbing the mountain, not that the world can see ME...so that WE can see the world together the way that it truly is. ~Christy Bradshaw, M.Ed.

* An opportunity to financially contribute to something historic! This series will elighten you on the AMAZING things you never knew our planet! Be a part of unlocking the mysteries and jaw-dropping discoveries on how the most unsuspecting Earthly events interlinks! ~Sherry Anne...Brywood Talent Enterprises

*It’s time to tap into the energy of spiritual awareness and Universal Consciousness. A great healing is needed on our planet. The healing begins in your life first so that you share your experiences, your wisdom, and your healing energy with others. ~Michelle Anne Cox-Lomas, PhD...professional astrologer, psychic and spiritual counselor.

*Everything is connected, each word, each leaf. Each poem, drawn and held together by the thread of our own experience, and the longing of our own Soul to follow the vine back to its root.  ~John Millar

story:
What is Simply Adventure?

Niko and Katie are two climbers, spending 2013 living in a van and traveling around the country to advocate for conservation and positive land stewardship within the climbing and outdoor community - all while promoting the experience of adventure. 

We've noticed two trends in the outdoor industry - first, that there is an exploding population of folks interested in getting outside and exploring the land (which is great). The second is a growing population of adventurers who don't quite understand how to treat the land (which isn't so great).

Simply Adventure is going to create an engaging, interactive, inspiring resource to educate adventurers about how to form sustainable relationships with the outdoors. Rather than discouraging anyone from enjoying the outdoor space, we hope to help create a new generation of outdoorsmen who feel as strongly about protecting the land as they do about exploring it. 

With strong social media influence in the outdoor industry, we have the experience and tools neccesary to reach a wide audience and achieve our goal of inspiring others to embrace a lifestyle that prioritizes sustainability and conservation - but we need your help to fund our mission. 

Over the course of the next year, we'll be aggregating the content and experiences needed to create the ultimate source of information for aspiring outdoor adventurers. First through real-time documentation via social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, as well as daily blog posts on TheMorningFresh.com. Upon the conclusion of our journey, the photos and stories we gather will be compiled into a series of e-books and hardcopy publications.

Beyond a resource for those interested in living the adventure lifestyle, we're creating an entire movement. Adventure is for everyone. 


What We Need & What You Get

The costs of living on the road for a year are pretty hefty - but we've got that covered. Thanks to the generous contributions of our gear sponsors like Goal Zero solar equipment, Stonelick crash pads, ClimbOn! products, and Teton Sports, we've been outfitted with all the camping and clothing needed for our trip. We've also been hoarding change in a glass jar we call, "The Sushi Fund." 

But in order to achieve our goal of creating a digital and print resource for the adventure lifestyle, we need the technical equipment to fuel our mission. Your contributions will go directly towards camera and computer equipment, publication fees, and any costs associated with the promotion of our campaign to gain visibility. With $5000, we can confidently create a lasting movement to shape the future of the outdoor community. 

Here's what your contributions won't be funding: our food costs (don't worry, we're collecting an arsenal of instant mashed potatoes and canned corn beef hash to sustain us), our camping/lodging fees, our climbing equipment, etc. 

In return for your generous contributions, we want to reciprocate the love with a series of contributor perks, including personalized postcards from the road, limited edition t-shirts, and even the chance to come adventure with us during our journey. All contributors will get a shout-out on TheMorningFresh.com's Simply Adventure section, and any contributions over $1000 will qualify for sponsorship status, an excellent way to connect your own business or brand with our project. 

The Impact of Simply Adventure

By contributing to the Simply Adventure campaign, you become a truly valuable member of our project. Your donation is a keystone to enabling us to create the ultimate resource for aspiring adventurers. You'll be helping us keep parks clean, inspire folks to get outside, and ensure that the beautiful American outdoors are preserved for the next generation. 

As a member of Columbia Sportswear's inagural OmniTen crew, the co-host of Twitter's weekly #ATQA Adventure Travel chat, and contributor to GeigerRig's Hydration Summit campaign, Katie is well versed in the art of tapping into the outdoor industry - and together with Niko's passion for biology and conservation, and your support of this project, we're going to make a difference, inspire the outdoor community, and save our lands. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Living on a dirtbag budget? We understand that not everyone who supports our project is able to make a donation. You can make just as valuable of a contribution by lending your voice to spreading the word about Simply Adventure. You can help us gain visility by sharing a link to the campaign on your Facebook page, tweeting about the Simply Adventure project, e-mailing friends and family, and telling your peers in the outdoor community about what we're doing. 

Want to get connected? 

As a project driven largely by social media engagement and interaction, we're all over the web - and we love to connect with people who are interested in what we're doing! Check us out:

  • Facebook - Give a 'like' to the Simply Adventure or The Morning Fresh fan pages.
  • Twitter - Follow us at @TheMorningFresh and @SimplyAdventure.
  • Instagram - Follow @TheMorningFresh and stay visually updated with our adventures.
  • Pinterest - Give our Pinterest boards a gander, we've got everything from gorgeous mountain images to healthy oatmeal recipes.
  • Or, feel free to get in contact with us via e-mail! Shoot a message to katieboue@gmail.com. 

Thank you for supporting Simply Adventure. We can't wait to bring you all along for our epic journey. The adventure officially begins on January 25th!
story_txt:
What is Simply Adventure?
Niko and Katie are two climbers, spending 2013 living in a van and traveling around the country to advocate for conservation and positive land stewardship within the climbing and outdoor community - all while promoting the experience of adventure. 
We've noticed two trends in the outdoor industry - first, that there is an exploding population of folks interested in getting outside and exploring the land (which is great). The second is a growing population of adventurers who don't quite understand how to treat the land (which isn't so great).
Simply Adventure is going to create an engaging, interactive, inspiring resource to educate adventurers about how to form sustainable relationships with the outdoors. Rather than discouraging anyone from enjoying the outdoor space, we hope to help create a new generation of outdoorsmen who feel as strongly about protecting the land as they do about exploring it. 
With strong social media influence in the outdoor industry, we have the experience and tools neccesary to reach a wide audience and achieve our goal of inspiring others to embrace a lifestyle that prioritizes sustainability and conservation - but we need your help to fund our mission. 
Over the course of the next year, we'll be aggregating the content and experiences needed to create the ultimate source of information for aspiring outdoor adventurers. First through real-time documentation via social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, as well as daily blog posts on TheMorningFresh.com. Upon the conclusion of our journey, the photos and stories we gather will be compiled into a series of e-books and hardcopy publications.
Beyond a resource for those interested in living the adventure lifestyle, we're creating an entire movement. Adventure is for everyone. 
What We Need & What You Get


The costs of living on the road for a year are pretty hefty - but we've got that covered. Thanks to the generous contributions of our gear sponsors like Goal Zero solar equipment, Stonelick crash pads, ClimbOn! products, and Teton Sports, we've been outfitted with all the camping and clothing needed for our trip. We've also been hoarding change in a glass jar we call, "The Sushi Fund." 
But in order to achieve our goal of creating a digital and print resource for the adventure lifestyle, we need the technical equipment to fuel our mission. Your contributions will go directly towards camera and computer equipment, publication fees, and any costs associated with the promotion of our campaign to gain visibility. With $5000, we can confidently create a lasting movement to shape the future of the outdoor community. 
Here's what your contributions won't be funding: our food costs (don't worry, we're collecting an arsenal of instant mashed potatoes and canned corn beef hash to sustain us), our camping/lodging fees, our climbing equipment, etc. 
In return for your generous contributions, we want to reciprocate the love with a series of contributor perks, including personalized postcards from the road, limited edition t-shirts, and even the chance to come adventure with us during our journey. All contributors will get a shout-out on TheMorningFresh.com's Simply Adventure section, and any contributions over $1000 will qualify for sponsorship status, an excellent way to connect your own business or brand with our project.

By contributing to the Simply Adventure campaign, you become a truly valuable member of our project. Your donation is a keystone to enabling us to create the ultimate resource for aspiring adventurers. You'll be helping us keep parks clean, inspire folks to get outside, and ensure that the beautiful American outdoors are preserved for the next generation. 
As a member of Columbia Sportswear's inagural OmniTen crew, the co-host of Twitter's weekly #ATQA Adventure Travel chat, and contributor to GeigerRig's Hydration Summit campaign, Katie is well versed in the art of tapping into the outdoor industry - and together with Niko's passion for biology and conservation, and your support of this project, we're going to make a difference, inspire the outdoor community, and save our lands.

You can make just as valuable of a contribution by lending your voice to spreading the word about Simply Adventure. You can help us gain visility by sharing a link to the campaign on your Facebook page, tweeting about the Simply Adventure project, e-mailing friends and family, and telling your peers in the outdoor community about what we're doing. 
Want to get connected? 
As a project driven largely by social media engagement and interaction, we're all over the web - and we love to connect with people who are interested in what we're doing! Check us out:


Facebook - Give a 'like' to the Simply Adventure or The Morning Fresh fan pages.

Twitter - Follow us at @TheMorningFresh and @SimplyAdventure.

Instagram - Follow @TheMorningFresh and stay visually updated with our adventures.

Pinterest - Give our Pinterest boards a gander, we've got everything from gorgeous mountain images to healthy oatmeal recipes.
Or, feel free to get in contact with us via e-mail! Shoot a message to katieboue@gmail.com. 

Thank you for supporting Simply Adventure. We can't wait to bring you all along for our epic journey. The adventure officially begins on January 25th!

story:
What Is The Rickshaw Run?

In January, 2015, we will make a valiant effort to complete the Rickshaw Run. We will fly from the USA to the city of Kochi in the South of India. From Kochi, we will embark on a 1600 mile drive up India’s west coast in a 3-wheeled motorized rickshaw running at a whopping 7 horsepower. What this means is that we’ll be driving roughly the distance between Miami and Boston in a small, beat-up, glorified lawnmower at a blistering 25mph.

On the way to the finish line in Jaisalmer, in the northwest of the country, we will pass through the beautiful beaches of Goa, the chaos of Mumbai, and many other areas of India that we have no idea about quite yet. This rally is fully unguided and unsupported. We create the route, and we will get lost. We aren't mechanically inclined, but we will break down. Repeatedly. But it is all for a good cause and a sense of adventure.

Of course, along the way we will face many challenges; experience numerous cultures, flora and fauna; and likely curse the idea of participating in such a grueling adventure. We will be journaling, photographing, and checking in along the way, and we hope that you, our friends and family, will follow us on our journey.




Who Is Team Marco Yolo?


In order to combine the spirits of exploration and throwing caution to the wind, we are (perhaps regrettably) Team Marco Yolo. We are three dudes who live in New York City, who by the time of the rally will have each just turned 30, and who spend a lot of time cooking up harebrained ideas over platters of oysters. This time, we’re following through with one such idea.


Mike

Mike Abdul is a recent transplant to New York City from Chicago. He is an intellectual property attorney and stand up comic. Mike used his legal expertise to draft the silly napkin contract that got this whole journey started. During the Rickshaw Run, he hopes to find at least $20 on the ground and shake hands with “Tunak Tunak” singer Daler Mehndi.

Brett

Brett Harmon is a New York City transplant by way of Chicago. He will have been 30 for just two weeks at the start of this adventure. Professionally, he is a real estate agent in Brooklyn, though he spends the vast majority of his time accruing and hoarding airline miles, driving across the country, riding his bicycle to the beach, and consuming raw and undercooked seafood.

Brendan

Brendan Sund very recently moved to New York City from the arid wastelands of Los Angeles. One night after a few drinks and a plate of oysters at the local bar, he signed a legally binding napkin contract and now has no choice but to go to India. He is not thrilled.


The Charity: Cool Earth

Cool Earth is the charity that works alongside indigenous villages to halt rainforest destruction.

We know that saving the rainforest isn’t a new idea. Managing to do it is.

Over the last 40 years, half the world’s rainforests have been destroyed. That’s why Cool Earth decided to go about things differently.

Cool Earth doesn't create reserves or put up fences. They don’t buy land. Instead, they put indigenous people back in control of the world’s most endangered rainforest.

These people have lived in the forest for countless generations. Their homes are now on the  frontline of deforestation. They have the most to lose from deforestation.

By building better incomes, better schools and better clinics, Cool Earth gives their partner villages the resources they need to keep their forest intact.

Cool Earth is now working alongside 65 rainforest villages throughout the world.

These partner villages are protecting over 350,000 acres of forest that lie directly in the path of chainsaws and bulldozers.

The clever part is that this forest is forming a shield to make the neighbouring forest inaccessible  to loggers – saving millions of acres of further forest.

At least 90% of each donation to Cool Earth goes directly to their projects. With this support, Cool Earth can put in place the simple steps that change the fate of at-risk rainforest and the lives of their indigenous partners.


What We Need

In order to participate in the Rickshaw Run, we must first raise a minimum of $1,700 for the Cool Earth charity. That's our first big hurdle. But we could also use, and would much appreciate, your help with some of the other costs of the trip, which are as follows:

  • Registration fee
  • Flights to and from India
  • Visas
  • Lodging
  • Fuel

The first $1700 we raise will go toward the minimum charity goal. Thereafter, we will use some of the funds for charity and some to help us turn this insane idea into reality.


How Else You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Here are some other ways we would love for you to lend a hand:

  • Share! There are links on this campaign page to our various social media pages. All the exposure we can get helps, and we're sure you know somebody who would be interested in supporting and/or following along as we progress to and through India.
  • If you think you have any gear or supplies to donate, by all means, let us know. We will be traveling very light, but a camera or a tarp or anything else you think of may come in extremely handy.
  • We hope to hold a fundraising event of some kind between now and the end of the year. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram for updates on our trip and upcoming parties.

Tell your friends. Tell your family. And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for reading, especially if you made it all the way down here. See you in India!

story:
Short Summary

ANIMALIA IN NATURE is a sustainability project that aims to inspire a greater connection with nature in urban Sydney. Our events feature outdoor film screenings of family friendly documentaries of the natural world. 

Guests are invited to participate in a multi-sensory experience by dressing as their favourite animal in line with the each event’s theme. The theme will be based on the film subject, which we will select. For example, “Animalia in the Forests” or “Animalia Under the Sea”.

Each event will be free and will feature roving flora and fauna characters, smoking and growing ceremonies and behaviour change motivational giveaways, allowing guests to be fully immersed within the natural word.

Our first event will be take place on 20th February 2016!


What We Need & What You Get

We need $3000 to get our project on the ground and running. So far we have raised $800 through the generosity of family and friends.

The breakdown of our costs are:

The venue (Coal Loader Sustainability Building - Waverton) – $350

The Screen (Big screen hire) - $1200 

Insurance - $200

Graphic design - $250 

Accessories for the event – guest speakers, actors, lights, chair hire, possible eco-food and beverage van –$1000


The Impact

We all know that time is a precious resource and lacking amongst Sydney’s working population. Outdoor film screenings in serene locations are a great way to captivate our imaginations, infuse us with nature and provide a fun and educational experience. 

Thoughtfully selected guest speakers will deliver empowering messages of how we can protect and advocate for our natural spaces. 

We want this experience to offer more than just a film, we want to inspire people to be aware and reconnect (and have fun!). 

Risks & Challenges

We cannot afford the rights for screening films. The only way to screen these publicly is if we do not price or ticket our event. 

We do however have to make a booking page - as we can only host 150 people at the venue for venue regulation reasons. 

This is our main hurdle as pricing tickets would have been the easiest way to fund this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are really keen to hear from anyone who would like to donate giveaway products in line with our messaging to distribute at our events. 

Please also come. This is a free event and everyone is welcome:
Animalia in Nature - Presents 'the beginning'
Coal Loader,
Waverton, NSW
Saturday 20th February

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Tracy Prescott-MacGregor and I am a farmer in Clatskanie, Oregon working with a group of concerned Columbia County citizens to regain our community rights! Here is an older video explaining how we got here.
  • Did you know that a harmful industry can come into our towns and counties, take our natural resources, destroy our wildlife, pollute our water and air but if we say "no" to the corporation it can sue our communities for lost future profits? 
  • In the last 180 years local communities in the United States have lost their right to decide what happens to their local resources in favor of big corporate interests...mostly through rulings made by the Supreme Court.
  • We ALL want what the founding Fathers promised and swore to uphold in the Constitution of the United States of America. WE THE PEOPLE want our rights back! On the face of it, it seems a monumental task. Our tiny community is taking on the whole of the world oil corporations who want to ship dangerous Bakken Crude by rail through our towns, wildlife areas and farmland! Where do we start? Well right here where we live so we here in Columbia County are trying to get an initiative on the ballot. 
  • Our group created the Columbia County Right to Sustainable Energy Future Ordinance. This initiative establishes the right to a sustainable energy future, including a right to a healthy climate, a right to natural communities and ecosystems, a right to local, community self government; and prohibits corporations from engaging in fossil fuel transportation, as well as land acquisition, construction, or siting of any structure, for the purpose of constructing unsustainable energy systems. It would NOT prohibit the transportation of fossil fuels for the purposes of fueling existing natural gas-fired power stations, on-site energy consumption such as heat and electricity, or vehicle refueling.

    Why an initiative?

  • CC SAGE began working on the ordinance in response to mounting frustration with the lack of transparency surrounding plans to export fossil fuels out of Port Westward in Clatskanie, Oregon to overseas markets.  The issues at Port Westward have been years in the making but learning that coal was given a thumbs up by the Port of St Helens Commission in January 2012 after closed door meetings had already taken place, got people's attention and motivated them to action.  Just a few months later, unit trains of volatile crude oil began to run through the county with zero public notice. Global Partners had purchased and converted an existing permit to transport ethanol, which DEQ later determined was used to move hundreds of millions of gallons more oil than what was allowed by the permit, in violation of environmental laws. Watch a train pass through Rainier here! Oil train 

  • Here is a photo of the Lynchberg, Virginia oil train disaster. 

  • In spite of the many concerns raised about public safety, environmental impact, transportation of explosive crude oil on outdated infrastructure, and local emergency response agencies  lack of proper training and equipment in the event of a disaster, local officials continue to forge ahead with plans to expand the industrial complex at Port Westward. Enough is enough!  says Nancy Ward, member of CC SAGE. We've been to all the meetings, all the hearings and nothing happens. It's time to take control of the helm before the good ship Columbia County is destroyed by the Port Westward fossil fuel folly. It's time we put community rights over corporate power!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are trying to fund our court costs and a campaign to get this initiative on the ballot. Our initiative has been blocked by industry lawyers but we have prevailed and now we need to get out and get the signatures to get this on the ballot!
  • We have "We the People" T shirts! We have "We the People!" pins. We have "We the People" bumper stickers!

  • We will use the money to pay for our signature gathering and education campaign. We need money to  create media to educate folks and counter what we know will be an enormous backlash by industry to oppose our efforts. Help us be the David to the Goliath of the fossil duel industry! With a small donation from many folks "We the People" can get our rights back and finally say "WE DECIDE!"

The Impact

Your contribution will make efforts to regain Community Rights back in Columbia County possible!  With those regained community rights we want to forge ahead into a green energy future and move away from dirty fossil fuel use in our county and country! This is a historic opportunity and you can play a part in that history!

  • WE THE PEOPLE, WE DECIDE!
  • Community Rights Initiatives are springing up all over the United States and even all over the world! One hundred and sixty communities in many states have stopped corporate harms like factory farms, fracking, GMOs and established rights of nature with similar initiatives. 
  • We want to get our right to decide back and pave the way for a clean energy future in Columbia County and you can be part of it!

Risks & Challenges

Our goal is to get this initiative on the ballot so that "THE PEOPLE" can vote on it. Opposition by industry interests and corporate entities is VERY strong. The Fossil Fuel Industry has bottomless pockets. We are a group of 8 people...farmers, small business owners and local citizens with very little money. We have funded the project so far but we can't match the money available to the big corporations that have been trying to stall our efforts. We need help!

  • We are the "Davids" determined and doggedly persistent in our goal to wrest our rights back from these giant "Goliaths". We are small and nimble. They are large and cumbersome. We can do this if we all work together!
  • Our goal is to shine a light on the absurdity of our current system that allows these huge impersonal corporations to roll into our back yards, pillage and pollute indiscriminately without conscience, then leave our damaged communities behind taking the cash with them. We will take this initiative as far as we can go!
  • We know, oh so well, that not everyone can afford to give money. But there is something YOU can do. Can you get the word out and make some noise about our campaign? We would be so grateful!
  • Please check out and use the Indiegogo share tools!

We at Columbia County Sustainable Action for Green Environment say from the bottom of our hearts a resounding "Thank you"!

We need money to  create media to educate folks and counter what we know will be an enormous backlash by industry to oppose our efforts. Help us be the David to the Goliath of the fossil duel industry! With a small donation from many folks "We the People" can get our rights back and finally say "WE DECIDE!"    The Impact Your contribution will make efforts to regain Community Rights back in Columbia County possible!  With those regained community rights we want to forge ahead into a green energy future and move away from dirty fossil fuel use in our county and country! This is a historic opportunity and you can play a part in that history!  WE THE PEOPLE, WE DECIDE! Community Rights Initiatives are springing up all over the United States and even all over the world! One hundred and sixty communities in many states have stopped corporate harms like factory farms, fracking, GMOs and established rights of nature with similar initiatives.  We want to get our right to decide back and pave the way for a clean energy future in Columbia County and you can be part of it!    Risks & Challenges  Our goal is to get this initiative on the ballot so that "THE PEOPLE" can vote on it. Opposition by industry interests and corporate entities is VERY strong. The Fossil Fuel Industry has bottomless pockets. We are a group of 8 people...farmers, small business owners and local citizens with very little money. We have funded the project so far but we can't match the money available to the big corporations that have been trying to stall our efforts. We need help!  We are the "Davids" determined and doggedly persistent in our goal to wrest our rights back from these giant "Goliaths". We are small and nimble. They are large and cumbersome. We can do this if we all work together! Our goal is to shine a light on the absurdity of our current system that allows these huge impersonal corporations to roll into our back yards, pillage and pollute indiscriminately without conscience, then leave our damaged communities behind taking the cash with them. We will take this initiative as far as we can go!     We know, oh so well, that not everyone can afford to give money. But there is something YOU can do. Can you get the word out and make some noise about our campaign? We would be so grateful! Please check out and use the Indiegogo share tools!   We at Columbia County Sustainable Action for Green Environment say from the bottom of our hearts a resounding "Thank you"!

story:
Our Story

Hey Guys,

This is Devanik Saha, from New Delhi, India. Being passionate about climate change, I run my own non profit "Youth For Policy & Dialogue" (youthpolicy.in), India's first think-tank comprising entirely of youth. We have the vision of nurturing youth climate change activists into policy leaders. We have just completed our first year of operations and have been selected to send a delegation to Conference of Parties COP 17, of United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change Durban, South Africa. Its a meeting of all governments to decide the future course of action for climate change.

 But since it comprises of students and people working in non profit sector, we can't afford so much money in attending the conference.

This conference will be a really great opportunity for us to achieve our objectives.

Team: 

Devanik Saha ( Director, YPD)

Satwik Pradhan ( Policy Coordinator, YPD)

Shruti K.N. ( Media Coordinator, YPD)

Namrata Dhamankar (Campaign Coordinator,YPD)

The Impact

After coming back from COP 17, we will start working on creating a National Youth Advisory Board on Climate Change in India which will be the launchpad for several climate change activists to pursue climate policy and advocacy. Also, it will serve as the youth board to make policy recommendations to the Ministry of Environment in India in conjunction with other civil society organizations. India is one of the most vulnerable to climate change in Asia and we need many young people to fight and advocate for protecting the rights of  people affected and vulnerable to climate change in India.

What We Need & What You Get

Cost of Attending COP 17: 4 people 
Flights : 3600$
Accommodation : 500$
Food &  other expenses : 400$
Launch costs for National Youth Advisory Board: 300$ (registration and basic costs)

If we don't reach our entire fundraising goal, we will take loans to fund ourselves but we definitely want to go as this is perfect opportunity for us to interact and collaborate with so many amazing change makers. 
What you get?

1) Opportunity to build a network of policy leaders
2) Advocate with Indian youth change makers to protect the rights of people vulnerable to climate change.
3) Promoting change makers to take their work to the next level 
4) And of course, we will keep you updated with all our work.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet about us and refer a friend to donate to us ! Thanks !

story:
The Video above call to action was recycled from v2.0; nevertheless, the goals, programs, and need remain the same.

Please use the Share This Campaign Tools link via e-mail, Like via FB or Google+, or Tweet directly above to spread the word and expand the network.


COMMUNITY | SUSTAINABILITY | ENVIRONMENT |  ARTS . . .

Through application of these core concepts I will continue to build upon a pilot project launched in 2011 by planning and leading a hands-on long-term community development effort to alleviate poverty, food insecurity and environmental degradation in the rural areas of Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

This third campaign (version 3.0) will allow me to go back to Cambodia to serve the Wat Opot Children's Community (WOCC), the people in the rural villages surrounding WOCC, and - this time around - focus on building farmer training centers in adjacent villages.  All of which will be conducted within a 5 week timeframe starting mid to end of February 2013.  The initial fundraising campaign (version 1.0) and subsequent follow-up (version 2.0) results and progress may be viewed via my blog at http://briancambodiasustainability.tumblr.com/. 

I will continue to conduct three specific, on-going, long-term programs aimed at bolstering the viability of a rural population disenfranchised by the rapid development of a Cambodia shifting towards modernity:

  1. Sustainable Agriculture and Food Security Training and Education benefiting ~30 adult village leaders and educators living with HIV/AIDS and in poverty 
  2. Environmental and Teen Leadership Day benefiting children and teens (K-12) of WOCC and the surrounding villages living with HIV/AIDS and in poverty
  3. Dance (Hip-Hop, Break-dancing, Jazz, Contemporary, etc.) Competition benefiting children and teens (K-12) of WOCC and the surrounding villages living with HIV/AIDS and in poverty

The three programs were developed after a needs assessment and follow-up performed in 2011 -2012 (v1.0) and 2013 (v2.0), bolstering this region by:

  • Providing training for the rural communities to adopt small-scale subsistence sustainable agricultural techniques and knowledge sharing forum to share best practices; hence, alleviating food insecurity and achieving food sovereignty free from external conventional agriculture forces (i.e. multi-national corporate chemical and/or GMO seed companies)
  • Engaging the youth of the rural communities through the arts (dance) and crafts (fun environmental related acitivities), which not only makes them stewards of their communities in the near term, but, also, provides leadership, planning and organizational skills supplementing their primary and secondary education, all of which is necessary for their success in the medium and long-term

In other words, together we can and are "CHANGING THE COURSE"

FUNDING AND TRANSPARENCY

FOR AS LITTLE AS $10 YOU COULD FUND:

  • 1 Adult Cambodian Community Leader impacted by HIV/AIDS and malnutrition to attend a Sustainable Agriculture and Food Security Training
  • 7 Cambodian Children/Teens to learn about life-long Sustainability and  Environment principles to conserve their resources as well as provide necessary Leadership Skills
  • 60 Children/Teens impacted by HIV/AIDS and Poverty to value community as well as learn about life long group dynamics and leadership skills, all of which builds confidence through the art of dance and healthy competition

There are THREE fundraising benchmarks to achieve:

  1. Raise $1,300 to run all three programs, provide my room and board, food, and the transportation costs to conduct farmer outreach work
  2. Anything raised above benchmark #1 up to about $2,500 via online and offline (events in San Francisco) would go to my travel to and from Cambodia as well as other costs to conduct my work for WOCC and the surrounding villages
  3. Anything raised above benchmark #2, greater than about $2,500 will go towards WOCC General Funds


*Expenses Pie Chart Breakdown

*Expenses Spreadsheet Details

By donating you will be updated and will remain informed about the spending of the funds, which may slightly change pending on the need when I am on the ground . . . in-country.

*100% of donations will go towards bolstering the community; myself nor anyone else stand to make NO income or recieve administrative fees (in-fact I'll take a salary hit, but, no worries I do this for the love of this community).

WHAT YOU GET FOR YOUR DONATION

Should you choose to receive a gift for your donation, I will personally shop for gifts as described in the perks section at the local markets in Phnom Penh.  Perks will be mailed or personally given to you once I return from Cambodia.  You may also opt not to collect a gift.  If you didn't collect from the last campaign, you may still contact me to collect, the perks are still sitting in a box under my bed! :).

*4 Percent of the donations will be collected by Indiegogo for running this service and platform.

OTHER INFORMATION

For more information on key partners click the following links:

  • Brian Reyes (me) - Planner, Organizer, Overseer of the entire project whom fundraises, plans and executes all programs for WOCC and the surrounding community
  • Wat Opot Children's Community (WOCC) - provides access to existing target beneficiaries and the central location of trainings, conferences, dancing competions, and/or meetings
  • Centre d'Etude et de Développement Agricole Cambodgien (CEDAC) - provides Cambodian Sustainable Agriculture training and resources, which is consistent with the values of this project
  • Global Service Corps - U.S. based non-profit responsible for initiating the pilot project and contributing resources

For more information about the Sustainable Agriculture techniques used:

  • Typical Biointensive Agriculture concepts via John Jeavons' GROWBIOINTENSIVE movement or Wikipedia

  • Techniques & Concepts used during v1.0 and v2.0 via my blog at http://briancambodiasustainability.tumblr.com/


Remember to please spread the word by using the "Share This Campaign Tools" link below the initial photo/video above to spread the word.  Also, post and re-post this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, You Tube, LinkedIn, blogs, etc.  It would be much appreciated if you could ask your friends and family to help donate by directly contacting them.  If anyone has any questions, comments or just want to chat feel free to call me anytime at 415-730-8153 or email me at brian5368@gmail.com
