story:
[ Just a Few Days Left! ]




We may be a little ways away from our original goal, but we can still make Raising Esperanza a reality at the scale we dreamed it with just $4,500.  That's $4,500 to change the future of around 30 children, and the generations to come after them.  That's just $4,500 to change the pollution of streets, waterways, and food in a Honduran village.  


With the funds we have currently raised, we will be able to:

  • Get Byoearth to the home to do workshops, consulting, and help us launch
  • Bring documentarian Cameron Zohoori to the home to film and photograph the project and the kids
  • Acquire most of the materials needed to build the infrastructure

If we reach $4,500, we will be able to:
  • Get all of the building materials and worms needed for the project at the intended scale
  • Get our first wave of packaging materials for product distribution
  • Begin placing collection bins around the community and in homes
We're almost there!


[ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ]


[ Background ]

Finca, meaning farm, is the first of the Raising Esperanza project series - a series of well-designed small business initiatives, managed and run by a Honduran staff to put Children's Villages of Honduras (CVoH), a home for the displaced children of Honduras, closer to its goal of self-sustainability. 

Agriculture is at the cultural and economic core of Honduran daily life, so we decided to look there first for potential impact and change.  After some research and initial legwork in Valle de Ángeles, where CVoH is located, we discovered the following:

  • Rural food systems are largely self-contained in Honduras, which means most produce of Valle de Ángeles comes from within a 20-mile radius.
  • Aerable land is very limited, so common practice is to strip land of nutrients, clear cut forests for fertile soil, and repeat.
  • Chemical pesticides and fertilizers are a relatively new phenomenon, and therefore are misunderstood, and vastly misused.
  • Beyond the negative health impact these chemicals have on food being eaten, they leech into waterways.
  • Trash is often collected in piles and indiscriminately burned, which produces unavoidable thick patches of black smoke.

The situation seems overwhelming, but after looking at the central issues surrounding harsh chemicals, pollution, and land depletion, something suddenly clicked, and we decided to turn to a technology that is cutting-edge and ancient all at once...  


...Enter the ever humble worm.


Yes, you heard right.

[ Worms ]

Worms are hard workers, solving all kinds of problems one bite at a time.  When we provide them with an ideal environment (e.g., a pile of garbage), they in turn provide the following:

  • Nutrient rich, organic fertilizer
  • "Tea" (fertilizer + water + oxygen) which is loaded with microbes and acts as an organic pesticide
  • More worms!

Worms can eat and process more than 1/2 their own weight in a day.  We know what you're thinking, and sure, a worm may not weigh much, but when we're talking about tens of thousands of pounds of worms, the trash-to-treasure potential is truly staggering.


[ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ]


[ Here's how it works ]

  • Build four worm compost containment bins.  These bins will house the worms and compost at different stages
  • Collect crop waste and other biodegradables from farmers, and the greater Valle de Ángeles area.
  • Recycle waste.  Send plastics and metals to the recycling center.  Convert biodegradables into products that restore and revitalize the soil that grows the food that feeds the children and the rest of Valle de Ángeles.
  • Sell compost, "worm tea," and worm starter kits to nonprofit organizations that promote sustainable agriculture development.  Nonprofits distribute those products to farmers in the region.
  • Educate on composting methods and the benefits of compost through free workshops for the Valle de Ángeles community.
  • Document the whole project through film and photography.


Finca has already begun.  After successful gardening and composting for the past three years, we are ready to bring this service to the town. 


[ What We Need & What You Get ]

  • Project Director - Scroll down to learn more about Vahid.  This will cover travel, lodging, and the economic burden of leaving work for 6-8 months.  
  • Videographer - We have a documentarian who will be in Honduras to film and document the project launch and its impact on the community.  We need your help to cover travel, lodging, filming, and editing.
  • Construction Materials - We have to buy blocks, cement, and wheelbarrows to build four rectangular containment systems, 15'x5'x4', and a simple roof to keep rain and scavengers out.
  • Byoearth - Byoearth is an incredible company based out of Guatemala that has been operating large worm composting systems for the past 7 years.  They are a key component to getting Finca off the ground, and we need help getting them to CVoH from Guatemala.
  • Labor - We are hiring two people to help with construction of our containment systems - laying blocks, cement, building the roof, etc.
  • Chipper/Shredder - A chipper machine breaks down large waste into smaller pieces.  By increasing overall surface area of the waste, we can ultimately cut the trash to treasure time in half.
  • Misc. Equipment - Pitchforks, shovels, buckets, containers, etc.


[ Perks ]

Check out the perks to the right to see what you will receive as a token of our gratitude for being a part of this with us.  Scroll down for merchandise options and details!


/// RAISING ESPERANZA LOGO ///


/// CVoH ///



/// Silicone CVoH Bracelets ///



/// Esperanza Sticker /// Circular /// 3" Diameter /// 





Apparel:

1. After you've contributed, shoot an email to RaisingEsperanza@gmail.com.

2. Include your name in the subject line.

3. Let us know which perk you are set up to receive, and the size of your choice.  Sizes XS-XL.  For example: "ESPERANZA / MEDIUM" or "CVOH / LARGE"


Photo Print:

1. After you've contributed, shoot an email to RaisingEsperanza@gmail.com.

2. Include your name in the subject line.

3. Let us know if you're interested in the canvas print or aluminum panel.  Next we'll send you the photo album for you to choose your favorite, and the print or panel will be on its way!

---

Fine Print:  Please understand that we won't be able to accept returns.  We will gladly ship internationally, but please include an extra $15 when you make your contribution. You can always contribute more than the specified amount for each perk.  When you've selected your perk, you will be prompted to enter an amount, and you can adjust your contributions there!


[ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ]



[ Children's Villages of Honduras ]

A quick Google search for "Honduras" will turn up some pretty awful things:

  • Murder capital of the World
  • Highest HIV/AIDS rate in Central America
  • Teacher strikes and a broken education system
  • Police and government in back pockets of drug cartels

On the outskirts of Tegucigalpa, Children's Villages of Honduras (CVoH) exists in the thriving town of Valle de Ángeles, home to the best education systems, the lowest crime rates, and some really good coffee.  Home to 20-30 children born into worlds of abuse, poverty, and malnutrition, CVoH offers a second chance, and the results have been truly inspiring.

To educate the disadvantaged children of Honduras, to provide them with a stable, nurturing environment, to raise them to be responsible, successful adults that will become pillars of change and growth in their communities is at the core of CVoH's mission.  

We're talking about a small home with a massive impact.  Our "children" can be as young as 5 and as old as 25, because we are dedicated to raising high caliber adults that transition into careers, healthy marriages, and supportive parents.  For some reason, this is practically unheard of.  While similar homes offer basic food and shelter until the children get pregnant, run away, or get kicked out, Children's Villages of Honduras is creating new opportunities and positioning its children to be more than a statistic.


The people behind...



//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


[ Vahid ]

My name is Vahid Moavenzadeh.  More important than figuring out the pronunciation of my nightmarish, multi-syllable name is the story attached to it.

When I was 19 I went to a Honduran orphanage to broaden my then very narrow worldview, maybe help some people along the way, and just maybe get a perfect Facebook profile picture out of it.  While my worldview expanded (or rather exploded), it was in no way the experience I expected, and there was certainly no time for selfies.

It all turned around when the abusive and corrupt director was revealed for committing some of the most horrific acts imaginable.  All of a sudden I was on a bus to Costa Rica, fleeing under threat of death, vowing to return to Honduras as soon as possible to regroup and rebuild a brighter future for the kids I had grown to love so deeply in three very short months.

It took two years (2010) until there was finally a way to get back to the kids, to build something new, something safe, something that would give the kids a second chance, and Children's Villages of Honduras was born.  I worked and saved and got to Honduras in early 2011 to help establish the new home.

Since then I have studied agriculture, run a small edible landscaping business, and joined the ever-inspiring board of directors.  I'm currently heading up the Raising Esperanza initiative as a means of pulling away from such heavy dependence on the profoundly generous contributions that have gotten us this far.  Raising Esperanza is my passion and calling, and I'll do whatever it takes to help secure a bright future for these kids and the many more to come.


[ Cameron ]

Cameron Zohoori is an incredible photographer and videographer, who also has little time for selfies.  You can see his work here and here.  He's been to some remarkable places and taken some grand shots, but look closer and you'll see that Cameron has found true gems in ordinary things.  Vahid and Cameron were childhood friends that wound up living in different places, falling out of touch, and reconnecting years later only to discover that they had each gotten involved in some pretty exciting projects.  After a few phone calls, it was on, and Cameron became a part of the Raising Esperanza: Finca team.

We are so lucky to have Cameron on board.  If you choose the canvas or aluminum print, which is our favorite perk, it will be his masterpiece hanging on your wall.  Beyond shooting portraits of the kids and some landscapes of Valle de Ángeles, he's going to be documenting the launch of Raising Esperanza: Finca.

So go take a look at his work and get excited.  Very excited.


[ Byoearth ]

You can learn more about this incredible company here.  Founded by Maria Rodriguez in Guatemala about seven years ago, Byoearth has used vermiculture and several innovative agriculture products to build community and empower women in the region.  They have been incredibly successful not only in producing high quality agriculture products, but in educating individuals, farmers, and organizations on the many bounties of worms.  We are incredibly excited to welcome them to Honduras as they help us get Raising Esperanza: Finca off the ground.


[ Elisa Cardenas ]

Elisa has been with CVoH since day one.  She is our office administrator, among many other things.  Whenever she's not in the office, she's surrounded by a swarm of adoring kids.  We are so lucky to have a woman who, beyond being deeply dedicated to CVoH's mission and an absolute joy to work with, is highly experienced - she's worked with a slew of nonprofit organizations in an administration capacity.  Doing projects like Raising Esperanza are not possible without people that know the country and how to navigate various social, political, and economic systems.  That said, if this project had an "anchor," it would, without a doubt, be Elisa.  She runs a tight ship at CVoH, and none of this could happen without her.  


[ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ]




[ Get Involved! ] 

We aren't just asking for donations here.  We want to engage with you.  Talk to us, give us feedback, tell us what you want to see more of!  The vast majority of you won't be able to go to Honduras, but we don't want that to stop you from being intimately involved with the process.  We keep our pages updated and interactive, through ups and downs, because we don't believe in sugar coating.  The rough patches make the successes that much sweeter anyway. 

So...

Like us on Facebook! 
Follow us on Twitter! 
Sign up for our monthly newsletter!  


Don't forget to hashtag it up! 

         #RaisingEsperanza    #Finca     #pollutionsolution     #CVoH


//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

For all questions and comments regarding this campaign, project, and fundraising, please feel free to email:  RaisingEsperanza@gmail.com

For publicity, interviews, etc. you can email Vahid Moavenzadeh directly: vmoaven@gmail.com
story_txt:
[ Just a Few Days Left! ]We may be a little ways away from our original goal, but we can still make Raising Esperanza a reality at the scale we dreamed it with just $4,500.  That's $4,500 to change the future of around 30 children, and the generations to come after them.  That's just $4,500 to change the pollution of streets, waterways, and food in a Honduran village.  With the funds we have currently raised, we will be able to:
Get Byoearth to the home to do workshops, consulting, and help us launch
Bring documentarian Cameron Zohoori to the home to film and photograph the project and the kids
Acquire most of the materials needed to build the infrastructure
If we reach $4,500, we will be able to:

Get all of the building materials and worms needed for the project at the intended scale
Get our first wave of packaging materials for product distribution
Begin placing collection bins around the community and in homes

We're almost there!
[ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ][ Background ]Finca, meaning farm, is the first of the Raising Esperanza project series - a series of well-designed small business initiatives, managed and run by a Honduran staff to put Children's Villages of Honduras (CVoH), a home for the displaced children of Honduras, closer to its goal of self-sustainability. Agriculture is at the cultural and economic core of Honduran daily life, so we decided to look there first for potential impact and change.  After some research and initial legwork in Valle de Ángeles, where CVoH is located, we discovered the following:
Rural food systems are largely self-contained in Honduras, which means most produce of Valle de Ángeles comes from within a 20-mile radius.
Aerable land is very limited, so common practice is to strip land of nutrients, clear cut forests for fertile soil, and repeat.
Chemical pesticides and fertilizers are a relatively new phenomenon, and therefore are misunderstood, and vastly misused.
Beyond the negative health impact these chemicals have on food being eaten, they leech into waterways.
Trash is often collected in piles and indiscriminately burned, which produces unavoidable thick patches of black smoke.
The situation seems overwhelming, but after looking at the central issues surrounding harsh chemicals, pollution, and land depletion, something suddenly clicked, and we decided to turn to a technology that is cutting-edge and ancient all at once...  ...Enter the ever humble worm.Yes, you heard right.[ Worms ]Worms are hard workers, solving all kinds of problems one bite at a time.  When we provide them with an ideal environment (e.g., a pile of garbage), they in turn provide the following:
Nutrient rich, organic fertilizer
"Tea" (fertilizer + water + oxygen) which is loaded with microbes and acts as an organic pesticide
More worms!
Worms can eat and process more than 1/2 their own weight in a day.  We know what you're thinking, and sure, a worm may not weigh much, but when we're talking about tens of thousands of pounds of worms, the trash-to-treasure potential is truly staggering.[ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ][ Here's how it works ]
Build four worm compost containment bins.  These bins will house the worms and compost at different stages

Collect crop waste and other biodegradables from farmers, and the greater Valle de Ángeles area.

Recycle waste.  Send plastics and metals to the recycling center.  Convert biodegradables into products that restore and revitalize the soil that grows the food that feeds the children and the rest of Valle de Ángeles.

Sell compost, "worm tea," and worm starter kits to nonprofit organizations that promote sustainable agriculture development.  Nonprofits distribute those products to farmers in the region.

Educate on composting methods and the benefits of compost through free workshops for the Valle de Ángeles community.

Document the whole project through film and photography.

Finca has already begun.  After successful gardening and composting for the past three years, we are ready to bring this service to the town. [ What We Need & What You Get ]

Project Director - Scroll down to learn more about Vahid.  This will cover travel, lodging, and the economic burden of leaving work for 6-8 months.  


Videographer - We have a documentarian who will be in Honduras to film and document the project launch and its impact on the community.  We need your help to cover travel, lodging, filming, and editing.


Construction Materials - We have to buy blocks, cement, and wheelbarrows to build four rectangular containment systems, 15'x5'x4', and a simple roof to keep rain and scavengers out.


Byoearth - Byoearth is an incredible company based out of Guatemala that has been operating large worm composting systems for the past 7 years.  They are a key component to getting Finca off the ground, and we need help getting them to CVoH from Guatemala.


Labor - We are hiring two people to help with construction of our containment systems - laying blocks, cement, building the roof, etc.


Chipper/Shredder - A chipper machine breaks down large waste into smaller pieces.  By increasing overall surface area of the waste, we can ultimately cut the trash to treasure time in half.


Misc. Equipment - Pitchforks, shovels, buckets, containers, etc.

[ Perks ]Check out the perks to the right to see what you will receive as a token of our gratitude for being a part of this with us.  Scroll down for merchandise options and details!/// RAISING ESPERANZA LOGO ////// CVoH ////// Silicone CVoH Bracelets ////// Esperanza Sticker /// Circular /// 3" Diameter /// Apparel:1. After you've contributed, shoot an email to RaisingEsperanza@gmail.com.2. Include your name in the subject line.3. Let us know which perk you are set up to receive, and the size of your choice.  Sizes XS-XL.  For example: "ESPERANZA / MEDIUM" or "CVOH / LARGE"Photo Print:1. After you've contributed, shoot an email to RaisingEsperanza@gmail.com.2. Include your name in the subject line.3. Let us know if you're interested in the canvas print or aluminum panel.  Next we'll send you the photo album for you to choose your favorite, and the print or panel will be on its way!---Fine Print:  Please understand that we won't be able to accept returns.  We will gladly ship internationally, but please include an extra $15 when you make your contribution. You can always contribute more than the specified amount for each perk.  When you've selected your perk, you will be prompted to enter an amount, and you can adjust your contributions there![ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ][ Children's Villages of Honduras ]A quick Google search for "Honduras" will turn up some pretty awful things:
Murder capital of the World
Highest HIV/AIDS rate in Central America
Teacher strikes and a broken education system
Police and government in back pockets of drug cartels
On the outskirts of Tegucigalpa, Children's Villages of Honduras (CVoH) exists in the thriving town of Valle de Ángeles, home to the best education systems, the lowest crime rates, and some really good coffee.  Home to 20-30 children born into worlds of abuse, poverty, and malnutrition, CVoH offers a second chance, and the results have been truly inspiring.To educate the disadvantaged children of Honduras, to provide them with a stable, nurturing environment, to raise them to be responsible, successful adults that will become pillars of change and growth in their communities is at the core of CVoH's mission.  We're talking about a small home with a massive impact.  Our "children" can be as young as 5 and as old as 25, because we are dedicated to raising high caliber adults that transition into careers, healthy marriages, and supportive parents.  For some reason, this is practically unheard of.  While similar homes offer basic food and shelter until the children get pregnant, run away, or get kicked out, Children's Villages of Honduras is creating new opportunities and positioning its children to be more than a statistic.The people behind...//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////[ Vahid ]My name is Vahid Moavenzadeh.  More important than figuring out the pronunciation of my nightmarish, multi-syllable name is the story attached to it.When I was 19 I went to a Honduran orphanage to broaden my then very narrow worldview, maybe help some people along the way, and just maybe get a perfect Facebook profile picture out of it.  While my worldview expanded (or rather exploded), it was in no way the experience I expected, and there was certainly no time for selfies.It all turned around when the abusive and corrupt director was revealed for committing some of the most horrific acts imaginable.  All of a sudden I was on a bus to Costa Rica, fleeing under threat of death, vowing to return to Honduras as soon as possible to regroup and rebuild a brighter future for the kids I had grown to love so deeply in three very short months.It took two years (2010) until there was finally a way to get back to the kids, to build something new, something safe, something that would give the kids a second chance, and Children's Villages of Honduras was born.  I worked and saved and got to Honduras in early 2011 to help establish the new home.Since then I have studied agriculture, run a small edible landscaping business, and joined the ever-inspiring board of directors.  I'm currently heading up the Raising Esperanza initiative as a means of pulling away from such heavy dependence on the profoundly generous contributions that have gotten us this far.  Raising Esperanza is my passion and calling, and I'll do whatever it takes to help secure a bright future for these kids and the many more to come.[ Cameron ]Cameron Zohoori is an incredible photographer and videographer, who also has little time for selfies.  You can see his work here and here.  He's been to some remarkable places and taken some grand shots, but look closer and you'll see that Cameron has found true gems in ordinary things.  Vahid and Cameron were childhood friends that wound up living in different places, falling out of touch, and reconnecting years later only to discover that they had each gotten involved in some pretty exciting projects.  After a few phone calls, it was on, and Cameron became a part of the Raising Esperanza: Finca team.We are so lucky to have Cameron on board.  If you choose the canvas or aluminum print, which is our favorite perk, it will be his masterpiece hanging on your wall.  Beyond shooting portraits of the kids and some landscapes of Valle de Ángeles, he's going to be documenting the launch of Raising Esperanza: Finca.So go take a look at his work and get excited.  Very excited.[ Byoearth ]You can learn more about this incredible company here.  Founded by Maria Rodriguez in Guatemala about seven years ago, Byoearth has used vermiculture and several innovative agriculture products to build community and empower women in the region.  They have been incredibly successful not only in producing high quality agriculture products, but in educating individuals, farmers, and organizations on the many bounties of worms.  We are incredibly excited to welcome them to Honduras as they help us get Raising Esperanza: Finca off the ground.[ Elisa Cardenas ]Elisa has been with CVoH since day one.  She is our office administrator, among many other things.  Whenever she's not in the office, she's surrounded by a swarm of adoring kids.  We are so lucky to have a woman who, beyond being deeply dedicated to CVoH's mission and an absolute joy to work with, is highly experienced - she's worked with a slew of nonprofit organizations in an administration capacity.  Doing projects like Raising Esperanza are not possible without people that know the country and how to navigate various social, political, and economic systems.  That said, if this project had an "anchor," it would, without a doubt, be Elisa.  She runs a tight ship at CVoH, and none of this could happen without her.  
[ CVoH ]                  [ Facebook ]                 [ Twitter ][ Get Involved! ] We aren't just asking for donations here.  We want to engage with you.  Talk to us, give us feedback, tell us what you want to see more of!  The vast majority of you won't be able to go to Honduras, but we don't want that to stop you from being intimately involved with the process.  We keep our pages updated and interactive, through ups and downs, because we don't believe in sugar coating.  The rough patches make the successes that much sweeter anyway. So...
Like us on Facebook! Follow us on Twitter! Sign up for our monthly newsletter!  
Don't forget to hashtag it up!          #RaisingEsperanza    #Finca     #pollutionsolution     #CVoH//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////For all questions and comments regarding this campaign, project, and fundraising, please feel free to email:  RaisingEsperanza@gmail.comFor publicity, interviews, etc. you can email Vahid Moavenzadeh directly: vmoaven@gmail.com

story:
Mi nombre es Sebastian Zapata, ciudadano de Cali, Colombia. Este bello país, al igual que el resto del mundo, se está viendo afectado por la tala de árboles y la disminución de las áreas arborizadas. 


Dada mi preocupación y la de millones de personas en el planeta tierra de revertir esta tendencia, he decidido empezar el proyecto "Un Millón Más", cuyo objetivo principal es sembrar un millón de árboles con el apoyo de todas las personas a nivel mundial, mientras se genera un fondo para el desarrollo y estudio de soluciones ambientales.

My name is Sebastian Zapata and I live in Cali - Colombia. This beautiful country  just like all the world it's being affected for  the deforestation.

Given my concern and the one of people all around the world to reverse this situation, I decided to start the project "One Million more", which consistent of planting one million trees with the support of the people inside and outside my country, while a fund for studies in environmental solutions is created.



¿Cómo Funciona?

Cada persona alrededor del mundo tendrá la oportunidad de comprar un árbol (o varios) que será donado al proyecto, este dinero será utilizado para la siembra y mantenimiento de cada árbol hasta por un año, además, con un poco de conocimiento financiera se genera el aporte a nuevos proyecto.

Expliquemos esto, el dinero entra a un fondo financiero (clasificación AAA) en donde se generan ganancias por rentabilidad entre 15 - 20 días mientras llega la oportunidad de sembrar tu árbol donado, esto se debe a que los sitios y los árboles deben tener unas preparaciones previas. A medida que el proyecto avanza y se van sembrando los árboles, el dinero generado a partir del fondo se empieza a acumular para que una vez se termine la siembra del millón de árboles haya suficiente capital para generar un centro de investigación en soluciones ambientales. 

De esta forma, se logrará sembrar un millón de árboles con la ayuda de todos y, como una cascada, se generan ingresos para construir un nuevo centro de investigación cuyo nombre será Prograss (expuesto al final del vídeo).

How it Works

Each person around the world will have the opportunity to buy a tree (or as many as they want) and this tree will be donated to the project. the money received will be use to plant and maintain the tree, and with little financial knowledge the donation will generate funds to new projects.

Let's explain this, the money is deposited in a financial fund of low risk (AAA Qualification) where will generate profit for 15 - 20 days while everything is prepared to plant the tree, the reason is that we need to organize the places and trees to be planted. While the project grows and more trees are planted, the money generated in the financial fund is being accumulated to create enough capital to create a research center of environmental solutions.

This way, the project will plant one million trees with the help of all of you and, like a waterfall, will generate income to build a new center for environmental research named Prograss.



Qué Busco a Través de Indiegogo

1. Con los recursos obtenidos se terminará de construir la plataforma virtual donde las personas podrán donar su árbol y tener el seguimiento de la campaña. 

2. Construir un vivero donde se germinen una parte de los árboles que se utilizarán en el proceso de re forestación. 

3. Conseguir los fondos para sembrar los primeros 2.000 árboles y darle fuerza en los medios a Un Millón Más. 

4. Recoger el dinero para que la compañía pueda sobrevivir el primer año y poder vincularme con empresas privadas que deseen invertir en campañas posicionadas y temáticas ambientales. 

What I am looking for through Indiegogo

1. With the funds collected I will finish the web page of the project where the people will have the opportunity to donate and follow the progress of "One Million More".

2. Build a greenhouse to germinate some of the trees that will be used in the reforestation.

3. To get the donation to plant 2.000 trees and hire advertising.

4. What I want through indiegogo is to get the money needed to survived the first year of the project to create record to convince private companies to support "One Million More".

 

¿Dónde se realizarán las siembras?

Las siembras se realizarán es espacios rurales y urbanos, previamente seleccionados en el departamento del Valle del Cauca, con las debidas autorizaciones de las instituciones respectivas, garantizando su existencia bajo el cuidado de la ciudadanía y sin que vayan a generar daños a causa del tipo de especie sembrada. En las ciudades se busca devolver el verde a las carreteras, parques y lindero de ríos (que a falta de material vegetal suelen desbordarse en temporada de lluvias). 

Las siembras se realizarán junto a los Scouts, Voluntarios del proyecto y con los colegios de la región en forma de concienciar a los jóvenes sobre la temática ambiental.

Este proyecto es la base para poder empezar a cambiar el mundo. Si bien un millón de árboles requiere una gran cantidad de dinero (USD 11 x 1 MM = USD 11 MM), tan solo se requieren USD 10.000 para arrancar. Con este fondo se generarían los medios virtuales para la plataforma de donación y seguimiento de toda la campaña por parte de los ciudadanos del mundo, además de poder construir el vivero donde germinarán gran parte de los árboles a utilizar, la otra parte de los árboles se originarán de los viveros existentes en la ciudad que están dispuestos a vincularse.

El excedente del dinero para mi meta en indiegogo es para poder sembrar los primeros 2.000 árboles y poder generar mercadeo en el lanzamiento de la campaña. Por tanto, cada centavo recogido en esta campaña irá destinado a sembrar árboles, así que se logre la meta o no, el mundo tendrá nuevos árboles sembrados.

Un árbol puede que no cambie el mundo, pero puede cambiar la vida de muchas personas... La mía cambió cuando mis padres me llevaron a sembrar mi primer árbol, historia familiar que hoy recuerdo con amor... Un árbol es una historia, ayúdame a sembrar un millón!

¿Quieres Apoyar y no tienes como Aportar?

Ayúdame a difundir mi campaña de indiegogo y el fan page de facebook (https://www.facebook.com/UnMillonMasparalaHistoria), seguro entre tus conocidos abrá más gente interesada. El flujo de información en esta era puede realizar grandes cambios con proyectos como el mío.

Si te encuentras en Colombia, puedes vincularte para ser parte de las jornadas de siembra o actividades sociales que se están organizando.

Sabes de posibles alianzas que podamos realizar?

Estamos dispuestos a generar todo tipo de alianza y ayudar todo tipo de campañas, la idea es que juntos cambiemos el mundo.


Gracias por ser parte de esta historia!

story:
Welcome to the Yunus Emre farm ! Bienvenue a la Ferme Yunus Emre ! Yunus Emre ciftligi'ne Hosh Geldiniz ! ..

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TEXTE EN FRANCAIS APRES LE TEXTE EN ANGLAIS - PLUS BAS :O))))) .

 ------------------------------------------------------------

THE FARM

 

Situated in South Turkey, in the Mediterrannean area, in the country of Mevlana – Sufi master, the farm is a3 hectare wide space dedicated to NATURE.

 

It aims at experiencing and sharing the Ancient Knowlege of Yoga, as well as the powerful tools of Permaculture.

 

So like this you may come to the Yunus Emre farm for a Satyananda Yoga seminar,(next in MAY-  HERE)  for a yogic retreat (see HERE) .. you may also come for a Permaculture design course.(next in OCTOBER)

You may join the life of the farm as a volunteer, helping learning and sharing ...(info HERE)

You may also organise your own yoga seminar in the Yunus Emre farm. (see the flyer in the Gallery "Guest seminars" or here Guest Seminar )

 

Whatever the case there will always be Yogic Ecological practices like Havan, ancient fire ceremony, Chanting of Maha mrityun jaya mantra the “HEALING” mantra which provides healing energy for the benefit of all beings, for these  very practices attune our vibrations to the Cosmic vibrations, allowing harmony and peace in our entire being.

 

So Yunus Emre farm is a place where you can really experience INNER PEACE, as well as learn powerful tools which will help you to keep this positive healing ENERGY in your own life.

(A lot of pics may be found also in the GALLERY showing the farm from the very beginnings until now :o))

Yunus Emre farm aims at giving a CHANCE FOR EVOLUTION and is specially dedicate to the FUTURE GENERATIONS who will have to manage the world tomorrow.

 Here is an article by Theresa Day in TODAY ZAMAN in 2010 at the beginnings of the farm- things have evolved - but the spirit of the project remains same

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

THE AIM OF THIS CAMPAIGN

 

It concerns the LOTUS POND, our WATER RESERVOIR.

As a permaculture farm, the Yunus Emre farm’s design is based on permaculture, and according to permaculture, each important energy should be supplied by at least 2 sources, even 3.

 

Now we are trying to finalise the WATER subject.

 

See the “LOTUS POND” VIDEO HERE

 

In 2008 we received drinkable water from the village, but as there is shortage every summer this water is not allowed for watering.

So we digged a drilling and  found good amount of water, however this water revealed to be salty from time to time.

On the other hand another important source of water is simply RAIN.

In this area the annual amount of rain is superior to that of UK !!!!  BUT rain only falls (heavily) during 4 months in winter.

So we had to find a way to HARVEST and STORE this rain.

 

That is where the LOTUS POND came.

Digged also in 2008, it would be the perfect tool both to HARVEST RAIN WATER, and to provide a POOL for DRILLING WATER to REST and MIX with rain water thus becoming proper for watering.

 

Yet the Lotus pond remained empty during 2 years because we could not find any proper solution to cover the inside.

Finally, we put a “nylon” as we say in Turkey, a big large plastic, because it was cheap and quickly done.

Of course .. unfortunately it didnt last much ...

After only one year, the plastic revealed to be torn everywhere... Probably due to burning sun, strong winds, and ... lovely cats :o))

 

So this time, we searched eventually  a durable, sustainable and ecological solution for the LOTUS POND.

 

And we found the EPDM – Geomembrane as a very much reliable material.

Totally ecological, sun and heat resistant, very solid and durable, it appeared to the BEST solution.

 

And we have been very pleased when a good company based in Antalya accepted to do the work in very convenient conditions:

Bringing the material, covering the pond with it, fixing everything as it has to be, (it needs real professionnal people for such a work)  finally delivering a “fully ready water pond” in a 3- 4 day work.

And most of all, the company’s manager accepted to complete the work in the next weeks, with ONLY A SMALL DEPOSIT.... the remaining money being given .. on the completion of this campaign ! (25 JUNE dead line)

 

So you see how precious will be YOUR HELP and SUPPORT.

 

The cost of the work should be between 4200 / 4600 USD.

The farm's financial situation does not allow such an expense yet. Although it starts to bring some little incomes, the farm is not yet self sustainable financially speaking..

That is why we searched for FUNDING solutions and STARTED THIS CAMPAIGN

Aiming at raising an amount of 5000 USD to cover all expenses related to the LOTUS POND's LAST STEP .... 

 

We do COUNT ON YOUR SUPPORT to help the LOTUS POND to be FINALISED and fullfill its multi functions, like a good “permaculture pond” should do:

 

-- Water harvesting – Rain (may be up to1200 mm/ year – on the pond’s surface of around 100 m2: it may bring 120 tons of good rain water)

-- Water storage- Rain water and Drilling water will be mixed so that drilling water looses it salinity and rests under the sky and open air

-- Watering of the fields- for the time being around 700 plants have been planted in both Moon and Sun gardens. The uphill position of the reservoir allows watering of most of them by GRAVITY thus saving energy.

-- Shelter for life- As soon as possible we shall try to put water –plants in the pond, both to create LIFE and to provide SHADE thus limit evaporation.

-- Fire fighting reservoir- The farm being surrounded by pine tree forest the area in summer is highly fire sensitive... the forest road to the pond must always be open .. just in case ..

-- Pool for kids- why not to let kid have some fun and play in water at some stage .. (maybe grown ups too ! )

 

So we all COUNT ON YOUR HELP to finalise this last step and have a proper WATER RESERVOIR lasting many many many years, (20 year garanty :o)) providing WATER for many many many plants trees bushes, allow the Yunus Emre farm to become a green oasis providing ABUNDANCE TO ALL.

 

If however the total goal of the campaign would not be reached, we would still pay the works with the available money and borrow from other sources, even from banks :o(   if mandatory ... and maybe organise another campaign to finish to pay.

 

I am thinking totally POSITIVELY and want to believe YOUR WILL HELP US.

 

MANY WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

Financial support:

according to your possibilities, whatever you can give will be MORE THAN WELCOME.

 

Transmitting, sharing:

the more people know about the Yunus Emre farm’s water pond, the BETTER .. and if you write a note to your friends, relatives, collegues then it will definitely HELP A LOT

 

Personal involvement:

in addition you may wish to help the farm by involving your self in it in a way that would suit your capacities, preferences, ambitions, etc...

Examples:

-- VOLUNTEERING: nice way to share the life in the farm by helping and learning, giving and receiving

-- ADVANCED VOLUNTEERING: lets say you have come for volunteering and you like so much the project that you feel like joining us .. this is also possible and of course would have to be discussed in "live"..

-- PARTNERSHIP: again . .lets say you have come here and found the place, the project and activities so wonderful that you wish to CREATE something HERE TOO, to REALISE YOUR OWN PROJECT here, well .. this could be also possible either in the farm itself (renting a part of the fields of ex) or in the neighborhood ... . there is a HUGE potential in this region , we just have to be CREATIVE, POSITIVE, INVENTIV, and Permaculture and Yoga's tools may HELP us a LOT in creating a beautiful community ...

For all these suggestions of course .. contact us.. come and we talk !! 

Discussions are OPEN .. and we are happy to study any  case, and talk with you any time about any idea you may have :o)

 

PERKS

 

There is a Chinese saying iike:

“if you want to live happy, walk with 2 bags: one to give, one to receive”

So likewise you will maybe give something to the farm, and for sure you will also RECEIVE.

Detais about the perks are below.

One perk however is not mentionned, it is the one you will feel in your HEART.

Because BY GIVING we actually RECEIVE.

            "Generosity brings happiness at every stage of its expression.
              We experience joy in forming the intention to be generous.
                 We experience joy in the actual act of giving something.
                    And we experience joy in remembering the fact that we have given."
                                       -The Buddha

----------------------------------------------------------------- ICI EN FRANCAIS-----VERSION ACTUALISEE AU 8 MAI 2012------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bienvenue a la ferme Yunus Emre !

LA FERME

Située dans le sud de la Turquie, en région méditerrannéenne, dans le pays de Mevlana. Maître Soufi- createur des Derviches Tourneurs.

La ferme est un espace de 3 hectares dédicacés a la NATURE. 

Son rôle est d’offrir la possibilité de vivre et de partagerla Connaissance du Yoga, ainsi que les outils puissants dela Permaculture.

Ainsi vous pouvez venir a la ferme Yunus Emre pour un Séminaire de Satyananda Yoga (prochain trés bientot avec Sannyasis Atmatattwa et Brahmananda ICI) , pour une retraite « style de vie yoguique » (infos ICI) , aussi pour un cours de Design permaculture (PDC)(prochain en Octobre avec Saviana Parodi- ICI)

Vous pouvez également passer quelques jours ou plus en tant que volontaire, apprenant, partageant, échangeant avec nous l’expérience de la vie a la ferme Yunus Emre (voir les infos ICI)

Vous pouvez aussi organiser votre Propre Séminaire de Yoga, venir avec votre groupe.(voir documentation sur la ferme et info Séminaires invités ICI)

 

Quelle que soit la situation il y aura toujours les pratiques de l’écologie du Yoga, telles que le HAVAN – Ancienne cérémonie du FEU, le Chant du Mahamrityunjaya mantra, le Mantra qui guérit, apportant énergie bienfaisante a tous les êtres... Ceci car ces pratiques véritablement accordent notre être vibratoire aux vibrations Cosmiques, créant ainsi  l’harmonie et la paix dans tout notre être.

 

C’est pourquoi la ferme Yunus Emre est un lieu oula PAIX INTERIEURE peut être réellement ressentie, vécue. De plus on y apprend des techniques puisantes qui permettent de maintenir cette bonne énergie et une positivité inébranlable dans notre vie de tous les jours.

 

La ferme Yunus Emre est un lieu qui donne une CHANCE POUR L’EVOLUTION et est dédiée aux GENERATIONS FUTURES qui devront gérer le monde de demain.

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

LE BUT DE CETTE CAMPAGNE

 

C’est la finalisation du bassin du LOTUS, notre réservoir d’EAU.

Dans une ferme PERMACULTURE,et  la ferme Yunus Emre est  conçue selon la permaculture,  chaque énergie importante ( et l’EAU VITALE en est vraiment une ! ) devrait être fournie par au moins 2 voire 3 sources.

Ainsi nous essayons d’appliquer cette regle de redondance est source de stabilité et sécurité (comme en avion ou les circuits sont doublés ou triplés !!!)

 

Vous pouvez voirla VIDEOdu BASSIN DU LOTUS- BUT DELA CAMPAGNE ici. En anglais (tres facile !)

 

Un bref historique :

En 2008 nous avons reçu l’EAU de la commune, mais comme tous les étés la sécheresse impose des restrictions, l’eau est souvent coupée, et si elle ne l’est pas, l’arrosage est de toutes façons interdit.

C’est pourquoi nous avons fait un forage qui a donné de l’eau vers80 m. L’eau est belle et abondante même en fin d’été, en revanche elle est souvent SALEE et impropre a l’arrosage..

Cela fait donc déja 2 sources pour l’EAU 

La troisiéme sera la PLUIE.

En effet dans cette région méditerrrannéenne qui souffre de sécheresse tous les étés, en fait il pleut .. plus qu’en Bretagne ! mais les pluies ne tombent (de façon torrentielle) que durant les 4 mois d’hiver.

C’est pourquoi il faut un RESERVOIR pour COLLECTER cette eau et l’utiliser durant l’été.

Ainsi nous avons creusé le BASSIN DU LOTUS également en 2008.

A la fois pour recueillir l’EAU DE PLUIE, mais aussi pour permettre a l’EAU DU FORAGE (tirée avec une pompe électrique) de REPOSER a l’air et de se mélanger a l’eau de pluie ainsi perdant sa salinité.

N’ayant rien trouvé de mieux, nous avons d’abord opté pour une bache de plastique afin de couvrir l’intérieur du bassin qui a ainsi fonctionné trés bien .. seulement Un an !! le plastique s’est retrouvé perforé en mille endroits.. probablement par le soleil, le vent , et surtout .. les petits  chats !! :o))

C’est pourquoi cette fois nous sommes décidés a mettre un revêtement DURABLE, ECOLOGIQUE, SAIN et c’est l’EPDM Géomembrane qui nous a été conseillée par tous les amis qui sont dans le milieu..

Alors tout s’est enchainé trés vite..

Curieusement alors que nous cherchions sans rien trouver depuis des mois, une compagnie de pose d’EPDM a surgi , basée a Antalya (tout prés) , acceptant de faire le travail rapidement AVANT L’ETE.

Et SURTOUT SENSIBLE ALA SITUATION FINANCIERE DIFFICILE DE LA FERME, LE MANAGER DE LA COMPAGNIE A ACCEPTE UN PETIT ACOMPTE SEULEMENT (correspondant aux donations reçues) ET ATTENDRA LA FIN DE LA COLLECTE POUR RECEVOIR LE SOLDE !!!

Le patron de cette compagnie, Monsieur Aziz Icke m'a dit être "Touché" par le projet de la ferme Yunus Emre, c'est pourquoi ce geste.

Vous pouvez voir la seconde video sur le travail réalisé – la premiere partie : ICI

Ce travail est une premiere partie en effet les BORDURES restent a aggrandir et fixer. Ceci se fera avant l’hiver.

 

Le cout total de cette étanchéité sera entre 4200 / 4600 USD ( équivalent a 3200 /3600 €) l’incertitude restant a cause de la bordure non terminée.

Afin de couvrir les taxes et frais de cette campagne ... nous avons du poser l’objectif a 5000 USD soit 3800 € 

C’est une somme trés importante pour la ferme Yunus Emre.. et probablement pour la plupart d’entre nous ! Mais avec un tel revêtement qui est garanti 20 ans... le bassin du Lotus pourra remplir ses multi fonctions durant beaucoup plus que 20 ans ....

Et sera un vrai bassin permaculture permettant de :

-- RECUEILLIR ET STOCKER L’EAU DE PLUIE

-- STOCKER L’EAU DU FORAGE POUR QU’ELLE REPOSE ET PERDE SA SALINITE

-- ARROSER LES JARDINS DES DEUX TERRAINS DELA FERME

-- ETRE UN ABRI DE VIE AQUATIQUE (plantes poissons grenouilles ...)

-- SERVIR DE RESERVOIR D EAU CONTRE LE FEU

-- ET DE BASSIN DE BAIGNADE POUR LES ENFANTS !! (et peut etre aussi pour les grands ! :o)


‘C’est donc un important INVESTISSEMENT que ce BASSIN DU LOTUS, et nous comptons sur VOUS TOUS pour nous aider a rendrela FermeYunusEmre autonome au niveau de l’EAU, capable d’approvisionner toutes les plantations en eau, et espérons de devenir une OASIS de verdure qui apportera des BIENFAITS et ABONDANCE a chacun :o)

Si toutefois le but final (5000 USD – 3800 €) n’était pas atteint, nous utiliserions l’argent récolter pour payer ce que nous pourrons payer, et si besoin emprunterons a d’autres sources.. et peut etre même des banques ... (pas glop.. :o(  .. ou alors nous organiserons une autre campagne pour finir de payer.

JE VEUX RESTER RESOLUMENT POSITIVE ET CROIRE A VOTRE SOUTIEN ET VOTRE AIDE.

----------------------------------------------------------------------- 

VOICI LES DIFFERENTS MOYENS DE NOUS AIDER :  (Car il n’y a pas qu’avec l’argent !)

 

Apport financier en fonction de vos possibilités .. quoi que vous pourrez donner sera réellement BIENVENU !  (même 5 ou 10 euros !)

 

TRANSMETTRE – PARTAGER – FAIRE CONNAITRE : C’est aussi un moyen trés important en ce que d’une part cela permet a plus de gens de connaitre la ferme et sa situation périlleuse ( !) – en cela n’HESITEZ pas a transmettre.. faire connaitre .. rappellez vous toujours que LES GENS AIMENT AIDER . :o)

"La Générosité apporte le bonheur a toutes les étapes de son expression.

Nous ressentons de la Joie lorsque nous formons l'INTENTION d'être généreux,

Nous ressentons de la Joie dans l'ACTION d'Être généreux,

Nous ressentons de la Joie dans le SOUVENIR D'Avoir été généreux."

                             --- Bouddha --

Et l’autre aspect est que cela augmente le taux d’activité du site de la campagne (qui est appelé « gogofactor ») et qui permet d’avoir une meilleure PROMOTION de la campagne auprés des médias et autres sites...

INVESTISSEMENT PERSONNEL: Vous pourrez voir plus bas que différents niveaux de participation sont proposés, depuis le “volontariat” jusqu’au “partenariat” ou “volontaire avancé” ... ainsi il y a beaucoup de façons d’aider..

Et si vous avez d’AUTRES IDEES, n’hésitez pas a nous les faire connaitre, nous sommes ouverts a toutes discussions échanges partages..

 

CADEAUX ("perks")

 

Il y a un proverbe Chinois qui dit:

« si tu veux vivre heureux, proméne toi avec deux sacs. L’un pour donner, l’autre pour recevoir. »

Ainsi, si vous donnez quelque chose a la ferme, c’est certain vous allez aussi RECEVOIR.

Et les détails sur les cadeaux qui vous seront offerts sont plus bas sous la rubrique « PERKS » aussi en français.

Ceci dit un « perk » n’est pas explicité : c’est ce que vous sentirez dans votre COEUR : car en DONNANT, en fait on RECOIT.

 

LES SUPPORTERS DE LA FERME YUNUS EMRE

Certains des supporters ont bien voulu effectuer l’inscription dans l’EQUIPE de cette campagne, les autres restent plus discrets mais ont quand même accepté de voir leurs noms figurer dans la liste qui s'allonge presque tous les jours :o))... (merci a vous TOUS .. )

story_txt:
Welcome to the Yunus Emre farm ! Bienvenue a la Ferme Yunus Emre ! Yunus Emre ciftligi'ne Hosh Geldiniz ! ..
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TEXTE EN FRANCAIS APRES LE TEXTE EN ANGLAIS - PLUS BAS :O))))) .
 ------------------------------------------------------------
THE FARM
 
Situated in South Turkey, in the Mediterrannean area, in the country of Mevlana – Sufi master, the farm is a3 hectare wide space dedicated to NATURE.
 
It aims at experiencing and sharing the Ancient Knowlege of Yoga, as well as the powerful tools of Permaculture.
 
So like this you may come to the Yunus Emre farm for a Satyananda Yoga seminar,(next in MAY-  HERE)  for a yogic retreat (see HERE) .. you may also come for a Permaculture design course.(next in OCTOBER)
You may join the life of the farm as a volunteer, helping learning and sharing ...(info HERE)
You may also organise your own yoga seminar in the Yunus Emre farm. (see the flyer in the Gallery "Guest seminars" or here Guest Seminar )
 
Whatever the case there will always be Yogic Ecological practices like Havan, ancient fire ceremony, Chanting of Maha mrityun jaya mantra the “HEALING” mantra which provides healing energy for the benefit of all beings, for these  very practices attune our vibrations to the Cosmic vibrations, allowing harmony and peace in our entire being.
 
So Yunus Emre farm is a place where you can really experience INNER PEACE, as well as learn powerful tools which will help you to keep this positive healing ENERGY in your own life.
(A lot of pics may be found also in the GALLERY showing the farm from the very beginnings until now :o))
Yunus Emre farm aims at giving a CHANCE FOR EVOLUTION and is specially dedicate to the FUTURE GENERATIONS who will have to manage the world tomorrow.
 Here is an article by Theresa Day in TODAY ZAMAN in 2010 at the beginnings of the farm- things have evolved - but the spirit of the project remains same
 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
THE AIM OF THIS CAMPAIGN
 
It concerns the LOTUS POND, our WATER RESERVOIR.
As a permaculture farm, the Yunus Emre farm’s design is based on permaculture, and according to permaculture, each important energy should be supplied by at least 2 sources, even 3.
 
Now we are trying to finalise the WATER subject.
 
See the “LOTUS POND” VIDEO HERE
 
In 2008 we received drinkable water from the village, but as there is shortage every summer this water is not allowed for watering.
So we digged a drilling and  found good amount of water, however this water revealed to be salty from time to time.
On the other hand another important source of water is simply RAIN.
In this area the annual amount of rain is superior to that of UK !!!!  BUT rain only falls (heavily) during 4 months in winter.
So we had to find a way to HARVEST and STORE this rain.
 
That is where the LOTUS POND came.
Digged also in 2008, it would be the perfect tool both to HARVEST RAIN WATER, and to provide a POOL for DRILLING WATER to REST and MIX with rain water thus becoming proper for watering.
 
Yet the Lotus pond remained empty during 2 years because we could not find any proper solution to cover the inside.
Finally, we put a “nylon” as we say in Turkey, a big large plastic, because it was cheap and quickly done.
Of course .. unfortunately it didnt last much ...
After only one year, the plastic revealed to be torn everywhere... Probably due to burning sun, strong winds, and ... lovely cats :o))
 
So this time, we searched eventually  a durable, sustainable and ecological solution for the LOTUS POND.
 
And we found the EPDM – Geomembrane as a very much reliable material.
Totally ecological, sun and heat resistant, very solid and durable, it appeared to the BEST solution.
 
And we have been very pleased when a good company based in Antalya accepted to do the work in very convenient conditions:
Bringing the material, covering the pond with it, fixing everything as it has to be, (it needs real professionnal people for such a work)  finally delivering a “fully ready water pond” in a 3- 4 day work.
And most of all, the company’s manager accepted to complete the work in the next weeks, with ONLY A SMALL DEPOSIT.... the remaining money being given .. on the completion of this campaign ! (25 JUNE dead line)
 
So you see how precious will be YOUR HELP and SUPPORT.
 
The cost of the work should be between 4200 / 4600 USD.
The farm's financial situation does not allow such an expense yet. Although it starts to bring some little incomes, the farm is not yet self sustainable financially speaking..
That is why we searched for FUNDING solutions and STARTED THIS CAMPAIGN
Aiming at raising an amount of 5000 USD to cover all expenses related to the LOTUS POND's LAST STEP .... 
 
We do COUNT ON YOUR SUPPORT to help the LOTUS POND to be FINALISED and fullfill its multi functions, like a good “permaculture pond” should do:
 
-- Water harvesting – Rain (may be up to1200 mm/ year – on the pond’s surface of around 100 m2: it may bring 120 tons of good rain water)
-- Water storage- Rain water and Drilling water will be mixed so that drilling water looses it salinity and rests under the sky and open air
-- Watering of the fields- for the time being around 700 plants have been planted in both Moon and Sun gardens. The uphill position of the reservoir allows watering of most of them by GRAVITY thus saving energy.
-- Shelter for life- As soon as possible we shall try to put water –plants in the pond, both to create LIFE and to provide SHADE thus limit evaporation.
-- Fire fighting reservoir- The farm being surrounded by pine tree forest the area in summer is highly fire sensitive... the forest road to the pond must always be open .. just in case ..
-- Pool for kids- why not to let kid have some fun and play in water at some stage .. (maybe grown ups too ! )
 
So we all COUNT ON YOUR HELP to finalise this last step and have a proper WATER RESERVOIR lasting many many many years, (20 year garanty :o)) providing WATER for many many many plants trees bushes, allow the Yunus Emre farm to become a green oasis providing ABUNDANCE TO ALL.
 
If however the total goal of the campaign would not be reached, we would still pay the works with the available money and borrow from other sources, even from banks :o(   if mandatory ... and maybe organise another campaign to finish to pay.
 
I am thinking totally POSITIVELY and want to believe YOUR WILL HELP US.
 
MANY WAYS YOU CAN HELP
 
Financial support:
according to your possibilities, whatever you can give will be MORE THAN WELCOME.
 
Transmitting, sharing:
the more people know about the Yunus Emre farm’s water pond, the BETTER .. and if you write a note to your friends, relatives, collegues then it will definitely HELP A LOT
 
Personal involvement:
in addition you may wish to help the farm by involving your self in it in a way that would suit your capacities, preferences, ambitions, etc...
Examples:
-- VOLUNTEERING: nice way to share the life in the farm by helping and learning, giving and receiving
-- ADVANCED VOLUNTEERING: lets say you have come for volunteering and you like so much the project that you feel like joining us .. this is also possible and of course would have to be discussed in "live"..
-- PARTNERSHIP: again . .lets say you have come here and found the place, the project and activities so wonderful that you wish to CREATE something HERE TOO, to REALISE YOUR OWN PROJECT here, well .. this could be also possible either in the farm itself (renting a part of the fields of ex) or in the neighborhood ... . there is a HUGE potential in this region , we just have to be CREATIVE, POSITIVE, INVENTIV, and Permaculture and Yoga's tools may HELP us a LOT in creating a beautiful community ...
For all these suggestions of course .. contact us.. come and we talk !! 
Discussions are OPEN .. and we are happy to study any  case, and talk with you any time about any idea you may have :o)
 
PERKS
 
There is a Chinese saying iike:
“if you want to live happy, walk with 2 bags: one to give, one to receive”
So likewise you will maybe give something to the farm, and for sure you will also RECEIVE.
Detais about the perks are below.
One perk however is not mentionned, it is the one you will feel in your HEART.
Because BY GIVING we actually RECEIVE.
            "Generosity brings happiness at every stage of its expression.              We experience joy in forming the intention to be generous.                 We experience joy in the actual act of giving something.                    And we experience joy in remembering the fact that we have given."                                       -The Buddha

----------------------------------------------------------------- ICI EN FRANCAIS-----VERSION ACTUALISEE AU 8 MAI 2012------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Bienvenue a la ferme Yunus Emre !
LA FERME
Située dans le sud de la Turquie, en région méditerrannéenne, dans le pays de Mevlana. Maître Soufi- createur des Derviches Tourneurs.
La ferme est un espace de 3 hectares dédicacés a la NATURE. 
Son rôle est d’offrir la possibilité de vivre et de partagerla Connaissance du Yoga, ainsi que les outils puissants dela Permaculture.
Ainsi vous pouvez venir a la ferme Yunus Emre pour un Séminaire de Satyananda Yoga (prochain trés bientot avec Sannyasis Atmatattwa et Brahmananda ICI) , pour une retraite « style de vie yoguique » (infos ICI) , aussi pour un cours de Design permaculture (PDC)(prochain en Octobre avec Saviana Parodi- ICI)
Vous pouvez également passer quelques jours ou plus en tant que volontaire, apprenant, partageant, échangeant avec nous l’expérience de la vie a la ferme Yunus Emre (voir les infos ICI)
Vous pouvez aussi organiser votre Propre Séminaire de Yoga, venir avec votre groupe.(voir documentation sur la ferme et info Séminaires invités ICI)
 
Quelle que soit la situation il y aura toujours les pratiques de l’écologie du Yoga, telles que le HAVAN – Ancienne cérémonie du FEU, le Chant du Mahamrityunjaya mantra, le Mantra qui guérit, apportant énergie bienfaisante a tous les êtres... Ceci car ces pratiques véritablement accordent notre être vibratoire aux vibrations Cosmiques, créant ainsi  l’harmonie et la paix dans tout notre être.
 
C’est pourquoi la ferme Yunus Emre est un lieu oula PAIX INTERIEURE peut être réellement ressentie, vécue. De plus on y apprend des techniques puisantes qui permettent de maintenir cette bonne énergie et une positivité inébranlable dans notre vie de tous les jours.
 
La ferme Yunus Emre est un lieu qui donne une CHANCE POUR L’EVOLUTION et est dédiée aux GENERATIONS FUTURES qui devront gérer le monde de demain.
 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
LE BUT DE CETTE CAMPAGNE
 
C’est la finalisation du bassin du LOTUS, notre réservoir d’EAU.
Dans une ferme PERMACULTURE,et  la ferme Yunus Emre est  conçue selon la permaculture,  chaque énergie importante ( et l’EAU VITALE en est vraiment une ! ) devrait être fournie par au moins 2 voire 3 sources.
Ainsi nous essayons d’appliquer cette regle de redondance est source de stabilité et sécurité (comme en avion ou les circuits sont doublés ou triplés !!!)
 
Vous pouvez voirla VIDEOdu BASSIN DU LOTUS- BUT DELA CAMPAGNE ici. En anglais (tres facile !)
 
Un bref historique :
En 2008 nous avons reçu l’EAU de la commune, mais comme tous les étés la sécheresse impose des restrictions, l’eau est souvent coupée, et si elle ne l’est pas, l’arrosage est de toutes façons interdit.
C’est pourquoi nous avons fait un forage qui a donné de l’eau vers80 m. L’eau est belle et abondante même en fin d’été, en revanche elle est souvent SALEE et impropre a l’arrosage..
Cela fait donc déja 2 sources pour l’EAU 
La troisiéme sera la PLUIE.
En effet dans cette région méditerrrannéenne qui souffre de sécheresse tous les étés, en fait il pleut .. plus qu’en Bretagne ! mais les pluies ne tombent (de façon torrentielle) que durant les 4 mois d’hiver.
C’est pourquoi il faut un RESERVOIR pour COLLECTER cette eau et l’utiliser durant l’été.
Ainsi nous avons creusé le BASSIN DU LOTUS également en 2008.
A la fois pour recueillir l’EAU DE PLUIE, mais aussi pour permettre a l’EAU DU FORAGE (tirée avec une pompe électrique) de REPOSER a l’air et de se mélanger a l’eau de pluie ainsi perdant sa salinité.
N’ayant rien trouvé de mieux, nous avons d’abord opté pour une bache de plastique afin de couvrir l’intérieur du bassin qui a ainsi fonctionné trés bien .. seulement Un an !! le plastique s’est retrouvé perforé en mille endroits.. probablement par le soleil, le vent , et surtout .. les petits  chats !! :o))
C’est pourquoi cette fois nous sommes décidés a mettre un revêtement DURABLE, ECOLOGIQUE, SAIN et c’est l’EPDM Géomembrane qui nous a été conseillée par tous les amis qui sont dans le milieu..
Alors tout s’est enchainé trés vite..
Curieusement alors que nous cherchions sans rien trouver depuis des mois, une compagnie de pose d’EPDM a surgi , basée a Antalya (tout prés) , acceptant de faire le travail rapidement AVANT L’ETE.
Et SURTOUT SENSIBLE ALA SITUATION FINANCIERE DIFFICILE DE LA FERME, LE MANAGER DE LA COMPAGNIE A ACCEPTE UN PETIT ACOMPTE SEULEMENT (correspondant aux donations reçues) ET ATTENDRA LA FIN DE LA COLLECTE POUR RECEVOIR LE SOLDE !!!
Le patron de cette compagnie, Monsieur Aziz Icke m'a dit être "Touché" par le projet de la ferme Yunus Emre, c'est pourquoi ce geste.
Vous pouvez voir la seconde video sur le travail réalisé – la premiere partie : ICI
Ce travail est une premiere partie en effet les BORDURES restent a aggrandir et fixer. Ceci se fera avant l’hiver.
 
Le cout total de cette étanchéité sera entre 4200 / 4600 USD ( équivalent a 3200 /3600 €) l’incertitude restant a cause de la bordure non terminée.
Afin de couvrir les taxes et frais de cette campagne ... nous avons du poser l’objectif a 5000 USD soit 3800 € 
C’est une somme trés importante pour la ferme Yunus Emre.. et probablement pour la plupart d’entre nous ! Mais avec un tel revêtement qui est garanti 20 ans... le bassin du Lotus pourra remplir ses multi fonctions durant beaucoup plus que 20 ans ....
Et sera un vrai bassin permaculture permettant de :
-- RECUEILLIR ET STOCKER L’EAU DE PLUIE
-- STOCKER L’EAU DU FORAGE POUR QU’ELLE REPOSE ET PERDE SA SALINITE
-- ARROSER LES JARDINS DES DEUX TERRAINS DELA FERME
-- ETRE UN ABRI DE VIE AQUATIQUE (plantes poissons grenouilles ...)
-- SERVIR DE RESERVOIR D EAU CONTRE LE FEU
-- ET DE BASSIN DE BAIGNADE POUR LES ENFANTS !! (et peut etre aussi pour les grands ! :o)

‘C’est donc un important INVESTISSEMENT que ce BASSIN DU LOTUS, et nous comptons sur VOUS TOUS pour nous aider a rendrela FermeYunusEmre autonome au niveau de l’EAU, capable d’approvisionner toutes les plantations en eau, et espérons de devenir une OASIS de verdure qui apportera des BIENFAITS et ABONDANCE a chacun :o)
Si toutefois le but final (5000 USD – 3800 €) n’était pas atteint, nous utiliserions l’argent récolter pour payer ce que nous pourrons payer, et si besoin emprunterons a d’autres sources.. et peut etre même des banques ... (pas glop.. :o(  .. ou alors nous organiserons une autre campagne pour finir de payer.
JE VEUX RESTER RESOLUMENT POSITIVE ET CROIRE A VOTRE SOUTIEN ET VOTRE AIDE.
----------------------------------------------------------------------- 
VOICI LES DIFFERENTS MOYENS DE NOUS AIDER :  (Car il n’y a pas qu’avec l’argent !)
 
Apport financier en fonction de vos possibilités .. quoi que vous pourrez donner sera réellement BIENVENU !  (même 5 ou 10 euros !)
 
TRANSMETTRE – PARTAGER – FAIRE CONNAITRE : C’est aussi un moyen trés important en ce que d’une part cela permet a plus de gens de connaitre la ferme et sa situation périlleuse ( !) – en cela n’HESITEZ pas a transmettre.. faire connaitre .. rappellez vous toujours que LES GENS AIMENT AIDER . :o)
"La Générosité apporte le bonheur a toutes les étapes de son expression.
Nous ressentons de la Joie lorsque nous formons l'INTENTION d'être généreux,
Nous ressentons de la Joie dans l'ACTION d'Être généreux,
Nous ressentons de la Joie dans le SOUVENIR D'Avoir été généreux."
                             --- Bouddha --
Et l’autre aspect est que cela augmente le taux d’activité du site de la campagne (qui est appelé « gogofactor ») et qui permet d’avoir une meilleure PROMOTION de la campagne auprés des médias et autres sites...
INVESTISSEMENT PERSONNEL: Vous pourrez voir plus bas que différents niveaux de participation sont proposés, depuis le “volontariat” jusqu’au “partenariat” ou “volontaire avancé” ... ainsi il y a beaucoup de façons d’aider..
Et si vous avez d’AUTRES IDEES, n’hésitez pas a nous les faire connaitre, nous sommes ouverts a toutes discussions échanges partages..
 
CADEAUX ("perks")
 
Il y a un proverbe Chinois qui dit:
« si tu veux vivre heureux, proméne toi avec deux sacs. L’un pour donner, l’autre pour recevoir. »
Ainsi, si vous donnez quelque chose a la ferme, c’est certain vous allez aussi RECEVOIR.
Et les détails sur les cadeaux qui vous seront offerts sont plus bas sous la rubrique « PERKS » aussi en français.
Ceci dit un « perk » n’est pas explicité : c’est ce que vous sentirez dans votre COEUR : car en DONNANT, en fait on RECOIT.

story:
The idea started when i found my self on the group of people who where fired  from the telecommunication Industry in order to lower the operational costs of the company. Considering the economic situation in Greece and my future, i had the idea to make products, that will be used easily and will contain herbs you find in Greece and which were used from my grandmother us folk medicine. In order to achieve this goal i started a company with a friend (Hippocrates Medicine Private Company) and start our first cultivation of Saint john Wort plant. Until now we have two fields on which we cultivate 22.000 plants under the guideline of organization (ΔΗΩ) in order to be able to certify it as biological, following  cultivation methods friendly to the environment.

Except the cultivation of the specific herb we want to cultivate other 8 herbs (you can see them in our website) and we have started to make our production line at a warehouse we rent.

Finally we have invest until know around 18.000 euros and we need approximately 40.000 more in order to buy the equipments we need for the production line and take the ISO 22000 certificate for the production line.

You can have an idea for who we are also by visiting www.hippocratesmedicine.com which is our site and at this point give professional information about the herbs we refer. Check the "ways to work with us" which is an idea of expanding and helping new farmers work if the demand of out products tend to grow.
Check also our blog to see health topics about several issues and visit our photo calendar so you can be updated about our work.

story:
My name is Teresa Albano and I am a co-editor of PeoplesWorld.org, a daily news website that provides analysis and reporting of under-reported stories of everyday people working together to make the world a better, more just and safer place for all. 

That’s why peoplesworld.org will be on the scene in Paris to cover the United Nations historic climate change summit, and we want to bring you with us.

Climate change and Paris attacks are two topics dominating the news and intersect in surprising ways. Bernie Sanders aptly connected terrorism and global warming, saying at the recent Democratic debate: “If we do not get our act together and listen to what the scientists say … you’re going to see all kinds of international conflict.” 

President Obama and other heads of state will be there, as will an estimated 40,000 environmental activists, trade unionists, scientists, doctors, and others who represent civil society from every continent. Peoplesworld.org will be there too.

We need $6,000 to offset the cost of sending two seasoned journalists - myself and Blake Deppe to Paris from Nov. 29-Dec. 7. You will hear and read the the stories of everyday people working to put people and the planet before profits. You will get information and unique analysis. You will be able to read, tweet, like, listen and watch the takeaway from Paris. 

Peoplesworld.org seeks to bring the social justice, activist-journalist tradition of The Daily Worker and other socialist and working-class oriented publications to a new media and technology savvy audience. 

With a small staff, a scrappy network of volunteers and more than 90 years of advocacy journalism behind us, peoplesworld.org is recognized as a force on the labor and progressive media scene, winning awards for reporting and editorial content. 

(To read one of the 2015 award-winning stories, "New generation finds its voice and power in Ferguson, Mo.", check out: http://peoplesworld.org/new-generation-finds-its-voice-and-power-in-ferguson-mo/)

People’s World does not receive corporate cash and relies solely on the generosity of readers and those who support labor-oriented, progressive social justice news and views. You can join our growing team of supporters with your donation and bring us to a new level of recognition and influence.

Strapped for cash? Help get the word out about the campaign by sharing with your friends and family through social media. See you in Paris!


P.S. Read Blake's blog on the upcoming trip "En voyageant: France, je viens ici,"

and don't forget - each level of giving brings these additional rewards:


The People's World: $1 and up
·  Public acknowledgement on the People’s World website and Facebook Page 

TROPOSPHERE: $15 and up

·  Public acknowledgement on the People’s World website and Facebook Page

·  Exclusive access to COP21 coverage by People’s World editor Teresa Albano and staff writer Blake Deppe

STRATOSPHERE: $100 and up

·  Public acknowledgement for your donation

·  Exclusive access to coverage

·  Souvenir ‘SWAG’ from the conference (buttons, stickers, and anything else our staff can get their hands on for you!)

MESOSPHERE: $250 and up 

·  Public acknowledgement for your substantial donation

·  Exclusive access to coverage

·  Souvenir from the conference

·  People’s World reporters Teresa Albano and Blake Deppe will bring YOUR specific    question or concern with them to the conference for special coverage

THERMOSPHERE: $500 and away!

·  Public acknowledgement for your out-of-this-world donation

·  Exclusive access to coverage

·  A special gift from Paris

·  Coverage of your important question or concern

·  A feature article about YOU and your CLIMATE ACTION in People’s World!

·  A special gift from Paris
·  Coverage of your important question or concern
·  A feature article about YOU and your CLIMATE ACTION in People’s World!

story:
3,000-year-old petroglyphs in the Bishop Volcanic Tablelands were cut out of lava formations with power saws and stolen. 

This is disgusting and the people who did this should be caught. The Bureau of Land Management and the Paiute tribal leaders are investigating. Currently the reward is at $2000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the thieves. 

The Bishop Paiutes have put in $1000 and the BLM has put in another $1000. We would like to increase this reward through our donations.

Rock Climbers: let's show we care and increase this reward. Help Save and Protect the petroglyphs in the Bishop Volacanic Tablelands.

According to the LA Times:

http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-petrogl...

"at least four petroglyphs have been taken from the site. A fifth was defaced with deep saw cuts on three sides. A sixth had been removed and broken during the theft, then propped against a boulder near a visitor parking lot.

Dozens of other petroglyphs were scarred by hammer strikes and saw cuts.

"The individuals who did this were not surgeons, they were smashing and grabbing," U.S. Bureau of Land Management archaeologist Greg Haverstock said last week as he examined the damage. "This was the worst act of vandalism ever seen" on the 750,000 acres of public land managed by the BLM field office in Bishop.

The theft required extraordinary effort: Ladders, electric generators and power saws had to be driven into the remote and arid high desert site near Bishop. Thieves gouged holes in the rock and sheared off slabs that were up to 15 feet above ground and 2 feet high and wide."

 

What happens if the fund is not called upon?

You have the choice to specifiy where you would like YOUR money to go if this fund is not called upon (i.e. the thieves are convicted without the use of this reward or there are no arrests made) 

1.  Interpretive programs showing how the damage has affected the site (through the BLM)

2.  An “adopt a camera” program for surveillance of the site, (through the BLM)

3.  Stewardship training and volunteer opportunities at the site. (through the BLM)
 
4.  The Access Fund in Conjuction with the Paiute Tribe's Historic Preservation division:http://www.bishoppaiutetribe.com/historicpreservation.html
 
 
(when you make the donation, you should be able to write in your choice (a number from above) in the area where it asks for a specific name.  If you'd prefer, you could also leave it in the comment section.. (you can do this as a private comment) If you do not specify, it will go to number 4. 
 
 
Thank You for caring!

story:
****Thank you to everyone who donated****

THE END DATE FOR THIS FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN WAS APRIL 22

HOWEVER YOU CAN STILL DONATE AT RUNFORTHESOL.COM

PLEASE BE SURE TO PUT THE WORDS "SOLAR PROJECT" NEXT TO YOUR LAST NAME IF THE DONATION IS GOING TOWARD THE SOLAR PANEL FUND INSTEAD OF TOWARD RACE REGISTRATION 

 

 

 

ECO Club

The Environmental Change Organization (ECO Club) is a student run club affiliated with Portsmouth High School, in Portsmouth, New Hampshire.  The club's mission is to work as a group to create a more sustainable school and community.  Fueled by the power of over 50 students, we have embarked on our most ambitious endeavor to date: to install solar panels at the high school.  The ultimate goal of our club is to create a healthy, high performance environment that can serve as a model for other schools in New Hampshire. 

Donations and Benefits

We need at least $5,000.00 to launch our effort.  When we meet this goal, installation of solar panels will begin. Our hope is for installation to start on Earth Day (April 22nd) 2013.

The Sell-A-Cell program will start with a Kick-Off on January 29th at FlatBread Pizza Company in Portsmouth, N.H.

We are asking for $5.00 donations, the equaivalent of one cell of a solar panel. Individuals who purchase a panel for $300.00 will receive recogniction, as their names will be placed on the panel!

You may purchase as many cells or panels as you wish!  

Purchase 5 cells and we will send you an eco-friendly shopping bag and we will send you a t-shirt designed by our very own Portsmouth High School Students.

For everyone who contributes, no matter how big or how small, we will be sending you a certificate in the mail.  You will also have the satisfaction of knowing that you helped work toward a more sustainable future.

The Impact

The ECO Club has been working deligently toward reaching its goal for over five years. By contributing to this cause, YOU are helping all of us cut down on the use of fossil fuels.  This is a project that will continue to grow and raise awareness about the use of renewable resources. Please help us bring Solar Energy to Portsmouth High School!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please like us on Facebook at facebook.com/ECOClubPHS or follow us at @PHSECO to learn more about our upcoming events and our relentless pursuit of becoming a more sustainable school community.
